loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es soltera no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe junto a sus padres Carolina trabaja como ayudante de cocina  y quiere un credito para comprar una maquina que le permita cocinar pollos broaster de esa manera podra empezar su propio negocio Carolina es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Carolina is single and does not have any children. She lives in El Alto in a house made of adobe together with her parents. Carolina works as a cooking assistant and wants a loan to buy a machine that will allow her to cook roasted chicken. In that way she will be able to start her own business. Carolina is the only source of income in her house, so she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a machine that will allow her to cook roasted chicken.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Âgée de 43 ans,Adjo est revendeuse depuis les années 2000.Mariée a un bijoutier, Adjo est une maman d un enfant.Elle mène son commerce de manière ambulante et ce premier crédit  servira a renforcer son commerce.Les revenus de son commerce serviront a  épargner pour payer les études supérieures de son enfant et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille,
texts.en:
Aged 43, Adjo has been a retailer since the years 2000. Married to a jeweler, Adjo is the mother of one child.

She has been running her business as an itinerant vendor and this first loan will serve to strengthen her business.

Profits from her business will be put into savings, to ensure higher education for their child, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy clothes

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora was born in 1964. She is married and bringing up three children. One of her children is not yet an adult. Gulnora has been busy selling vegetables in a local market for more than 17 years. She sells fresh vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. Her working day begins early in the morning. She works eight hours in a day. Gulnora is the main breadwinner of her family as her husband is a migrant in Russia. Gulnora is going to increase her working capital and maximize her profit. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy vegetables to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tomas Paulino

texts.es: Tomas es un señor que vive solo debido a que tiene que viajar de un lado a otro, actualmente es guardia de seguridad y comenta que su  madre es pobre y que por este motivo Tomas tuvo que salir de su casa desde que tenía 13 años a trabajar en una panadería y de ahí en diferentes trabajos  que se le han venido presentando, Tomas también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos que los deja al cuidado de su madre hasta que Tomas llegue a su casa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Tomas aspira mejorar su negocio y de ahí ayudarle a su madre en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Tomas is a man that lives alone since he has to travel from place to place. Today he is a security guard and says that his mother is poor and for this reason Tomas had to start leaving the house at the age of 13 years old to work in a bakery and from there different jobs that presented themselves. Tomas also raises pigs for a living, that he leaves in the care of his mother when he is away. The loan will go to invest in the purchase of pigs. Tomas aspires to improve his business and in this way help his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient and readily available cooking energy from Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be operating the business in a temporary structure. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
En 2010, Kodjo aujourd’hui  âgé de 33 ans ouvre  son commerce de boissons dans la ville de Lomé. Homme marie et père d un enfant, son accueil  fait grandir sa  clientèle, et pour cela, il voudrait plus tard agrandir son activité.
Quatorze ans de travail lui font solliciter un troisième  crédit de 300000FCFA auprès des bénévoles de Kiva, il souhaiterait développer son affaire  en achetant des produits de la brasserie   pour augmenter le stock présent.   Soucieux de l’avenir de son enfant de 6 ans, Kodjo s’efforce par son travail de lui offrir le meilleur.
texts.en:
Kodjo, who is 33 today, opened his beverage shop in 2010 in the city of Lomé. A married man and father of one child, his welcoming attitude has grown his customer base, and for that he wants to expand his activity.

After fourteen years of work he is requesting a third loan of 300,000 CFA francs from Kiva lenders. He would like to expand his business by buying products from the brewery to increase his current stock supply.

Concerned about the future of his 6-year-old child, Kodjo strives through his work to provide him with the best.

loans.use: buy beverages from the brewery

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 54 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from food vending.

Emelia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de adobe en la que tambien viven sus padres Luis es albañil y quiere un credito para comprar un taladro  Luis es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Luis is single and does not have any children. He lives in El Alto in an adobe house in which is parents also live. Luis is a mason and wants a loan to buy a drill. Luis is the only source of income in his household so he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy a drill.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area good for the business and his primary customers are shops and supermarkets. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that the business requires a lot of energy. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more crates for bread distribution. His business goal is to own a pick-up for distribution within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more crates for bread distribution

loans.name: Marina Luz

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 47 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su familia. Tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor orgullo y por quienes ha luchado constantemente para poder brindarles un mejor futuro.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como empleada en una Tienda de Repuestos. Es una persona muy responsable y luchadora, siempre esforzándose en todo lo que hace.
Marina está agradecida con los prestamistas kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un juego de sala para su vivienda para que su familia pueda reunirse en los días de descanso y disfrutar juntos en familia. Con esto ella seguirá trabajando para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propio negocio”.
texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking woman. She is 47 years old and lives in the District of Calleria together with her family. She has 3 children that are her greatest pride and for whom she has constantly struggled to provide them a better future.
For many years she has worked as an employee of Tienda de Respuestos (Spare Parts Store). She is a very responsible and hardworking person. She always pushes herself in everything that she does.

Marina is grateful to the kiva lenders as with the support that they have provided she will be able to buy a living room set for her home so that her family can meet on days off and enjoy being together with family. With this she will continue working towards her great dream: "to have her own business".

loans.use: to buy a living room set.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
The group members all live in Teshie, a neighborhood of Accra, and they know each other as neighbors. They work as vendors selling palm oil, rice, spices, grocery, fish, vegetables and soft drinks. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana and are now on their seventh loan cycle. 

Doris is well known in the entire neighborhood as a vendor of high quality groceries and soft drinks. She plans to use her loan to buy groceries and soft drinks from the wholesale market in Accra. The groceries and soft drinks will be sold to customers and she promises to be ever ready to be a retailer to a customer base composed mainly of local people in her community. With this loan, Doris hopes to earn a good monthly revenue, which will be reinvested in her business. She is 42 years old and lives alone. The group needs a loan of GHS 5,500 in total to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy groceries and soft drinks from the wholesale market in Accra.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 30-year-old widowed mother of two. Nine years ago, her beloved husband passed away, leaving her alone with her precious children struggling to provide them with the necessary living needs. For this reason, she established her current children and women's clothes-selling business in addition to selling perfumes to increase her income.

Amal is a hard worker. Her loss gave her the necessary strength to stand still and work hard to support her family. She is taking on the role of both the caring mother and the supportive father.

Her business income isn't enough to expand her business and increase her capital, since she has living expenses to cover. So Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua was her only hope to take this step forward with a Youth loan that will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special summer released collection to attract new customers and increase her sales.
  
She hopes to be able to develop her business in a well-managed way to make sure that the acquired income is enough to cover her children's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy a special summer released collection of clothing to sell

loans.name: Godiano

texts.en: Godiano is a 44-year-old male who is married with five children, four of whom attend school. Godiano deals in the transportation business on a busy street and has a coffee business for additional income. He ventured into the business in order to pay school fees for his children. Godiano needs money to buy a motor vehicle for transportation. Educating his children is his dream despite the hardship of inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy a motor vehicle for transportation.

loans.name: Wijaya

texts.en:
Wijaya runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. He is also a private employee. Wijaya lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Wijaya is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Wijaya began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es: Ramiro es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Ramiro es empleado pero ha decidido pedir un prestamo para iniciar un taller de electronica Ramiro no tiene a nadie que le ayude
texts.en: Ramiro is single and doesn't have any children. He lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that he rents. Ramiro is employed but has decided to apply for a loan to start an electronics workshop. Ramiro has nobody to help him.

loans.use: to start an electronics workshop.

loans.name: Gloria Senaida

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive con su hijo de 3 años de edad y con sus padres, en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz, frejol y arveja. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus sembríos. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old, married and lives with her three-year-old son and her parents, in the La Palmira community in the Chillanes district of the Bolívar Province.

She is a member of the solidarity group LA PALMIRA and is located in the La Palmira community around 40 minutes from the cooperative's office, made up of 14 members all from the same community, who work in agriculture.

Gloria works in agriculture growing corn, beans and peas. She is applying for the loan to buy manure and fertilizers. She purchases these at the market in Chillanes. Her goal is to improve the production of her sown fields. Her challenge is the climate and the plagues in those fields. In her free time she likes to be with her children and practise sport.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es soltero no tiene hijos y vive solo en la ciudad de La Pazen en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Jose trabaja arreglando y haciendo zapatos y necesita un credito para comprar clefa, forros, cordones Ya que piensa incrementar su produccion de zapatos de mujer Jose no tiene a quien acudir
texts.en: Jose is single, has no children and lives in the city of La Paz in a brick and cement house that he rents. He works as a cobbler and needs a loan to buy glue, lining and shoelaces because he wants to increase production of women's shoes.  He has no one he can turn to.

loans.use: To buy glue, lining and shoelaces to increase his production of women's shoes.

loans.name: Paola Janhette

texts.es:
Paola es una joven emprendedora, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su familia. Es madre soltera pero eso no es un impedimento para que ella pueda salir adelante y brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija. Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja como Obrera en una empresa Agroforestal de la zona donde vive. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, con muchas ganas de sobresalir, trabajadora y amable.
Paola está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintar las paredes, arreglar el piso y comprar un juego de sala para que su familia pueda sentirse más cómoda en un grato ambiente familiar. Así ella seguirá luchando para más adelante cumplir u gran sueño: "Lograr tener su propio terreno para construir su casa propia".
texts.en:
Paola, 30, is a young entrepreneur who lives in the district of Calleria with her family.  She is a single mother but that does not keep her from getting ahead and offering her daughter a brighter future.  For over three years she has been working at an agroforestry company in the area where she lives.  The job is going well because she is very responsible, determined to get ahead, hard-working and kind.

Paola is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support she will be able to renovate her home by painting the walls, fixing the floor and buying a living room suite so her family has a more comfortable home atmosphere.  This will encourage her to continue her struggle to get ahead and meet her goal: "To buy her own land and build a house".

loans.use: To renovate her house for her family's safety.

loans.name: Delia Natividad

texts.es:
Delia tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 4 hijos de 12, 10. 7 y 4  años de edad en la comunidad la Palmira perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Delia se dedica a la agricultura, a la crianza de vacas y borregos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. Las compras realizan en el mercado de chillanes. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y al hogar.
texts.en:
Delia, 34, is single and lives with her parents and four siblings, ages 12, 10, 7 and 4, in the community of La Palmira in the Chillanes Canton, province of Bolivar.

She is a member of the communal bank LA PALMIRA which is about 40 minutes away from the co-op.  The group is comprised of 14 members from the same community who work in agriculture.

Delia works in agriculture and livestock (cattle and sheep) farming.  She is requesting a loan to buy livestock at the market in Chillanes.  Her goal is to improve animal sales.  The challenge she has is transportation.  In her free time she enjoys sports and caring for the home.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Dúo Nahomi Group

texts.es: Dúo Nahomi integrado por la señora Elba Ester, casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo es agente de seguridad para empresas privadas, doña Ester se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 3 años y empezó a vender serca de una iglesia y a sacar pedidos ahora la buscan y cada día vende comida pero solo pedidos  que le hacen sus clientes ella ya sabe cuánto va a vender cada día pues un día antes llama a sus clientes y les pregunta si van a querer comida o busca a nuevos para ofrecer sus productos, también vende postres como pasteles, donas y otros, su sueño es ayudar a su esposo para poder arreglar su vivienda y darle estudio a sus hijos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de insumos para elaborar comidas.
texts.en:
One of the members of the Dúo Nahomi Group is Elba Ester who is married and has four children.  Her husband is a security agent for a private company.  She has been selling food for three years and started out selling near a church and through orders.  Now she sells only on an order basis so she knows how much she sells daily.  Elba calls her customers to take orders or goes out seeking new customers for her products.  She also sells pastries and other food items.

Her goal is to help her husband renovate their house and provide their children with an education.  The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a food business.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno  vive en USA, una hija trabaja y la otra está estudiando en la universidad, con María solo viven sus hijos, tres nietos que le cuida a su hija y su esposo. 

María se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en la siembra de granos básicos un trabajo que le gusta mucho y que realiza desde hace unos 25 años, la otra fuente de ingresos son  las remesas que le envía su hijo de Estados Unidos, el lugar donde trabaja le queda a 5 minutos de su casa, no tiene que pagare bus si no que se moviliza a pie.

El préstamo que solicita a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar los materiales para mejorar la vivienda ya que está construyendo el área de cocina y no el suficiente dinero suficiente para comprar, de esta forma se le estará ayudando ya que no tendrá la preocupación de que se va a mojar cuando llueva, comprará 9 pliegos de lámina para ponerle al contorno de la cocina, también comprara 3 tramos de viga, clavos y pagará la mano de obra.

María pretende seguir trabajando apoyada por CrediCampo, y manifiesta que enseguida quiere seguir mejorando poco a poco la vivienda ya que quiere repellarla para que tenga una mejor presentación, por otra parte quiere poner el piso de ladrillo.
texts.en:
María and her partner are in agriculture for a living. She has three children of whom one lives in the USA, one daughter works, and the other is studying at college. With Maria live her children, three grandchildren in her daughter's care, and her husband.

María and her husband harvest basic grains for a living.She likes the work very much and has been doing it for some 25 years. The other source of income is remittances from her son in the United States. The place where she works is 5 minutes from home, so she doesn't have to pay for a bus and can go by foot.

The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo she needs to purchase materials to improve her housing as she is constructing a kitchen area and does not have enough money for purchasing. It will help so that she doesn't have the worry of getting wet when it rains. She will buy 9 sheets of laminate to outline the kitchen. She will also buy 3 rafters, nails and manual labor.

María intends to continue working supported by CrediCampo and states that she wants to continue improving and repairing her housing little by little as she wants to install a brick floor and improve its presentation.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve housing as she is constructing a kitchen area she will buy 9 laminate sheets to outline the kitchen, 3 flights of rafters, nails, and labor.

loans.name: Segundo Bolivar

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Segundo se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y la costumbre que más le gusta es el carnaval.
texts.en:
Segundo is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children aged 5 and 3. They live in La Palmira, which belongs to the Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.

Segundo is a member of the communal bank La Palmira, located in the community of La Palmira, about 40 minutes from the regional office. It has fourteen members, all from the same community, who work in agriculture.

Segundo grows food and raises pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea and fungicides with the objective to improve his produce. He will buy these supplies at the marketplace of Chillanes. His goal is to improve the quality of his plantations. Transportation is a big challenge for him. During his free time, he likes to play sports. The local tradition he likes the most is the carnival.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Víctor se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida y animales. La compra lo realiza en Chillanes. Su meta es comprarse un terreno. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Víctor is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the community of La Palmira, which belongs to the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.

He is a member of the communal bank La Palmira, located in the community of La Palmira, about fourty minutes from the regional office. It is comprised of fourteen members from the same community; all of them work in agriculture.

Víctor grows food and raises pigs. He is requesting a loan to buy compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea and fungicide, and also to buy animals. He will purchase these things in Chillanes. His goal is to buy a piece of land. His challenges are the weather conditions and the plagues that affect his crops. During his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 30-year-old married father of two. He is a Palestinian refugee who has lived and worked in a Palestinian camp since he was born. 

Just like almost all of the Palestinians who live in Lebanon, he has limited access to several working sectors. That's why at the beginning of his working career he used to work in furniture painting and making. However, four years ago, he turned to trading scrap, which he says provides his beloved family with a better income and standard of living.  

Since Rami is the family's sole earner, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy scrap to trade and sell.

Rami is working hard to continue building his family's house completely, and he might invest part of the loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy scrap to trade and sell.

loans.name: Kumrikhon

texts.en:
Kumrikhon is a hardworking woman from South Tajikistan. She is a careful mother of four non-adult children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. 

Kumrikhon has been busy operating a bakery for more than 12 years. Kumrikhon cooks and sells flatbreads in the local market. She has regular customers. Kumrikhon has a workshop in her house. She hopes to increase her working capital and maximize her profits so she can improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy flour, wood, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy flour, wood, etc. for her bakery business.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Ms. Enkhjargal, the female head of a household, is 41 years old and lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling). She brought up her son alone and her son graduated from University in May of 2014 and now works in the military.

Ms.Enkhjargal works in a restaurant as an organizer. She is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to make extra income by importing and selling clothing, stockings and socks from China. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to start a new business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as loving. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, maize flour, milk, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in urban area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, milk, bread and other items she sells. Her business goal is to have expanded within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be an achiever. This is her second loan with SMEP Micro Finance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, milk, bread and other items.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 38 years old and married to Dancan who also supports the family by providing additional income. They are blessed with three children.

Pauline has been running a restaurant where she has sold fast food for the past six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. She paid her previous loan well. She is applying for her second loan of KES 15,000 to renovate the restaurant and add more stock of sugar, tea leaves, etc. for use in the restaurant.

In the near future, Pauline plans to grow her business and become financially stable.

loans.use: to renovate her restaurant and add more stock of sugar, tea leaves, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen owns and operates two tricycle units. She has been successful in this business for ten years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by offering electronic load service.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicles. She is requesting an amount of PHP 12,000 for the maintenance of their tricycle units to continue operation of her business.

In the future, Carmen wants to manage her own "sari-sari" store. She meets up with her *co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycles.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is widowed mother and she works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Melida Cirstabel

texts.es:
Mélida tiene 44 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casada y su esposo se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales una ya está casada, la otra hija trabaja y de Mélida solo depende un hijo que se encuentra estudiando en la escuela.

Mélida se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo hace casa por casa en las comunidades cercanas tiene, 2 años de dedicarse a esta labor, además ella posee otra fuente de ingresos que es la venta de dulces típicos artesanales, la actividad la aprendió en el año 2010  por una capacitación que fue brindada por una ONG de origen español en el cual aprendió a elaborar dulces artesanales de mango, jocote, coco, tamarindo  entre otros, todos estos dulces los prepara en su casa y sale a vender durante las tardes, y en ocasiones sus hijas se involucran en el trabajo.

El dinero del crédito lo utilizará para comprar materiales para elaborar los dulces artesanales, como lo son fresa, coco, tamarindo, dulce de atado y bolsas, su idea es elaborar más dulces ya que las ventas se han incrementado.

Su sueño principal es colocar una venta de dulces típicos artesanales en un local, además incorporar ahí la venta de ropa para mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, con lo que le genere la ganancia principalmente espera cancelar el préstamo y ahorrar para comprar más materia prima.
texts.en:
Melida, 44, has an eighth grade education.  She is married and her husband works in agriculture.  They have three children, one of whom is married, one daughter works and a son is still in Melida's care and attends school.

Melida sells clothing on a door-to-door basis in nearby communities.  She has been in business for two years and also earns extra income selling typical artisan sweets which she learned how to make in 2010 through training offered by an NGO from Spain.  She learned how to make sweets with mango, purple mombin, tamarind and other goods.  She prepares all the sweets at home and goes out in the afternoon to sell them.  Sometimes her daughters help with the work.

Melida will use the loan to buy ingredients for her sweets, such as strawberries, coconunt, tamarind, cane sugar and bags.  She wants to increase production and sales.

Her main goal is to sell her sweets from a shop and also sell clothing there to increase sales and income.  With the profit she will pay off the loan and save to buy more raw materials.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as strawberries, coconut, tamarind, cane sugar and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to build another room beside the first one and renovate the house.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo Buena Vista La encargada de este dúo es la señora Marta Lucrecia, quien se dedica al bordado de blusas de tela a máquina desde hace 20 años.  Con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y el amor de sus 4 hijos, cada mañana sigue luchando por su sueño, ser una gran distribuidora de blusas muy reconocida por la calidad de su trabajo en diferentes partes del mundo.  Tiene varios pedidos de  blusas, pero no le es suficiente la que tiene en casa, también le faltan colores de hilos que los compra por conos, adornos para la confeccion de delantales que lo compra por yarda de diferentes clases y calidad.  Por tal razón necesita un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar lo que necesita, y asi no quedarles mal a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is the group "Dúo Buena Vista", for which Martha Lucrecia is responsible. She has been  embroidering blouses with a sewing machine for twenty years. With the unconditional support of her husband and the love of her four children, she wakes up every morning and fights to make her dream come true, which is to become a great distributor of blouses, well-known worldwide for the good quality of her work.

Her customers have placed numerous orders, but she does not have enough stock to fulfill them. She is also lacking some colors of the threads she uses and different types of ornaments for the aprons she makes. This is why she is requesting a new loan to buy what she needs and be able to fulfill the orders.

loans.use: to buy materials to make aprons.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 57 años de edad,es madre soltera de 3 hijos, ya profesionales todos, los cuales no dependen del comercio que ella realiza, tiene 57 años de edad. Ella comenta que lo del comercio lo trae en la sangre, porque toda su familia es comerciante; recuerda que su mamá hacia tortillas y ella junto a sus hermanas salían a venderlas o cambiaba una tortilla por el queso que tanto le gusta. Esta actividad es lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que nunca ha recibido una pensión por parte del papá de sus hijos. Actualmente ella cuenta con su propia casa y con el orgullo de ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad y con muy buenos puestos. Por lo que me comenta que ella trabaja para sus propias necesidades y continuar ahorrando ya que le gusta mucho viajar por todo el mundo.
Se dedica a comercializar Línea Blanca desde hace 25 años, viajaba a México y Panamá, indica que desde que abrieron el Deposito Libre de Golfito ella les compra, por tener tantos años de trabajar con ellos actualmente realiza sus pedidos por teléfono y se los cotizan para enviárselos desde allá. También trabaja como asesora de viajes desde hace 14 años para Agencia 2000. Ella solicita este crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder traer toda la mercadería que le han solicitado.
Mujer muy trabajadora, con amplia experiencia en el comercio, actualmente sus hijos no dependen de ella, por lo que actualmente debe velar por su bienestar y correcta condición de vida, ya que nos asegura que mientras ella viva nadie debe mantenerla. La zona donde se ubica no es su fuerte aunque si le compran; me indica que cuenta con clientas de muchos años y algunas nuevas que en su mayoría son asalariadas.
texts.en:
Doña María is 57 years old. She is a single mother of three children, all of whom are now professionals and do not depend on her business. She says that she has business in her blood, because all of her family are businessmen and women. She remembers that her mother used to make tortillas, and she and her sisters would go out to sell them or trade a tortilla for the cheese she liked so much. This activity is what has allowed her to give her children a good life, as she has never received any money from their father. Now she has her own home and the pride of seeing her children graduated from university and in very good jobs. She works for her own needs and to continue saving as she really likes to travel the world.

She has worked selling household appliances for 25 years, and has travelled to Mexico and Panama. She explains that since the Deposito Libre de Golfito centre opened she has been buying there. As she has been working with them for so many years, now she makes her orders by phone and they send her them. She has also worked as a travel agent for Agencia 2000 for 14 years. 

She is applying for this loan to increase her working capital and be able to obtain all the merchandise that her customers have ordered from her.

A very hard-working woman, with a lot of business experience, her children don't currently depend on her, so now she must look after her own well-being and living conditions, as she assures us that while she is living nobody has to care for her. The area where she is located isn't her strength, although people do buy from her and she has both customers she has had for years, and some new ones that are mainly wage earners.

loans.use: to buy the merchandise that her customers order.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells tubes and tires. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are frequent. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tires and tubes. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires and tubes.

loans.name: Juan Moises

texts.es:
Juan tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en la comunidad Santa Rita perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Santa Rita  a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Juan se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frejol y a la crianza de vacas. Solicita el crédito para  la compra de insumos agrícolas. La compra lo realiza en mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su desafío es el mal tiempo, plagas y enfermedades. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old. He is single. He lives with his parents in the community of Santa Rita, belonging to the Chillanes Canton and Bolívar Province.
He is a member of the group LA PALMIRA located in the community of Santa Rita some 40 minutes from the office of the cooperative formed by 14 members from the same community that are in agriculture for a living.
Juan cultivates corn and beans for a living as well as raising cows. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs. The purchase will be made in the Chillanes market. His goal is to improve his living conditions. He challenges are the bad weather, plagues, and disease. In this free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria vive en el puerto del Callao junto con sus padres y su hermana, su familia atraviesa por una grave crisis económica ya que su padre es pescador y debido a su avanzada edad ya no puede laborar, su hermana trabaja eventualmente pero lo poco que gana lo destina en los gastos de su menor hija ya que es madre soltera, motivo por el que los gastos de la casa son solventados solo por su madre, la cual labora como ayudante en una pesquera ganando apenas S/. 20.00 soles diarios lo que apenas alcanza para la comida.
Es por esta difícil situación que Maria tendría que abandonar sus estudios y comenzar a trabajar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva. Ella esta próxima a iniciar practicas pre-profesionales como parte de la carrera que viene estudiando, lo que le permitirá tener un ingreso con el cual ayudar en casa sin tener que abandonar sus estudios.
Maria desea terminar su carrera y espera comenzar a laborar a tiempo completo para poder ayudar a su familia que tanto lo necesita y a su vez convertirse en la primera en su familia en tener estudios superiores, sus padres están muy orgullosos de ella. Es por todo esto que esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas de Kiva que no solo le permitirá poder culminar con éxito sus estudios sino también salir adelante a ella y a toda su familia.
texts.en: Maria lives in the port city of Callao with her parents and her sister. Her family is experiencing a financial crisis since her father, who is a fisherman can not work anymore because of his advanced age. Her sister works once in a while, but the little that she earns is to pay the expenses of her small daughter, since she is a single mother. All household expenses are then paid by their mother, who works as an assistant to a fish company, earning barely S/. 20.00 soles a day, which only covers the food. Because of this difficult situation, Maria would have to stop studying and start working if she did not have the support of the Kiva lenders. She is almost ready to start her training internship, as part of the career she has been studying, which will allow her to have an income so she is able to help at home without having to abandon her studies. Maria wishes to finish her career and hopes to start working full time to be able to help her family, who needs it so much. Also, at the same time she wishes to be the first one in her family to finish college. Her parents are very proud of her. Because of all of this she is very grateful for all the support that the Kiva lenders give her, not only to finish her studies successfully, but also to allow her and her whole family to move ahead.

loans.use: to pay for her technical studies in textile chemistry

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en:
Clarisse is 28 years old. She is married with one child. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production: they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during maize production.

loans.name: Shivaramareddi

texts.en:
Shivaramareddi is a 60-year-old farmer from Devaraguddapalli village in the Chikkaballapur district of Karnataka. Agriculture is very important in this region and is the main source of his income. Shivaramareddi is a highly experienced farmer who grows tomatoes, sunflowers, chilies and various other crops.

Shivaramareddi lives with his spouse and two sons as well as his brother’s family, totaling nine members in all. In all his years of farming, Shivaramareddi has never requested a loan. After being introduced to drip irrigation technology from a local manufacturer (Driptech), he was impressed by its ability to save water while potentially increasing his yield by 20-50%.  He wishes to take out a Kiva loan in order to purchase and implement this system in his fields.

Shivaramareddi is very happy to use more Eco-friendly and sustainable technology that will also bring him more profit to re-invest and improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a drip irrigation set

loans.name: Kankele Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankele de Koutiala  du quartier Darsalam1 de la ville de Koutiala est un regroupement de femmes qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans, sont mariées et  ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’Habits, Condiments, Fruits et Légumes et divers.  Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur douzième prêt de groupe. 
Sétou est un membre du groupe Kankele vendeuse de fruits et légumes,   debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la  droite.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des Fruits et légume (mangue, bananes, orange, citrons..). Elle se procure de ces articles  au grand marché et les vend au comptant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres  du groupe Kankele comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sétou compte réaliser  130 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Kankele Group is based in the Darsalam 1 district of the town of Koutiala.  It is made up of women who know one another well and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 43 years old and have five children.  They sell various products such as clothing, food, fruit and vegetables, etc.

In order to expand their businesses the women decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their twelfth group loan.

Sétou (standing third from the left in the photo) is a member of the Kankele Group, and sells fruit and vegetables.  She plans to use her loan to buy fruit and vegetables (mangoes, bananas, oranges, lemons, etc) from the main market.  She will then retail her produce for cash to various customers.

The other members of the group expect to make an average profit of 115,000 francs CFA each, over the loan period, but Sétou expects to make 130,000 francs CFA.  She intends to use her profit to repay her loan, provide for her personal expenses and increase her working capital.  

The women would like to continue to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure that they maintain their stock levels.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Adinarayanappa

texts.en:
Adinarayanappa is a 54-year-old farmer who is married with a son and daughter. He has gained years of farming experience by growing vegetables and fruits. Despite being an experienced farmer, he struggles to get sufficient yields because of the variance in seasonal rain. He plans to buy a drip irrigation system from Driptech, a local irrigation manufacturer. This system will not only help increase his yield by 20-50% but also decrease his annual water usage in the process.

With the help of a Kiva loan, Adinarayanappa can expand his fields and increase his income. He will use the additional income for his children’s education. He wishes for them to become well educated and hold good jobs in the community.  He hopes this loan can help fulfill his dreams of becoming an influential farmer and a role model in his community.

This is Adinarayanappa’s very first loan and he is very excited about the opportunity and thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a drip irrigation set

loans.name: Nanjareddy

texts.en:
India is largely an agricultural country. Eighty percent of the populations live, directly or indirectly, on income derived from agriculture. But to say that India lives by agriculture does not mean that India is completely agriculturally advanced. Unfortunately, many small plot farmers cannot afford to use the most technologically advanced equipment due to the low income from their current yield and expenses for water usage.  These farmers’ annual yield of crops per acre is lamentably low and is highly dependent on the weather where depleted rainfall is a recurring issue.

For these small plot farmers, age-old methods used to be the standard. Unfortunately, the yields produced by these methods are not sufficient to provide a steady income. Because of this, many farmers are turning to newer methods to increase yields. Drip irrigation is one of these developing methods. Drip irrigation increases crop yields 20-50% and requires less labor and money spent on diesel or electricity for pumping water.

Nanjareddy is a small plot farmer who lives in Devaraguddapalli village of Chikkaballapur, Karnataka. He plans to use a Kiva loan to buy a drip irrigation system for his farm. His goal is to increase his yield and provide a steady income for his family. This loan can bring a big change in Nanjareddy’s life. With any extra income, he can contribute to his two sons’ future education. They are currently studying in the 12th and 8th grade.

loans.use: to buy a drip irrigation set

loans.name: Venkatesh

texts.en:
Global water usage is unsustainable from a food security perspective. Available water per person in developing countries is 20% of what it was fifty years ago. In these same places, agriculture accounts for 81% of total freshwater usage, primarily for flood irrigation. In addition to wasting water, flood irrigation leads to lower yields for many crops and is very labor intensive. At the same time, most small-plot farmers cannot grow crops throughout the year due to insufficient rainfall and are unable to afford existing irrigation systems, which are either too expensive, too complicated to use, or of too-poor quality. 

Under these conditions, small-plot farmers are limited in ability to improve their livelihoods. Drip irrigation technology has emerged as a viable solution, being both easy to use and relatively inexpensive.

Venkatesh is 34 years old and from a village in Chikkaballapur District in Karnataka. He is married, and his family has been farming for the last 25 years. Despite being an experienced farmer, his area suffers from low water levels due to depleted seasonal rainfall.

With a loan from Kiva, Venkatesh can buy a drip irrigation system designed to get higher yields while greatly decreasing his water usage. This loan will effectively help him to increase his income and fulfill his dreams of expanding his farm and becoming a successful farmer.

Venkatesh is highly appreciative of the chance at a loan: “I am very grateful to Kiva for giving me this great opportunity.”

loans.use: to buy a drip irrigation set.

loans.name: Venkatareddy

texts.en:
Venkatareddy is a farmer who lives in Bagepalli, Karnataka. He is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a drip irrigation system, which will help increase the yield of fruits and vegetables while decreasing his usage of water. 

Compared to flood irrigation or relying on rainfall, drip irrigation increases crop yields 20-50% and requires less labor and money spent on diesel or electricity for pumping water. Through Driptech, a local irrigation manufacturer, Venkatareddy can acquire a sustainable drip system for a price that is 50% lower than the nearest competition.

Typical financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. As a result, farmers in Bagepalli remain underserved by financial institutions. Kiva loans provide a way for farmers to improve their farming technique in a sustainable way.

A Kiva loan can make a meaningful impact. By purchasing a drip irrigation system, Venkatareddy can not only increase his finances and provide the day-to-day needs of his family, but also conserve natural resources in the process.

loans.use: to buy a drip irrigation set.

loans.name: Hermelinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Hermelinda vive en la comunidad de quilile, tiene  28 años de edad , dice que curso hasta sexto grado de primaria en la escuela de su comunidad  dice que después ya no continuo estudiando por problemas de salud asi que se dedico ayudar a su mama en los labores del hogar  , su familia dice tienes unas manzanas de tierra las que las cultivan su padre y sus hermanos de esta manera su familia recibe ingresos para los gastos de la casa , ella es madre soltera su hijo tiene 10 años de edad su padres la apoyan bastante con los gastos de su hijo y ella también dice que ha aprendido a trabajar la tierra así que siembra maíz y frijoles  y luego que sale la cosecha los vende.Quiere aplicar a tramite de crédito para comprarse un Kits solar  para usarlo por las noches en su vivienda así sus padres hermanos y su hijo podrán beneficiarse y no estar a oscuras por las noches
texts.en:
Hermelinda lives in the Quilile community. She is 28 years of age, and says she completed sixth grade primary schooling at the local school. After that she did not continue studying due to health issues, and so she helped her mother with housework. Her family has fields that are tended by her father and her brothers. This is how the family earns income for their household expenses. Hermelinda is a single mother. Her son is 10 years old and her parents provide a lot of help with with the costs of raising her son. She also says that she has learned to work on the land, sowing corn and beans, eventually selling the harvest. 

Hermelinda wants to apply for a loan to buy a solar kit to use in her home at night so that her parents, brothers and son can benefit and not be left in the dark during the nights.

loans.use: to buy a solar kit

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Balimaya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Medina coura de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, d’habits, Condiments  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt de groupe. 
Aminata première debout de la gauche vers la droite, qui est une vendeuse de pagnes,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de toute qualité et de plusieurs couleurs en quantité qu’elle vend en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure de ces pagnes au marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Balimaya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Aminata  compte réaliser  115 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Balimaya is a group of married women who live in the Medina Coura district of the town of Koutiala.  They know one another well and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives.  They are, on average, 30 years old and have three children.  The women sell various products such as clothing, food and other products.

In order to expand their businesses, the women decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their seventeenth group loan.

Aminata (standing on the far left in the photo) sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).  She plans to use her loan to buy several qualities of pagnes, in various colours and quantities, from the market.  She will then retail them to various customers.

While the other members of the group expect to make an average profit of 110,000 francs CFA each over the loan period, Aminata expects to make 115,000 francs CFA.  As well as repaying her loan, she will use her profit to provide for her personal expenses and increase her working capital.

The women would like to continue to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to ensure that they have adequate stock levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kaly Isaac

texts.fr:
Kaly Isaac  est un jeune agriculteur qui a une expérience de 3 ans dans ce domaine. Chaque année, à l’approche de la saison des pluies, il fait une demande de crédit pour pouvoir acheter des semences et de l’engrais. Il fait du maraichage et exploite un espace qui appartenait à ses parents. Dans les champs, c’est un plaisir pour lui, de rester toute la journée : de 8h à 19h.
Kaly Isaac est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’un est scolarisé grâce aux revenus tirés de l’activité.
Dans son compte, il essaie d’épargner pour construire son terrain et mettre sa famille dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Kaly Isaac is a young farmer who has three years' experience.  Each year, in the run up to the rainy season, he requests a loan in order to buy seed and fertilizer.  He grows vegetables on a patch of land that belongs to his parents.  He really enjoys working in the fields all day long, he works from eight in the morning until seven in the evening.

Kaly Isaac is married and father to two children.  One of his children attends school and this is paid for by his business revenue.

Kaly Isaac tries to save money to enable him to construct a property and improve the living conditions of his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to prepare for the winter season.

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamondo est une commerçante, conseillère et membre du groupe d’affaires «Uwezo», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 5 étudient et 1 a déjà obtenu son diplôme universitaire. La cliente est vendeuse  friperie. Elle installe sa marchandise à domicile dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est chef de quartier dans une commune de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 27 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 ballon de vêtements. Ainsi, elle souhaite  scolariser, vêtir, nourrir et assurer les soins médicaux de ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation  des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kamondo is a retailer, counsellor and member of the business group 'Uwezo'.  She is a senior entrepreneur, dynamic, 50 years old, married and mother to six children.  Five of her children currently attend school, the sixth has already achieved their university diploma.

Kamondo has been selling second-hand clothing from her home in a busy district of the town for 27 years now.  She started her business with capital provided by her husband.  He is the neighbourhood chief at the local commune.  Later, Kamondo started to work with the field partner, Hekima.  She will use her loan to buy a bale of second-hand clothing.

Kamondo hopes to be able to use her profits to educate, clothe, feed and provide healthcare for her children.

She is very grateful to Hekima for helping women entrepreneurs, who are excluded from the classic banking system, to become independent.  This is especially important during this post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en:
Sauda is married and has 3 kids who still go to school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Bernandeta

texts.en:
Bernandeta works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a PHP 2175 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor of her house for her family.

With your help Bernandeta will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Bernandeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo est  composé  uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 42ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, de légumes et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Deba (femme assise au milieu devant sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (bazins). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20mètres de bazins en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Hamdallaye et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Deba  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group is made up solely of monogamous women. They average 42 years of age with four children each. They all live in Hamdallaye, one of the districts of Bamako, and they got to know each other as neighbors. The group members have small businesses selling clothing, vegetables and charcoal. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso so they could expand their businesses, and they are on their first group loan.

Deba (who is sitting in the middle at the front of the photo) has a great reputation for the sale of clothing (damask fabric). She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 meters of damask fabric wholesale at the Grand Market. She resells on a retail basis in Hamdallaye mainly to women. 

Deba hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA as a result of this loan and she will use this profit to reinvest in her business. Her aim is, through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, to buy a plot of land to live on.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Puma Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a mother of eight children; one attends school and the others are adults. She is married and is in her early fifties. 

She has sold bar soap (magadi) and Muslim clothing since 2008 and works from 9am to 6pm daily.  She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy soap and clothing to sell.  She sells her products door-to-door. She dreams of having a shop where she can sell her product in one place.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group "puma" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy soap and madela to sell.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La  Señora Gladis es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su hijo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   venta  de tortillas.
Doña Gladis el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz leña y cal. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña Gladis espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y que su hijo  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 
Choluteca, Honduras  –  Mayo   del   2014
texts.en:
Gladis is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person.  She lives with her son in the south of Honduras.  Her business is selling tortillas.

Gladis needs the loan to buy corn, firewood, and lime.  With the loan she wants to increase her business sales and improve her customer service because she'll have more products to sell.

Gladis expects to cover her needs and improve somewhat her family's quality of life and her own.  She hopes her business will keep growing and, in a few years, become one of the biggest and best known in the area.  She also hopes her children will become decent people with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras–May 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and firewood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy upholstery materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Fajoatkhon

texts.en:
Fajoatkhon is caring mother of 4 children.  Her husband died 20 years ago. Fajoatkhon raises her children on her own and is the main provider for her children. 

She is an entrepreneur and has had an apricot business for more than 15 years. She buys, processes, and sells the apricots in a local market as ‘kuraga’.  Her children help her manage the business. 

Fajoatkhon will use the 6,000 TJS loan to buy the  apricots for processing. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy apricots.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 50 years old and a widow with four children. Azucena works very hard to provide for them.

Azucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Azucena has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, shampoo, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Azucena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Euis

texts.en:
Euis lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Euis is married and living with three people in the family home. Euis is a housewife and she also runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits. In the picture, Euis is with her daughter.

Euis began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Pramila is a woman of 47 years. She is married, a housewife, and mother of three sons. She is very energetic, hardworking and optimistic.  

Her husband, Pabin, aged 56 years, does cultivation on their own land, which he got from his ancestors. They live in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  Both are illiterate, able to sign their names only, and did not get the opportunity to study due to their parents' poverty. Among her sons, one son is receiving education and the others are working as daily laborers. 

Pramila's husband has always worked in agriculture, which he learnt from his father.  He is the only earning member for the family and he always strives for the betterment of his family.  

Pramila, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  But it is difficult for them to run a family of five members in a decent way with such a small income. They thought to expand their business and start cultivation of jute, which is a profitable crop.  They cannot fulfill their dream due to lack of capital.

So Pramila has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase jute seeds and other necessary things related to cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them with much profit to give her family financial stability. She dreams of making improvements to her house and providing further education to her literate son to establish him in life.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To start cultivation of jute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the highest quality of potato seeds and fertilizer to help them.

loans.name: Ramon Alfredo

texts.es:
Ramón, está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo de un año de edad, ambos dependen económicamente de él;  para tener los ingresos económicos que necesita, él atiende un taller de reparación de llantas y ofrece el servicio de mecánico, lo tiene desde hace 7 años, el oficio lo aprendió de su papá, su horario de atención al público es de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. 
Invertirá en la compra de llantas, parches, pegamento, adictivos, cables y dará mantenimiento al equipo de trabajo, será muy útil para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, espera atraer nuevos clientes.
Su objetivo es crecer con su negocio y tener una economía más estable con la que cambiara las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Ramón is married and lives with his life's companion and one year old son. Both of them depend financially on him. In order to have the income that he needs, he runs a tire repair shop and offers mechanical service. He has had it for 7 years and he learned the trade from his father. He is open to the public  from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
 
He will invest in buying tires, patches, glue, additives and cables, as well as do maintenance on his work equipment. It will be very useful to offer his customers a good service and attract new customers. His objective is to grow his business and have more stable finances to change his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy tires, patches, glue, additives and cables, as well as to do maintenance on his work equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more of livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lotus Group

texts.en:
Yohana is in his early thirties and married with one child who is still at school. He has been a blacksmith for eight years now. He works from 8am  to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Yohana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use the loan to buy an up-to-date welding machine. He dreams of buying more materials for his business in order to make better iron windows and doors.

Yohana will share this loan with his loan group, "LOTUS," which has twelve members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy an up-to-date welding machine.

loans.name: Shahnozakhon

texts.en:
Shahnozakhon was born in 1983. She is married and her husband is a migrant in Russia. Shahnozakhon raises 2 children and teaches in a local school. 

Shahnozakhon is one of the successful and smart teachers. She graduated from Pedagogical College and has a special education. Shahnozakhon is going to earn a higher education degree at the university. She must pay for her tuition but she has no money. 

She asks for 3,000 TJS to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her mid-thirties, is single and has got three children, one of whom is in school.  The other two are still young.  She has been running a grocery store for one and a half years now. She works from 4pm to morning.  She works overnight.  She is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Mariam's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy beverages for her grocery business.  She dreams of building her own house.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Nguvu Moja," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beverages for her grocery business.

loans.name: Muborakhon

texts.en: Muborakhon is hardworking woman. She is married and brings up four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Muborakhon has been busy selling medicines for more than eleven years. She has a pharmacy where she sells a variety of medicines. Muborakhon’s eldest child helps her manage the business. Muborakhon uses the profits from her business to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy medicines for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Julia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Julia es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable  humilde vive junto a su hija en una comunidad en la zona  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de golosinas como tacos, comidas, enchiladas, tajaditas y otros el cual es muy conocido en su colonia.
Doña Julia necesita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima.  Como  repollos,  condimentos,  maíz,  manteca y carnes. Los cuales  necesita para seguir  vendiendo su  producto. Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos  necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento considerable el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar con el aumento de los ingresos.
Doña Julia espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  su hija continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo  del  2014
texts.en:
Julia's a very hardworking, responsible, and modest person.  She lives with her daughter in a community in Honduras.  Her business, which is very well known in her community, is selling tacos, lunch, enchiladas, tajaditas [fried plantains], and other snacks. 

Julia needs the loan to buy ingredients such as cabbage, condiments, corn, shortening, and meat so she can keep on selling her products.

Thanks to the loan, she hopes to be able to have what she needs to continue with her business and meet customer demand.  She also hopes her sales will increase considerably and improve her family's quality of life at home with the increase in income.

Julia hopes her business will keep growing and become the best known in the community so she'll be able to keep on supporting her family.  She also hopes her daughter continues with her studies and has more opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras–May 2014

loans.use: to buy cabbage, condiments, corn, shortening, and meat

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is forty-seven years old, married and the father of three children aged between twelve and sixteen.

He has been selling second hand clothes for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy more used clothes to sell.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide basic needs for his family. In the future he hopes to grows his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Karen Waleska

texts.es:
La Señora Karen  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus padres  en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 5 años. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, carne, queso, mantequilla etc. Con el crédito  ella espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan,  a diario y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión.
En unos años ella sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona, y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo  del 2014
texts.en:
Karen is a very enterprising person who lives with her parents in a community in southern Honduras. Her business is a store that she has had for more than 5 years. She needs the loan to buy corn, beans, rice, beverages, meat, cheese, butter, etc. With the loan, she hopes to increase her sales because she will have more fresh capital and more to offer her customers who visit every day to cover their needs. She also helps to improve her financial situation in her home and for that to reflect the investment.  

Her dream is that in a few years her business will be the biggest and best known in the area and that she will continue to help her family become good members of society with better opportunities. 

Choluteca, Honduras – May, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, beverages, meat. cheese, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 42 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Melinda has a mat-making business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials and new equipment for her mat-making.
