Melinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials and new equipment for her mat-making.

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy is 27 years old and married with three children. May Joy works very hard to provide for them.

May Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

May Joy has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, beverages and other groceries. 

In the future, May Joy would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 47 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is 23 years old, married and has two children, one attends school. 

Charlyn and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were destroyed. 

Charlyn is taking out a  8,357 PHP housing loan to purchase building materials and pay construction costs to build a house for her family. 

Charlyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fish vending business.

With your help, Charlyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is forty-three years old, married and has six children. Four of them are in school.

Dalia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Dalia requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dalia has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sarik

texts.en:
Sarik would like to have one more deal with Kiva since his first deal was rather profitable for his beekeeping activities. Sarik lives in the village Geghanush in Syunik region. He has two daughters who are married, and they live with their families. Sarik’s son lives with them and he works at the gas station. Sarik also is employed and he works at the Kajaran combine. 

At the same time, with his wife he is engaged in farming and agriculture. On his farm he breeds a cow, a bull, a calf, 25 beehives, and 10 chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, and beans. All his farm products he sells with the help of his beloved wife at the city wholesale market. 

Sarik requests this loan again for his beekeeping development, and with the loan amount he wants to buy fax papers, frames, special medicine for his bees, and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy fax paper, frames, special medicine for his bees, and also some animal fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Her smile exudes optimism as she ventures into goat farming. Margaret is not your ordinary small-holder dairy farmer, as evidenced by her carefully conceived business plan.

Margaret, a mother of 3, is embarking on a journey to improve her family’s standard of living by engaging in mixed farming.  She received training from Juhudi Kilimo, located in her home town of Kerugoya, Kenya.

She has farmed for10 years and has earned an income selling her  produce and engaging in other small businesses. 

Margaret seeks a loan to purchase goats. These goats will provide milk and meat that will be sold. The training she received from Juhudi focused on wealth-creation through income generating assets and basic financial management skills. The money she earns from selling milk and meat will be enough to repay the loan and save money. 

Her biggest challenge is raising capital and marketing the farm products. With your funding, Margaret will purchase the goats and use Juhudi Kilimo's extension resources to help with the marketing challenges. The extra income will meet the high farming costs that place heavy burdens on smallholder farmers. 

Her dream is for her family to enjoy financial independence.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, age 54 years, is a resident of Ekerenyo village in Kenya. On a small plot of land, he has practised mixed farming for more than 30 years. He grows tea, bananas and a variety of vegetables. He also raises dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from milk, tea and egg sales is insufficient to meet expenses of his family of six children. Hence he decided to start dairy entrepreneurship. 

Richard is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cowshed. With your loan, the cowshed will enable Richard to introduce zero-grazing, by which he projects he will be producing more than 20 litres of milk per day to be sold. This will generate enough money to pay for the loan and still have more for saving.

Richard can’t wait to start making real profits from dairy farming. Currently, his biggest challenge is limited funds. Richard is very appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo and its partners like Kiva who are there to support smallholder farmers. He plans to plough the extra money he will make back into the business and purchase better quality cows. He says his family will greatly benefit from the increased income.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 29 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a member of an agricultural cooperative who will benefit from a new loan offered by UOB. This loan will help to construct a warehouse which will  store  the cooperative’s harvested maize. A structure like this will actually help the entire community to securely store their produce.

UOB’s farmer clients often endure financial hardship while waiting for buyers to pay them for their crops. This 1,236,906 RWF loan will play a big role in avoiding the hardship affecting farmers during the period between harvest and profit. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and fluctuating prices. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for warehouse construction.

loans.name: Shaqqi

texts.en:
Shaqqi lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Shaqqi is single and living with three people in the family home. 

Shaqqi runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories

Shaqqi began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Shukla

texts.en:
Shukla is age 36, a hardworking housewife of a small town of Mayanaguri in Jaipaiguri district. She has completed up to class VIII (grade 8). She lives with her husband and one son who is too small to go to school.

Her husband is involved in a builders' business and she assists her husband in his business. The demand for building materials is high in their locality. But due to insufficient materials to sell, their earning is not enough for maintaining their family expenses. So to create a good stock, she needs a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). After getting the loan, she wants to purchase bricks, stone chips, sand, etc. for their business.

Her future dream is to develop this trade on a large scale so they can earn much profit and bear the family expenses smoothly.
 
Both Shukla and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials for her builders' business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flour bags.

loans.name: Kusumbala

texts.en:
Kusumbala is a woman of 52 years. She is married, a housewife, and mother of two sons. She is very energetic, hardworking and optimistic. Her husband, aged 60 years, does cultivation on their own land. They live in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  Both are illiterate, able to sign their names only, and did not get the opportunity to study due to their parents' poverty. Both the sons are working as daily laborers.
 
Kusumbala's husband has always worked in agriculture. He is the only earning member for the family and always strives for the betterment of his family.  Kusumbala, though a housewife, helps her husband in his agricultural activities. They mainly cultivate seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. But it is difficult for them to run a family of four members in a decent way with such a small income. They thought to expand their business and start cultivation of jute, which is a profitable crop, but they cannot fulfill their dream due to lack of capital.

So Kusumbala has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase jute seeds and other necessary things related to cultivation. She hopes it will be a lucrative business and will provide them with much profit to give her family financial stability. 

She dreams of making improvements to her house and, in future, upgrading her house to a concrete one.

She is grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To start cultivation of jute.

loans.name: Saripin

texts.en:
Saripin lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Saripin is married and living with three people in the family home.
 
Saripin runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. Saripin began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Gulsunoy

texts.ru: Гулсуной продолжает ремесло своей матери. Ей 52 года. Она на протяжении 22 лет занимается пошивом платьев национальных фасонов. Гулсуной принимает заказы у себя дома в районе Рудаки. За эти годы она зарекомендовала себя как профессиональная швея. Ее заказы всегда выполняются качественно и в срок. Ей помогают в деле невестка и дочери. Все эти годы Гулсуной шила на своей старой машинке. Теперь ее машинка уже выходит из строя и во время шитья причиняет ей неудобств. Гулсуной просит кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку для продолжения деятельности. Этот кредит ей действительно важен.
texts.en: Gulsunoy is continuing the craft of her mother. She is 52 and has 22 years of experience sewing traditional dresses. She takes orders from her home in the Rudaki district. Over the years she has established herself as a professional seamstress. Her orders are always high-quality and completed on time. Her daugter-in-law and her daughter help her with the business. For all these years Gulsunoy has been working with her old sewing machine. This machine is now out of order. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine so that she can continue her sewing business. This loan is very important for her.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es: María tiene 47 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 9 y 17 años de edad.  María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace dos años. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children aged 9 and 17. For two years María has been raising and selling chickens. This is how she makes a living and provides food for the household.

Since she wants to improve her living conditions she is asking FUSAI for this loan to repair the roof of her home, as it is in a poor condition and when it rains the water gets in. She will use the sum requested to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets, wood and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 20-year-old single sole breadwinner for ten members of his family, for whom he is working hard to support since 2009. Hamad had to quit school during his intermediate stage to financially support his family. He was only fifteen when he started working and unfortunately he missed all the fun of being a teenager.
Hamad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a small truck to help start his own hardware selling business.
Hamad hopes to develop his own business properly to ensure that he can support his family in a well managed way.

loans.use: To buy a small truck to help start a hardware selling business

loans.name: Majed

texts.en:
Majed is a 26-year-old Tunisian citizen who lives and works in a Palestinian camp, since he seeks a low-expense living with a better income.

Majed has had a barber shop since 2007, with 10 years of experience in his domain. He quit school during his intermediate stages and turned to seek a good income business, which he established on his own seven years ago.

Today, Majed is well-known in his region. Through his acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, he will make necessary maintenance to his shop with decoration, tiles and painting, in addition to renewing his business tools and machines to attract more customers.

He hopes to keep on developing his business in a well-managed way, and might move his shop to a better region.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his shop with decoration, tiles  and painting, in addition to renewing his business tools and machines to attract more customers

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his parents in a very simple house. His father is an employee in a local firm. This is the only source of income to the family. Rami is a student at university specializing in science management. He would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future.

Rami took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Rami will be able to do his homework and prepare for his reports by reading online articles.

Rami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic and other raw materials to build new greenhouses.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is 35 years old. She lives in a small village of the South Tajikistan with her family. Dilorom and her family live poorly because the only source of family income is from agricultural activity. Dilorom, for more than eight years, has been busy with animal sales. Dilorom feeds cows and sells them in a local market. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 
She wants to develop business but she has not enough money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her to increase the number of cattle and, from the profit, improve her living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Ayoub is a man in his 20s who is single. Since 2013, he has supported his welfare by running a barbershop. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit each month.

This will be his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to buy a nice shop chair and other salon equipment. Ayoub received profits that he used to cover his own welfare costs. He dreams of building a house. 

He will use this loan to buy power control equipment (stabilizer) and a radio for his business. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Vigae," which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy power control equipment (stabilizer) and a radio for his business.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a 43 year old married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be storage facilities. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a freezer for milk storage. Her business goal is to be a milk supplier within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy a freezer for milk storage

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 years old and married to Wanjiru, who also supports by adding additional income for the family through her tailoring business. They are blessed with four children.

He has been running a motorcycle transport business and also has been doing crop farming for the last three years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy some fabric materials for his wife’s business, fuel for the motorcycle, and farm inputs.

James will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot and build a house for the family. In near future he hopes to grows his business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy some fabric materials for his wife’s business, fuel for the motorcycle, and farm inputs

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he offers printing services. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy printing materials. His business goal is to do mass printing within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will prosper in business. This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: buy printing materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Tadevos

texts.en:
Tadevos has higher education and a profession of economist. Many years he worked at the bank and he held various positions. For five years he was branch manager of the bank in Sevan, his city. Tadevos lives in the Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. His wife works at the rest house in Sevan city. They have two children and both of them are already students. His son is just going to graduate and he, like his father, is an economist. Tadevos’ daughter is a future linguist and she studies at the Yerevan State University at the paid division.
  
Tadevos at this moment is employed at the post office where he is a department manager now. At the same time he is engaged in farming. (On his farm he has three cows, three calves, a pig, a bull and five sheep.) But still it is hard for Tadevos with all his family expenses to pay for his daughter’s education. He asks this loan in order to pay his daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay his daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 36-year-old father of 1.  His  farm is located in Kenya’s Rift Valley Province. For the last 3 years, he has sold milk and maize produced on his farm at a local market located near his home. 

Life has not been an easy ride for Stephen. However, he manages to overcome every challenge that tries to knock him down. When the income from his farm was not enough to take good care of his family, he started engaging in other personal businesses to generate more income. 

Stephen seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture. Introducing modern techniques and practices into his farm is Stephen’s perceived path out of poverty.

Through your loan, Stephen and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life.

Stephen became a member of Ebenezer Self-Help Group after sensitization of group-based security loans. Through the group, Stephen received training on how he could improve his agri-business and financial status.

loans.use: to venture into horticulture.

loans.name: Joana Marie

texts.en:
Joana Marie is 19 years old and married with one child.

Joana Marie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her abaca weaving business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Joana Marie requests a 8,750 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs to build a house for her family.

Joana Marie has been with NWTF since 2012 in order to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Joana Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 50 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo, por lo tanto de Oscar solo dependen su esposa y el hijo. 

Oscar tiene 22 años de trabajar como albañil, labor que aprendió cuando trabajaba de auxiliar de otro albañil, además es agricultor, él siembra una hectárea de maíz y también cultiva sandías, estas actividades le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su horario de trabajo en construcción es de 7:00 AM a3:00 	PM, y sus labores en la agricultura las realiza de 6.00 AM a 12.00 MD.

El crédito será utilizado para pagar a las personas que le ayudarán a limpiar la sandillera, comprará fertilizantes y foliadores que le permitan tener una buena producción.

Sus planes a futuro son darse a conocer más con sus trabajos de albañil en otras comunidades que le permitan crecer más en sus labores, y también obtener una buena producción de sandia para cancelar los compromisos adquiridos.
texts.en: Oscar is 50 years old. He studied up to sixth grade. He is married and his wife works in domestic chores. He has one son; therefore, Oscar has only his wife and son as dependents. Oscar has worked for 22 years as a mason. He learned this job when he worked as an assistant to another mason. Also, he works in agriculture. He grows a hectare of corn, and he also cultivates watermelons. These activities have allowed him to move his family forward. His work schedule is from 7 a.m. to 3 p.m. and he works the land between 6 a.m. and 12 p.m. He will use the loan to pay for the people, who will help him clean the watermelon field, and to buy fertilizers and foliar fertilizers to help him have a better production. His plans for the future are to make himself know through his masonry jobs in other communities, so that he can have more work. Also, he wants to get a good harvest of watermelons so he can pay for his committed loans.

loans.use: to pay the people, who will help him clean the watermelon field, to buy fertilizers and foliar fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to renovate his house and build other rooms to make the house more comfortable and larger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en: At the age of 28, Hameeda is a married woman.  She has three children. She is keen to provide her family with bread and butter. Ten years ago, she started a business selling milk to contribute to the family income. At present, she has 3 cows. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Dipali

texts.en:
Dipali lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in a rural village Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri. Dipali is 28 years old,  energetic and hardworking. Her husband, age 35 years, is a farmer by profession. Neither could complete the secondary level of education as their parents could not support them financially. Their three children go to school and are in grade 5, 6 and 1.

Dipali's husband has been relying on agricultural activities for a long time to provide all the basic needs of the family. He mainly grows potatoes, beans and chilies on his own farmland. Though Dipali is a housewife, she contributes her effort to growing crops, doing cleaning work, harvesting the crops, laying the manure etc. Thanks to their effort and determination, they somehow manage their household expenses.

Now Dipali is requesting a loan from BJS to start a business of jute. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure to cultivate this profitable crop. Her plans for the future are to have a large plantation of this crop. She can then earn more and strengthen the inheritance that she will leave for her children. In addition to this, Dipali's priority is providing good education for her children.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for fulfilling her dreams by giving her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase jute seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Binyomo 1 Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Binyomo 1 group, which is composed of three persons whose representative is named Christiana. The group members are friends living in the same neighborhood. With the goal of bolstering their business capital, this group is seeking their eighth loan from ID-Ghana. 

Christiana is 49 years old and married to Samuel, a mechanic. They have children who are in school. Christiana lives with her family, and jointly with her husband, provides for the various family needs. For about 10 years, Christiana has been selling provisions and credit cards. This business brings her a revenue, allowing her to contribute to the family budget. 

Christiana buys her products (diapers, T-roll, rice, fruit drinks) from the market and sells them at her residence. This eighth loan will no doubt allow her and the other members of her group to expand their businesses and increase their number of customers and their revenues. Their prior loans have been duly repaid.

They need a total amount of GHS 3,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy her products (diapers, T-roll, rice, fruit drinks) from the market and sell them at her residence.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Teriya est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, mèches de toutes sortes, habits, jus et lait en poudre. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fadima  (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des mèches de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 paquets de mèches en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à Hamdallaye et  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fadima espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The group Teriya is composed only of monogamous women, who average 34 years of age and four children each. All the women live in Hamdallaye, a district in Bamako. And they know one another through ties in their neighborhood. The group members have small-scale businesses involving hair extensions, clothing, juice drinks, and powdered milk. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Fadima (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) is famous for selling hair extensions of any kind. She intends to use her loan to purchase 60 packets of hair extensions wholesale at the big market. Her sales are made at the retail level to a customer base composed mostly of women in Hamdallaye. 

With this loan, Ms. Fadima hopes to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business. Her goal is to purchase  a plot of residential land through this relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions of any kind

loans.name: Papias Arision

texts.es:
Papias tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa e hijos de 30, 27 y 22 años de edad en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Papias se dedica a la agricultura. Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de los cultivos. Su meta es comprarse un terreno y construir su casa. Su desafío son las plagas y enfermedades en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir de viaje y visitar a la familia.
texts.en:
Papias is 57 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and children aged 30, 27 and 22 in the community of La Palmira which belongs to the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. He is a member of the LA PALMIRA communal bank which is located in the community of La Palmira 40 minutes away from the cooperative's office. The communal bank was set up by 14 members from the same community, who work in agriculture. 

Papias works in agriculture. He is asking for the loan to maintain his crops. His goal is to buy a plot of land and build a house of his own. The challenges he faces are pests and diseases in his crops. In his free time he likes to go travelling and visit the family.

loans.use: to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa wants to open up a store to have her oldest son run it. She wants to sell mostly fruits and veggies from her own fresh produce, and in addition, to sell other staple foods items; this is why she needs this loan in an amount of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL). 

Shpresa is 46 and a mother of three who are 20, 16 and 14. Her name in English means "hope." She has been focused on an agriculture/animal husbandry type of activity. Currently, she has two cows, two calves, and poultry, and she cultivates beans and has grapevines and peach and fig orchards.   

She’s been selling dairy and veggies and fruits to the farmers’ market until now, but from now on, she will sell her products at her store. The village where Shpresa comes from is known for prolific agricultural land and the large quantity and quality of pinto beans.

loans.use: to stock up on inventory items for a store that she recently opened up to be operated by her oldest son

loans.name: Nazeran

texts.en: Nazeran is a 54-year-old married woman. She is a hard-working lady and a responsible mother. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran is 41-year-old lady and enjoys doing works of hand embroidery. For about 6 years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in-demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater more to her customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright future. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, bricks, and wood in order to renovate the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken, etc.

loans.name: Meemona

texts.en: Meemona is a 34-year-old married woman. She is running a small beauty parlor at the corner of her house.  She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best-provided services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  She needs a loan of Rs. 45,000 to buy packs of hair rollers, combs and scissors along with hair care and skin products. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time. With the help of the loan, she will be able to expand her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history,

loans.use: to buy packs of hair rollers, combs and scissors along with hair care and skin products.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is a 40-year-old woman from the small village, Khagrabari, in Maynaguri at Jalpaiguri district. She is married and is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). All are receiving education at graduation level, higher secondary level and secondary level. Manju is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name.

Manju is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm, as they have their own land and her husband has experience in this field. He grows different vegetables in different seasons, but it does not provide much profit to run the family well. So, they have decided to cultivate rice paddy on their land.  

Being a staple food of the people, there is a great demand for rice in West Bengal. So, in this monsoon, which is the suitable time to cultivate this crop, they want to start cultivation of rice/paddy. They need financial help, so Manju has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase seeds, pesticides and insecticides for farming of rice paddy. After the harvest, they will sell the product in the wholesale market.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she can improve her family's condition and can give further education in the future.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling animals for ten years.  Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good health, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. For the improvement of her business, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 55,000 to purchase more goats. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to utilize part of profits on the renovation of her house.

loans.use: to purchase more goats.

loans.name: Sipra

texts.en:
Sipra is a very young and enthusiastic woman of 26 years, who hails from Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is married to Chitya, aged 32 years, and together they are raising one son. She has completed her eighth grade education and her husband studied until grade five.   

Sipra’s husband is a small businessman, which enables him to take care of his family with great difficulty. In order to help her husband, Sipra wants to start her own dairy business to sell milk to her neighbors and earn for her family.  

Sipra gets satisfaction from raising dairy cows because the milk brings in good income. Her biggest challenge is increasing the family income. So, she chose BJS (Kiva’s partner) for this loan because it caters to the interests of small-scale businessmen. The loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and thus generate more income. She wants to utilize the profit to improve her family's living standards.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 39-year-old married woman. She is doing a business of selling milk with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She has three children; all are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. Now she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a businessperson and a mother of two residing in Mukuru's informal settlements. She noticed that her area had very few sanitation facilities that could be relied upon and embarked on a mission to find a solution to the issue. While in the process she learned about the Fresh Life Initiative and thought it would be nice to be part of the fight against poor sanitation. 

She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet to be set up in her neighborhood. She will run the toilet on a pay per use basis in order to raise income for the maintenance of the facility as well as payment of her loan. She hopes to raise enough income in order to set up more of such facilities in the future and spread proper sanitation in the informal settlements.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Hafeez

texts.en:
Hafeez is a 34-year-old married woman. She deals in a business of selling cloth in her locality with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Hafeez is requesting a 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr:
Madame Amy, une femme de la trentaine, s’active dans l’élevage de bœufs depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et loge dans un village situé dans la petite cote. Elle exerce son activité chez elle et se fait aidé par deux de ses frères à tour de rôle qui amènent les bêtes paitre. Néanmoins, Amy est active toute la journée, chaque jour, elle se lève à 6h du matin et finit sa journée à 19h. Entre les travaux domestiques, ses enfants et ses bêtes, c’est une journée bien remplie pour elle, d’ailleurs elle ne peut pas rester sans rien faire.
Amy a déjà bénéficié de 05 crédits à l’IMCEC et cela n’a eu qu’un bon impact dans sa situation de famille car lui permettant d’améliorer  les conditions alimentaires, de payer la scolarité des enfants et pour elle-même, d’épargner un peu d’argent.
Amy est très soucieuse de sa famille, c’est pourquoi sa principale préoccupation est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Amy, a woman in her 30’s, has been active in raising cattle for five years. She is a married mother with a family and is living in a village located in Petit Cote. She operates her business at her home and is helped by two of her sisters, who take turns taking the animals to pasture. Nevertheless, Amy is active all day long, each and every day, getting up at 6 AM and finishing her day at 7 PM. Between domestic work, her children, and her animals, her day is filled up. Anyway, she cannot remain without doing anything. 

Amy has already benefited from five loans with IMCEC. And this has had only a good impact on her family, since it enables her to improve their food situation, pay her children’s schooling costs, and as for herself, to save a bit of money. Amy cares for her family very much, so this is why her main concern is to meet family needs.

loans.use: to purchase animals to fatten and resell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells avocados. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the 95,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of avocados. This will enable her to have enough stock for sale and increase her income. She hopes that in the future, she will own a piece of land. This is her 12th loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of avocados.

loans.use: to buy more stock of avocados

loans.name: Roxana Maribel

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 8 grado está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como motorista para una empresa privada ellos tienen dos hijos uno de 5 años que estudia primer grado y otro de 3 años que aún no estudia, solo ellos viven en la casa y solo sus 2 hijos de penden directamente de ella.

 Ella tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la distribución de productos para pequeñas tiendas de colonias, todo esto lo inició porque su hermana trabajaba para una comercial y gracias a ella comenzó a comprar productos y distribuir a tiendas, también ella trabaja vendiendo productos por catálogo labor que realizaba desde antes de dedicarse a la distribución de productos. Ella posee un vehículo donde distribuyen el producto esto lo realiza desde la 8:00 AM a 3.00 PM y muchas veces su esposo le colabora.

El crédito lo invertirá para comprar más productos como detergentes, lejía, papel higiénico, jabón para baño, jabón para ropa y granos básicos.

Su sueño principal es seguir creciendo en su negocio, obtener nuevos clientes y brindar un buen servicio y productos, brindarle la educación necesaria a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Roxana is 26 years old and studied as far as eighth grade. She lives with a partner and he works as a driver for a private firm. They have two children, one aged 5 who is in the first grade at school and a 3-year-old who does not go to school yet. Just the four of them live in the house and their children are their only direct dependents. 

For the last 2 years Roxana has made a living as a distributor of products for small neighbourhood shops. This all began because her sister worked for a company and, thanks to her, she started buying products and distributing them to shops. She also works selling products from catalogues, which she did before she became a distributor. She has a vehicle for delivering the products and does this between 8am and 3pm. Her spouse often helps her out. 

She will use the loan to buy more products such as detergents, bleach, toilet paper, soap, laundry detergent and basic grains. Her dream is to continue growing the business, get new customers and provide a good service and products. She also hopes to provide her children with the necessary education so that they can get on in life.

loans.use: to buy more products such as detergents, bleach, toilet paper, soap, laundry detergent and basic grains.

loans.name: Safiétou

texts.fr: Madame Safiétou, habite un village situé dans la petite cote où sont concentrées les activités de pêches, d’embouche, d’agriculture etc. Elle, vend des légumes et fait aussi du stockage de céréales. Elle a acquis une bonne expérience dans ce domaine où elle a fait 10 ans. Elle est active de 6 du matin a14h de l’après-midi. Grâce aux revenus de l’activité, elle appuie son mari dans les charges de la maison, les frais de scolarité et épargne un d’argent pour faire face à de probables imprévus, sinon pour préparer à pouvoir atteindre son objectif d’ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Ms. Safiétou lives in a village located in Petite Cote, where fishing, livestock farming, and agriculture are concentrated.  She sells vegetables and also stocks grains. She has acquired good experience in this domain, in which she has worked for ten years. She is active from 6 AM until 2 PM. Thanks to the revenues from this business, she supports her husband in covering household expenses and schooling costs and saving a bit of money in order to cope with the unexpected. Aside from this, it allows her to get ready to achieve her goal of opening a large store selling grocery items.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell and to stock grains

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been in a business of a beauty parlor for a period of about eight years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her best work providing services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. For this reason she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). It will allow her to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to cater to more customers time after time. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Asim

texts.en:
Asima is a 32-year-old married lady who is running a small shop where she sells cloth and dressmaking materials, such as lace, thread, buttons, etc. Her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone.  

She has been doing this business for the past three years in her community. By this time, she has retained many customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000, which she will use to buy spools of thread along with packs of lace, ribbons, and buttons in different colors. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread along with packs of lace, ribbons, and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the floor and plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Mouhamed Joseph

texts.fr:
Mouhamed Joseph est un jeune qui évolue dans le commerce de chaussures depuis maintenant 5 ans. Il est un client régulier à l’Institution et chaque fois qu’il veut renouveler son stock, il se tourne vers cette dernière. Comme c’est le cas cette fois ci, il a besoin d’une somme de 100 000F CFA pour faire une commande de chaussures d’ici la période des fêtes de Korité (fête qui marquera la fin du ramadan). Il aura donc la possibilité de faire trois, quatre voire cinq opérations d’ici là. 
Mouhamed Joseph est célibataire et vit encore chez ses parents, il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne  de la famille. 
Il rêve de construire sa propre maison un jour, avec un grand magasin où il pourra développer son activité de vente de chaussures.
texts.en:
Mouhamed Joseph is a young man who has been working  in commerce selling shoes for five years. He is a regular client at the microfinance institution. Each time he wants to renew his inventory, he turns toward the institution. This was the case at this time. And he needs the amount of 100,000 francs CFA for an order of shoes from now until the Korité feast (a holiday marking the end of Ramadan). He then will have the chance for three, four, indeed five sales cycles until then. 

Mouhamed Joseph is unmarried and still lives with his parents. He takes care of the family’s day-to-day expenses. His dream is to build his own house one day, with a large store, where he will be able to develop his business selling shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Adela Clida

texts.es:
Adela es una joven trabajadora, tiene 23 años de edad y vive en el Departamento de Ucayali junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 6 años se dedica a la agricultura, teniendo como principal cultivo la yuca, un producto muy solicitado en la zona donde reside. Tiene muchos conocimientos sobre el manejo de los cultivos es por ello que produce y ofrece productos de calidad y a un precio al alcance de todos. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Adela está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes y plaguicidas para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus tierras y así poder mejorar la calidad de sus productos, con esto obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá utilizarlo para elevar en nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adela, who is 23 years old, is a hard-working young woman. She lives with her family in the department of Ucayali. For more than 6 years she has made a living from agriculture, with cassava as her main crop, which is a very popular in the area where she lives. She has a lot of knowledge about looking after the crop and this is why she produces and sells good quality produce which is affordable for everyone. She has a great desire to get on in life and improve her family's quality of life. 

Adela is grateful to the Kiva lenders because the support they have given her will enable her to buy supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides so she can maintain her fields and so improve the quality of her produce. This will give her more income which she will be able to use to raise the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizers and pesticides) for looking after the cassava crop.

loans.name: Musingi Bora Group

texts.fr: La cliente Aime est une commerçante, vice présidente et membre du collectif d’affaires «Musingi Bora»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants, dont 3 étudient et 3 sont encore petits.  La cliente est vendeuse friperie(Rideaux). Elle installe sa marchandise au marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu d’une Institution financière de crédits. Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 ballon de rideaux. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser, vêtir, nourrir les personnes à sa charge. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Aime, is a merchant and the vice-president of the business collective “Musingi Bora”. An entrepreneur and energetic, she is 32 years old and a married mother of six children, of whom three are in school, and three are still little. This client is a vendor of used curtains. She sets ups her merchandise at the town’s busy market. She started her business with initial capital from a lending institution. Her husband is a public servant. Later on, Aime benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for four years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase a bale of curtains. Thus, she would like to grow her business and provide schooling, clothing, and food for those in her care.  

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical moment post-conflict in the country’s east.

loans.use: to purchase a bale of curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a tailoring machine and fabric

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as being kind, honest, and hard-working. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are kind and hard-working. 

Lucy will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine. Her business goal is to grow into a large tailoring shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: Madame Buganda, présidente dans le  groupe de credit  Utulivu; est  mariée à un vétérinaire  à l’âge de 47 ans.  Mère de 9 enfants  tous scolarisés, elle est vendeuse ambulante dans la ville depuis 2010.  Elle sollicite un  nouveau prêt  pour  acheter  20 litres d’huile végétale, 1kg de farine, 1 sac de braise et  5kg de sucre.  Son objectif est de devenir une grande commerçante dans les jours à venir. Elle remercie Hekima pour l’encadrement des femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Buganda, the president of the Utulivu Group, married a veterinary surgeon at the age of 47. A mother of nine children, who are all enrolled at school, she has worked as a travelling vendor in her town since 2010. She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase 20 litres of vegetable oil, one kilo of flour, one sack of charcoal and five kilos of sugar. Her goal for the future is to become an important trader. She would like to thank Hekima for the support they give to poor working women.

loans.use: to purchase 20 litres of vegetable oil, one kilo of flour, one sack of charcoal and five kilos of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is 31 years old and a married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Shanaz makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Shanaz wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 28 años de edad, asistió a la escuela hasta sexto grado ya que sus padres no le daban la importancia al estudio y no la apoyaron , está casada y tiene una hija de nueve años y su esposo ahora en día esta en USA lo cual  está pendiente de ella.

Blanca tiene experiencia en la actividad de la agricultura ya que siempre hace este trabajo a acompañada de su tío que  le ayudad en el mantenimiento del cultivo,  a ella le gusta mucho lo que es la agricultura ya que manifiesta que es de su agrado cultivar sus alimentos y obtener ingresos para  satisfacer las necesidades.  

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar fertilizantes ya que tiene sembrada una hectárea de maíz  y además ha sembrado frijol lo cual necesita darle el mantenimiento necesario para que el cultivo crezca sano.

En un futuro Blanca planea poder cultivar 4 hectáreas de maíz para tener mejores ingresos  y poder ayudar a su hija a que saque sus estudios y sea una profesional.
texts.en:
Blanca is 28 years old and attended school up to grade 6 as her parents didn't think school was important and didn't support her. She is married and has a nine year old daughter. Her husband is in the USA now and is dependent on her.

Blanca has experience in agriculture as she always does this work with her uncle who helps her ,with the maintenance of the crops. She enjoys farming expressing that it is nice to grow your own food and to receive income to pay for your necessities.

She will use the loan to buy fertilizer as she has one hectare of corn under cultivation and also has planted beans. She needs to give them the maintenance necessary for her crops to grow well. In the future Blanca plans to grow 4 hectares of corn to generate more income and be able to help her daughter with her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her bean and corn crops.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
The lending group “Freedom 1” consists of five female members, who live in the city of Teshie-Accra. This city is often visited by tourists because of its beautiful center from the colonial era. The members of the lending group are people with a spirit to fight and work and they are always striving to improve their economic stability so as to improve the lives of their families.

One of the members of this group is Adjeley. Adjeley is a kind and gentle woman who is part of the lending group “Binyomo 1”, a group which was formed by friends who help each other to achieve their goals. At each meeting they discuss various topics of interest including financial management, health issues, etc.

Adjeley is 52 years old; she is single and has grown-up children who are on their own. She lives in a family house. 

Adjeley works selling powder and she works from Monday through Saturday. She has worked in this business for 20 years. She will invest the money from the loan in the purchase of different flavors of powder and sell to customers.

loans.use: To purchase different flavors of powder

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia, a 40-year-old, married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Shazia has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on-time. She wishes to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Rafiqan

texts.en:
Rafiqan is a 46-year-old, vigorous woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. This loan will help her in meeting the orders on-time, to generate a healthier source of income. 

Rafiqan is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Mehrona

texts.ru: Мехрона жительница района Шахритус. Она разведена с мужем и живет вместе с детьми. Ей 28 лет. Мехрона сама обеспечивает семью. Она последние два года занимается торговым бизнесом, в котором помогает ее дядя-бизнесмен. Мехрона сейчас обратилась за кредитом. Дело в том, что она отложила сбережение на покупку мебели для дома, но после того как она увидела цены в магазинах, она пришла в отчаяние, что у нее не хватает денег, чтобы осуществить покупку. Единственное решение Мехрона увидела в получении кредита. Благодаря кредиту Мехрона осуществит мечту и приобретет удобную мебель для дома, что создаст хорошие условия для проживания.
texts.en: Mehrona is a 28-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She is divorced from her husband and lives with her children, whom she raises by herself. For the past two years she has been working in a retail business, which her uncle, a businessman, helps her with. Mehrona is looking for a loan since she had put aside some money to buy furniture but realized, after seeing the prices in the stores, that she didn't have enough to cover the purchase. The only option she saw was to borrow some money. Thanks to this loan Mehrona will be able to realize her dream and acquire comfortable furniture for her home, which will result in better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her home and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, one of whom attends school. She is looking after other family member (her elderly parents). She has been selling local brew from home, both wholesale and retail, for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She generates additional income from selling charcoal.

She has requested a loan of Ugx  2,000,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more local gin for sale. Her challenges include thieves and transportation. Her dream is to start selling beer, spirits and wines wholesale. She joined MCDT because of the good relationship between the SACCO members and the staff members.

She resides in her own house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for many years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice, cooking oil and bags of bread. She generates additional income from rental houses and selling charcoal. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked shop and also to build more rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice, cooking oil and bags of bread.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  is widowed   with six children, and two of her children go to school. She   also takes care of additional family members (her grandchildren).  She has a business selling chicken and has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She  has applied for a loan of 700,000  Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicken for sale.   

Joyce's major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring of rearing chickens and also to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Dalia Lineth

texts.es: Dalia tiene 20 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de un año. Ella trabaja en una tienda cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Actualmente, habita en casa alquilada pero cuenta con una casa la cual necesita reparaciones tanto del techo como de las paredes. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, arena y cemento.
texts.en: Dalia is 20 years old and lives with her life companion and one year old son. She works in a store which is close to their home which allows her to support her husband with the household expenses. Right now they live in a rented house but they have a home which needs repairs to the roof and the walls. For this reason they are requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate, wood, sand and cement.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, sand and cement to repair the roof and walls of her house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 50 years old and married to Jenipher. They are blessed with five children aged between 12 to 30 years.

He has been operating a butcher shop for the last 21 years with a monthly income of KES 120,000. He has applied for his second loan of KES 150,000 with VisionFund Kenya to buy cattle and goats for slaughter.

He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent house for the family. He hopes he grows his business and is financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cattle and goats to slaughter to add stock of meat.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a widowed woman. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are kind and hardworking. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise, clothes, shoes and basic supplies for doing handicrafts.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be calm and jovial. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for twenty years. Her business is located in a productive place. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy fertilizer and cover ploughing costs. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a better house.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and cover ploughing costs

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 32-year-old man who is married and blessed with one child. He has been in the carpentry business for the past seven years and he estimates that his monthly profit is now Kenya shillings 30,000 per month. 

He has just joined VisionFund Kenya and is now applying for his first loan which he plans to use to purchase wood, nails and glue which will be used to make some items that are needed by his clients. He hopes to use the anticipated profits to save towards the education for his child.

In future, he would like to have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails and glue for making furniture

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es:
Marta tiene 43 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela por motivos  de que sus padres no le daban la importancia al estudio, está casada y tienen tres hijos lo cual dos de ellos son profesionales.

Marta ya tiene muchos años de experiencia en lo que son los arreglos para bodas y en el servicio que le brinda a las personas en el molino, ella decidió brindar este servicio ya que puede obtener ingresos favorables, por lo cual se siente satisfecha de realizar las actividades a las cuales se dedica.

Marta utilizará el crédito para invertir en el molino ya que necesita cambiarles unas piezas para que le funcionen muy bien.
En el futuro Marta planea tener otro molino y ponerlo en otro lugar  para brindar mas servicios y tener mejores ingresos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Marta is 43 years old and did not go to school as her parents didn't feel school was important. She is married and has three children. Two of them are professionals.

Marta has many years of experience making arrangements for weddings and in providing service to people with her mill. She decided to offer this service as she can generate favorable income. So she is satisfied to carry out the activities that she does.

Marta will use the loan to invest in her mill as she needs to replace some of the pieces so that it functions well. In the future Marta plans to have another mill and operate it in a separate place so as to offer more services and have more revenue for her household.

loans.use: to invest in her mill as it needs a few replacement pieces to function well.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane lives in Miasnikyan village of Armavir region, an area that is known for its severe and cold climate. The best agricultural business for locals is cattle farming, with some limited land cultivation. Gayane lives with her only son. She keeps a small cattle herd and also cultivates the land. This is the main source of income for Gayane's household. She has already started the prep work for the autumn. To insure that she and her son are able to undertake all the necessary tasks, she has applied to SEF for a loan to acquire fertilizer, seeds and special forage for feeding pigs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and special forage for feeding pigs

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, estudió 3º grado, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos los cuales solo 1 estudia y viven en la misma casa y dependen de José.

Él se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la recolección de conchas y cangrejos también como jornalero  en la comunidad, además cultiva una hectárea de maíz la cual lo hace en la tarde junto a sus dos hijos.

El crédito  lo necesita para comprar una lancha, 4 sacos de abono para el cultivo  de maíz  y le hará unos arreglos al motor de la lancha  que tiene ya que es como obtiene los ingresos para  su  familia.

Sus sueños y proyecciones son construir su vivienda, preparar académicamente a sus hijos  y tener un buen equipo de pesca.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and completed up to third grade at school. José has a partner and two children, one of whom is in school. The children live at home and depend on José.

José makes a living as an artisan fisherman, fishing for shells and crabs. José also works as a labourer in the local community, and has a hectare of land where he grows corn in the afternoon with his two children.

José needs this loan to buy a boat, four bags of manure for growing corn, and to repair the motor on his current boat. This will help José to earn an income to support his family. 

José's dreams and plans are to build his own family, to educate his children, and to have good fishing equipment.

loans.use: to buy a boat, four bags of manure for growing corn, and to repair the motor on his current boat.

loans.name: Ana Indys

texts.es:
Ana tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, esta acompañada y su  pareja se dedica a la agricultura,  tiene dos hijos los cuales estudian y viven en la misma casa y de penden de él.

Ana  se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y en los ratos libres le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura el cual tiene una pipianera, el producto sale a venderlo y además cultiva una hectárea de maíz.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos para el cultivo de maíz y pipíán y a si poder tener una mejor producción en su cosecha y mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos. 

Sus sueños y proyecciones son construir una  vivienda digna y preparar académicamente a sus hijos  y poder cultivar un poco mas.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old and studied up to Grade 6. She is in a common-law relationship and her partner is a farmer. She has two children who are studying and live in her house with her and are dependent on her. Ana takes care of the house and in her free time she helps her husband with the farming. They have a squash patch from which they sell the produce as well as having an acre of corn under cultivation.

Ana needs the loan to buy inputs for her corn and squash crops to have higher production at harvest time and provide a better quality of living for her children. Her dreams and projects are to build a dignified house and prepare her children academically and be able to cultivate a little more.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her corn and squash crops.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a hardworking, married woman. She is the mother of seven children. She is keen to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Ten years ago, she started a business selling animals to support her husband financially. She purchases small animals, and after raising them a year or two, she sells them in her locality. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is in her 4th loan cycle and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. This will help her to purchase more cattle. She dreams of providing a prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en: Asmat, age 46, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She is doing this business with the support of her husband. She looks after the cattle and her husband sells them in the market at higher prices. She earns a good amount of income for her household expenditures. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase more animals. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.  She wishes to spend part of the profits on renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 42, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 40-year-old, vigorous lady. She has four children. She has worked selling used furniture for many years to contribute to the family income. She always has a good collection to offer to her customers. She makes enough to lead a decent life. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy good quality used furniture to increase her sales. She is in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality used furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en: Aasia is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. She is in her 8th loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of expanding her business for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase raw materials and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Gs Concepcion De Maria Group

texts.es:
