La señora   Blanca Rosa  de 35 años de edad, tiene  tres  hijos que dependen de ella, vive con sus hijos  y su esposo  en  casa propia , radica en la comunidad de  Langue  , valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 16 años  al negocio de la venta de cosméticos de los productos AVON, su venta consiste en que ella hace sus pedidos a los colaboradores de la empresa y luego le envían la caja con los productos y ella de forma ambulante los sale a vender con amigos y personas que la conocen.
 Ella al igual que sus demás compañera de grupo son personas trabajadoras que desean salir adelante.
Doña Blanca esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de más productos como cremas, lociones, lápiz de ojos, lipsticks, shampu y otros productos que se pueden vender sin hacer pedido, para poder atender mejor a sus clientes, las demás compañeras son doña ANA, que vende lo mismo que ella Nancy Yamilet  vende abarrotería en su pequeño negocio y doña Beronica ella elabora tamales de gallina, vende cuajada, verduras, etc. Ambos son personas humildes que desean salir adelante.
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio.
San Lorenzo, honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is 35 years old and has three children who still depend on her.  She lives with her children and her husband in her own home located in the community of Langue, in the southern valley of Honduras.  She has worked for the past 16 years in her cosmetics business selling Avon products. Her sales consist of making her requests to the members of the business group and then they send her the products in boxes and she sells them walking around the neighborhood amongst friends and people that she knows. 

She, like the other members of her group, is a hard-working person who wants to get ahead.  Blanca is asking for a loan for the purchase of more products like cremes, lotions, eye liner, lipsticks, shampoo and other products that she can sell without having to have people order them.  This will help her serve her customers better.  The other members of the group are Ana, who sells the same Avon products, Nancy Yamilet, who sells groceries in her small store, and Beronica who makes chicken tamales and sells milk products and vegetables.  They are all humble people who want to get ahead. Their dream is to improve their businesses.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras.  May of 2014.

loans.use: To purchase cremes, lotions, eye liner, lipsticks, shampoo and other products

loans.name: Manuel Alberto

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 24 años de edad de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en la comunidad La Palmira perteneciente al cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla LA PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  La Palmira a unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa formada por 14 socios que son de la misma comunidad,  que se dedican a la agricultura.
Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y al engorde de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos. La compra lo realiza en el mercado de Chillanes. Su meta es tener un terreno propio. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Manuel is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents in the town of La Palmira which belongs to the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

He is a member of the communal bank LA PALMIRA which is located in the town of La Palmira, about 40 minutes from the Cooperative office. The group consists of 14 members who are from the same community and who work in agriculture.

Manuel is a farmer and grows corn. He also raises pigs to fatten. He is requesting a loan to purchase pigs. His purchases will be made in a market in Chillanes. His goal is to have his own land. In his spare time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria de 57 años de edad, prepara picadas para fiestas, también vende comidas rápidas, como chuzos, postres, refrescos y frituras, Su negocio inició atendiendo el buen gusto que tiene Maria por la cocina y lo que en ella sabe hacer. Inicialmente empezó con su familia y ha ido extendiéndose  a sus vecinos, mercado con el que ha ido creciendo poco a poco, hasta llevarlo a lo actualmente tiene. Su meta es ampliarlo, fortaleciendo su infraestructura, y continuar apoyando a sus hijos en su educación superior, pero su mayor desafío es la falta de capital, para lograr de manera inmediata su meta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina de mayor tamaño, una freidora, además de que para ampliar su productividad, comprará materias primas e insumos, para elaborar comidas rápidas, como harina de trigo, condimentos, salsas, aderezos. Con esta inversión logrará mejores precios y mas productos lo cual hacen que esta inversión impulse su negocio, para cumplir sus propósitos y avanzar en su gran desafío, que de tener un mayor capital de trabajo y un mayor  equipamiento productivo.
texts.en:
Maria, 57, prepares picadas (Colombian cuisine for parties consisting of pieces of steak, chicken, corn tortilla, potato, cassava, morcilla, chorizo, and plantain). She also sells fast food such as skewered meat, desserts, drinks and fried food. She began her business serving delicious food, the way she knows how to make. Initially it began with her family and continued expanding to her neighbours, sales continued to grow slowly to bring it to what she currently has. Her goal is to expand her business, strengthen her infrastructure and continue to support her children in their education. However, her big challenge is the lack of capital to immediately achieve her goal. 

Now she is applying for a loan with Kiva. She will purchase a larger showcase, a deep-fat fryer in order to increase her productivity, raw materials and supplies to make her fast food, such as wheat flour, condiments, salsa and seasoning. With this investment she will achieve the best price and increase products which will help her business to fulfill her purpose and to overcome her big challenge; having a higher working capital and higher production equipment.

loans.use: to purchase a larger showcase, a deep-fat fryer in order to increase her productivity, raw materials and supplies to make her fast food, such as wheat flour, condiments, salsa and seasoning.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old, married, and they are blessed with two school-going children.

He has been operating a general shop for the last four years with a monthly income of KES; 25,000.He has applied for his third loan of KES. 45,000 with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying his previous loan. He will use this loan to buy assorted stock for the shop, e.g., sugar, washing detergents, and packets of sweets for sale.

He will use the anticipated profits to save and educate his children.  He hopes he grows his business and becomes financially stable.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the shop, e.g., sugar, washing detergents, and packets of sweets for sale.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en: Jared is a married man. He has three children and describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells radios, tooth brushes, torches and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more torches, radios, tooth brushes and other items to sell. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more torches, radios, tooth brushes and other items

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es:
Guadalupe, sigue manteniendo su negocio de sala de belleza y la venta de granos básicos, actualmente cuenta con más clientes por lo que necesita diversificar e incrementar la mercadería, sumado al buen servicio y la facilidad de pago que se le brinda en PADECOMSM, Ella se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, sodas, jugos, jabón, detergentes entre otros.
Con el financiamiento anterior compro insumos para la venta de granos básicos, de esta manera tiene clientes satisfechos, mejores ingresos, su vida familiar es más confortable, logra cancelar sus cuotas del crédito, pago de local, luz y agua.
texts.en:
Guadalupe continues with her businesses - a beauty salon, and selling basic supplies. She now has more customers and so, in addition to offering good customer service, Guadalupe needs to diversify and increase the merchandise that she sells. Given the handy repayment system at "PADECONSM", Guadalupe has decided to take out another loan in order to buy rice, beans, corn, soda, juice, soap, detergents and more.

Guadalupe used her previous loan to buy supplies for selling basic supplies. This kept her customers satisfied, earned her a higher income and gave her a more comfortable family life. Guadalupe also managed to pay off her loan, and pay for her premises, electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, soda, juice, soap, detergents and more.

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, por los buenos resultados que obtiene al invertir créditos en su negocio se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar lejía, jabón, detergentes, aceite, boquitas, gaseosas, dulces, pan, galletas, papel higiénico, etc., así surtirá el inventario rápidamente y continuara teniendo a sus clientes satisfechos.
Con el préstamo anterior ha mantenido la funcionando su negocio de la mejor manera, sus ventas y ganancias se han incrementado un poco, las utiliza para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Given the good results from investing loans in her business, Gloria has decided to apply for a new loan in order to buy washing-up liquid, soap, detergents, oil, snacks, fizzy drinks, sweets, bread, biscuits, toilet paper and more. With these items, Gloria can stock-up quickly and will continue to keep her customers satisfied.

Gloria's previous loan helped her to keep her business going as best as possible. Gloria's sales and profits increased a little; she used these profits in order to cover her family's basic necessities and pay off her debts.

loans.use: to buy washing-up liquid, soap, detergents, oil, snacks, fizzy drinks, sweets, bread, biscuits, toilet paper and more.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Zvart

texts.en:
Zvart is a teacher with thirty years of experience teaching in the local school. She lives in a small village called Sardarapat in one of the northern regions of Armenia, Armavir. Her family consists of her son, her daughter-in-law and little grandchildren. 

Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for the family. Her son is currently a migrant worker in Russia, working hard to support his family financially. In the village there is a high unemployment rate but a farm business enables the family's income to be more stable. Both Zvart and her son are involved in their small farm, and for a start they already have arable land with fruit and vegetables cultivated there. With the requested loan the family plans to purchase fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation. Please help Zvart with her loan to enlarge her family's farming business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Noe

texts.en: Noe is a single mother of four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (aged parents). She has had a restaurant business for years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more foodstuffs, such as bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, maize flour, and sweet and Irish potatoes. She generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works at the market all seven days of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant, and to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant, such as bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, maize flour, and sweet and irish potatoes.

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim used his previous loan to pay workers to cut his firewood. His main business is construction, together with farming and selling firewood, which have boosted his income. He started the businesses to provide for his family and educate his children, as a loving father. He faces the challenge of weather changes. He dreams of buying land and establishing a farm for livestock. Joachim has applied for a loan to pay workers to cut firewood.

loans.use: to pay workers to cut firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en: Jolly used her previous loan to buy beer to sell. She is still in the same business, running a tea room and a bar. She is facing challenges of customers who are show to pay. However, Jolly is aiming at expanding her business to new areas. Jolly has applied for a loan to add more supplies of sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to add more supplies of sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, a Ugandan, is a 26 year-old married woman with two children aged six and four, both of whom attend school. Since she likes being self-employed, she operates a retail shop and a bar. She earns additional income by farming. When she gets a loan, she would like to buy general merchandise, such as mineral water and cooking oil, to sell. Her dream is to buy land and build a good residence. Weather changes have been a threat to her farming, and defaulters have affected her business growth.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as mineral water and cooking oil, to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita, 52 years old, is separated from her husband. While her only child from her former union is already employed, Carmencita takes care of a nephew whom she raises as her own son. Her nephew is now 26 years old and is mentally challenged. She is the one supporting the medication and education of her nephew. To date, her nephew attends a special education class for special children and persons-with-disabilities in a public school near their house.

To earn their keep, Carmencita owns and manages a small store. She also sells ready-to-wear apparel and used clothing. In February 2014, Carmencita joined SEED and was able to avail a loan amounting to PhP 10,000. With this amount, she was able to add up to her stocks of soda drinks, bottled purified water and various grocery items. On her second loan now, she plans to buy 3 sacks of rice, 20 kilos of sugar and 2 large containers of cooking oil for her store. By stocking up these products, Carmencita is ensured of improved returns specially with price inflation becoming a concern.

With her earnings from this business, Carmencita is hopeful of being able to sustain the needs of her nephew in terms of medication and education.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking oil for her store.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en: ID-Ghana, a partner of Kiva.org in Accra, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Akotobu Group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to ID-Ghana/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of GHS 3,300 in order to invest in their respective businesses (ready-made slippers, silver bowls, assorted soap and dishes). Patience is the featured borrower of this group. Patience is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She sells ready-made dress slippers. She has been working in this business for eight years. With the help of this loan, Patience will invest in her business by buying ready-made dress slippers in larger quantities to add to her current stock. She is a very hardworking woman with an ambition of building her own house. Currently, she and her children live with her family.

loans.use: to buy ready-made dress slippers in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina was a former overseas Filipino worker in Korea, where she met her husband. After getting married, she and her husband decided to come back and raise their family in the country. From the last pays abroad, her husband was able to buy a motorcycle and used this for public transport service. 

In 1994, to help her husband, Edwina started selling viands from the PhP 500 that her mother-in-law advanced to her. From this, she was able to set up a small general store. In January 2014, she came to know about SEED through a friend and decided to join. She availed a first loan amounting to PhP 7,000 and used the amount to purchase canned goods for her store.

On her second loan, Edwina wants to buy bottled purified water and soda drinks for her store. She would also want to add up to her investment in the electronic load for mobile phones. These are highly demanded commodities in her area and she would like to take advantage of selling those items.

She knows life is is difficult in the country but would not want either her or her husband to be overseas workers again. She values her hands-on experience raising her children while doing business at the same time. With perseverance, Edwina hopes to see all her four children finishing school.

loans.use: To buy bottled purified water and soda drinks for her store.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, at 54, is still very much hands-on in her general store business. Starting with only PhP 5,000 investment, she was able to set up her store, and for the past twenty years, this supported their family's needs along with her husband's income from being a driver. 

As with any micro-entrepreneurs, Lolita faced various challenges in running her business. There had been a time when income became low owing to competition in her area, as well as failure to collect credit sales.  It was at this time, in 2011 that she was invited by a neighbor to join SEED. After passing the membership process, Lolita was able to avail a loan and invested this on her store - this time, adding up products that were not available in other stores in her area.

From then on, and with access to microfinance, Lolita is able to improve her business. To date, aside from the general store, Lolita also sells ready-to-wear clothes, electronic load for mobile phone and accessories. From her last loan, she was also able to have display cabinets for her store constructed. With her current loan, Lolita is aiming to buy vegetables, dried fish, sugar and cooking oil in big volumes as these are demanded in the community and not readily available from other stores.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, dried fish, sugar and cooking oil in big volumes as these are demanded in the community and not readily available from other stores.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena at 32, has five children, of which one is already in college and three are studying in high school. Even as her husband works as an overseas contract worker in the Middle East, she is compelled to engage in business by the growing needs of her family specially in terms of educational expenses.

In 2009, she started selling consigned cosmetics, apparel and footwear products. From her earnings and commissions, Rowena opened a small store in their house. With business needs increasing, Rowena contemplated on availing microloans but was dismayed with the interest rates offered. In 2012, her friend invited her to join SEED and she was eventually approved to avail a loan. From then on, Rowena was able to improve her business. From her last loan, she was able to have a separate store space constructed from an extension lot in their house.

On her 6th loan, Rowena is planning to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and processed meat products. These commodities are in demand with the opening of the school year in June. Often, to economize, families are preparing packed lunch for their children who are going to school as what Rowena also does for her children.

Rowena hopes that with her business, she will be able to assist her husband in meeting the needs of their family and specially in supporting the education of their children.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and processed meat products for her store which are in demand in preparing student's packed lunch.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil and his family hails from Capiz. His nephew, who owns an electronic repair shop in Cavite, invited him to work there. With good earnings, Ramil decided to have his family migrating in Cavite as well. After three years, his nephew's shop has been subject to demolition. It was then that Ramil, with knowledge and experience gained from working as a repairs man, decided to put up his own electronics repair shop in Silang, Cavite.

Business went well until Ramil and his family faced another challenge. In 2010, Ramil's wife died leaving him to take care of their three children. With the death of his wife, Ramil relocated his shop in his residence so he could attend to the needs of his children at the same time.

In 2012, he joined SEED and availed a loan to buy equipments for his repair shop. Since then, Ramil has been a responsible borrower and was able to improve his business as well. From junked washing machines, he was able to make those work and is renting those out in the community for his neighborhood's laundry needs. To date he has 2 units of washing machines for rent. He was also able to buy a motorcycle which he uses for providing electronics repair through home service. Ramil also mentions that through his earnings and with the loans previously provided to him, he was able to have the roof on installed in front of his house which serves as waiting area for his customers.

With this loan, Ramil is planning to buy additional junked washing machines and spare parts. These washing machines will be repaired and either sold out or be added to his washing machine for rent business. Through this, Ramil aims at improving his business and ensuring his continuous support to the needs of his children.

loans.use: To buy scrapped washing machines and spare parts to be repaired and resold or rented out in the community.

loans.name: Jenillin

texts.en:
Jenillin, 35 years old, married and with four children lives in a coastal community in Naic, Cavite. Her husband works as a fisherman. To help with the needs of the family, Jenillin set up a small store in 2004 selling mostly canned goods and grocery items which are in demand in the community. 

As earnings of fisherfolks rely on the sales of the produce, Jenillin's store has been exposed to a higher level of credit sales. Of which, she will only be able to collect at the end of the day or on a weekly basis. However difficult the situation, Jenillin managed to sustain her business for 10 years now. Jenillin makes sure that she only provide credit to neighbors with good repayment habits and stable fishing activities.

In January 2014, Jenillin was invited by a friend to join SEED. After having successfully passed the process, she was able to get a PhP 7,000 loan which she used to primarily purchase fishing net and the rest to refurbish stocks of canned goods from her store. 

On her second loan now, Jenillin wants to buy additional stocks of rice, sugar, milk and coffee in bigger volume. These would help her support the needs of her customers which is an advantage over going to the market in the town proper.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of rice, sugar, milk and coffee for her store.

loans.name: Arastas

texts.en:
Arastas is a 33-year-old male, married, with three children, two of whom go to school. 

Arastas has been operating a retail shop on a busy street for the last four years, so as to have a source of income to look after his family. 

Arastas wants money to buy sugar, soap, salt, maize flour, and other merchandise to sell. 

Constructing a residential house for his family is his dream. Arastas is hard-working, however, low capital is a challenge.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap, maize flour, and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish repairing  their house roof that he started with the previous loan

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn, 35 years old, married, and mother to her 6 year-old daughter, helps her husband sustain their family's needs through her businesses.

Before bearing a child, Gelyn used to work in a factory at the Export Processing Zone in Cavite. With motherhood, she decided to resign and set up her own business so she can personally attend to the needs of her daughter. For four years now, Gelyn has been cooking and selling fried chicken. 

To start up her business and to address her business needs from time to time, Gelyn resorts to availing credit under usurious interest terms (20% interest for a 40-day loan term). While terms are difficult, Gelyn manages her debts by ensuring proper loan use for business and with the support of her husband who works as a cab driver. With diligence, Gelyn was also able to set up a small store in their residence.

In March 2014, Gelyn became a partner of SEED and availed a loan of PhP 5,000 which she used to buy stocks for her store. On her second loan term, she is planning to buy additional stocks of cooking oil, flour, and fresh chicken meat for her fried chicken business. With these, Gelyn hopes to increase the volume of her cooked products to cater the increase in demand following her transfer to a better stall location in a flea market near her residence.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of cooking oil, flour and chicken for her fried chicken business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow who has seven children, five of whom attend school. She also cares for her mother and sister, and has earned a living by selling green bananas in a local market for the last ten years. She works six days a week, does not have any other source of income, and is requesting a loan for 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT- SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell. Her challenges include the seasonal nature of her business. Her dream is became a supplier and buy a vehicle to use in her business. She joined MCDT because the organization serves women and their children. Sarah rents a house with access to electricity but no piped-in water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas to sell.

loans.name: Dusabe Group

texts.fr:
Scholastique  fait partie du groupe  Dusabe et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 51 ans et est mariée à Ndayi, un maçon. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 9 à 31 dont  5 étudient. 

Elle  fait le commerce de chèvre depuis  15 ans. 

Elle est à son seizième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Scholastique is part of the group Dusabe and lives in Gitega. She is 51 years old and married to Ndayi, a mason. Together they have eight children, from 9 to 31 years old, of whom five are students.

Scholastique has been doing commerce in goats for fifteen years.

She is on her sixteenth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goats to resell, so as to earn more

loans.use: to purchase many goats to resell, in order to earn more

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is a farmer (corn and potatoes), age 47 years who lives with his spouse and 4 children.  His spouse Simona also helps with their agriculture.   
It is clear that Fabian and Simona work hard to maintain their family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  The kerosene lamps, which must be lit by striking a match, produce substantial contamination in the house, present a risk of fire and produce a very low level of lighting. 
He mentioned that he hopes to improve the security of his family and help the children study with electric lighting.  To improve living conditions for his family, Fabian is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.  With this system the illumination in the house will be with highly efficient and long life LED lamps.  With electrical light it is much easier to study and other activities are much more pleasant, such as cooking in the kitchen or gathering the family at the dinner table or in the living room. The solar electric system can power a television and radio which provide entertainment, news and education in this rural area providing better access to information from within the country and around the world. The system can also maintain the charge in a cellular telephone to allow essential communications from this rural area.
In addition to the reduction of toxic fumes from kerosene lamps, the solar electric system reduces the family’s energy costs by eliminating the cost of kerosene, the cost of dry cell batteries for radios and the cost of cell phone charging with related cost of transport to an urban center for charging.  These savings will provide Fabian a return on his investment in the solar electric system.  The solar panel has a 25 year warranty. Soluz Honduras installs, guarantees, and maintains the system to assure that the benefits will continue for many years. 
A positive global environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions (0.25 tons per year) that results from the elimination of kerosene consumption

loans.use: To buy a solar energy Systema for his home

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, three attending school. She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last 10 years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.
She has requested for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Her challenges include transportation. Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the school fees loan product.
She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Antoinette's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  a été créé en 05 Décembre  2000 à l’occasion de son inauguration. Ce groupe composé de femmes qui sont issues du même village, très solidaire entre elles, ces femmes  jouissent d’une très bonne entente et d’une réputation de femmes travailleuses. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Antoinette  (debout à droite avec une main  levée), est  l’emprunteuse vedette. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, est  mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 02 filles et 04 garçons. Elle est une femme très expérimentée dans l’activité dans la transformation de produits locaux, elle est aussi vendeuse de porcs dans sa commune et dans un pays frontalier. Elle achète de jeune porcs auprès des villageois les engraisse pendant une quarantaine de jours pour la revente à l’état ou faire des abattages à l’occasion des fêtes et autres cérémonies religieuses.
 
Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter en plus d’une dizaine de jeunes porcs, des sacs d’arachide non décortiqués à 10 000 F Cfa et payer 2 000 de frais de décorticage pour la transformation.

Les bénéfices tirés de son activité lui permettront d’accroître son épargne et de  participer très activement à la gestion des charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This [group] was created on December 5, 2000 when [the ’banc villageois’ was] inaugurated. The group is composed of women who are from the same village. Having very good solidarity between them, these women get along very well together and enjoy a reputation as hard-working. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Antoinette (standing at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower. She is 49 years old and a married mother of six children, of whom two are girls, and four are boys. She is a woman with a lot of experience in the business of processing local products. She is also a vendor of pigs in her community and in a neighboring country. She purchases young pigs from villagers and fattens the pigs for about forty days. She then resells them at the right time or has them slaughtered  for celebrations or religous events. 

With her new loan, she is going to purchase over a dozen young pigs and some sacks of unshelled peanuts at 10,000 francs CFA and to pay the cost of shelling them for processing. 

The profits from her business will enable her to grow her savings and to help in an active manner in managing household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more than a dozen young pigs and sacks of unshelled peanuts and to cover the cost of shelling

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, two attending school. She has been selling green bananas, vegetables, tomatoes, pumpkins and yams in the market at retail for the last 15 years, working seven days a week. She also earns income from renting out machines for making popcorn.
She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGS from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more green bananas, tomatoes, onions and fruit for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and changes in prices. Her dream is to increase her stock of fruit and green bananas. She joined MCDT because of the successful members of her community who are members of the SACCO.
She resides in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, tomatoes, onions and fruit for sale.

loans.name: Awa Peulh

texts.fr:
Madame Awa est une femme leader et très ambitieuse qui avec le programme a réalisé des investissements rentables par l’acquisition d’ustensiles de cuisine et chaises qu’elle loue durant les événements religieux et sociaux. Veuve de son état  et âgée de 57 ans, elle a en charge a elle seul sans soutien d’aucun parent deux de ses enfants de même que deux de ses petits fils. 

Elle est vendeuse de légumes au marché central. Elle a une expérience très considérable dans cette activité et a une clientèle fidèle car ses produits sont de bonne qualité. 

Avec ce crédit elle compte acquérir auprès des producteurs des plans de salade à raison de 15 000 F CFA l’unité pour la revente par tas de 200, 300, 350 voir 400 FCFA ou même plus suivant le besoin du client.

En phase de finition pour sa maison elle pense pouvoir finir la clôture avec les bénéfices que l’activité va générer.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa is a woman leader and very ambitious, and she has made profitable investments in the program by acquiring kitchen utensils and chairs that she rents out for social or religious events. A widow, she is 57 years old and supports by herself, without family help, two children in addition to her two grandchildren. 

Awa is a vendor of vegetables at the central market. She has considerable experience in this business and has a loyal customer base, since her products are of good quality. 

With this loan, she intends to acquire from producers some platters of salad at 15,000 francs CFA each. She will resell them in bunches at 200, 300, 350, and even 400 francs or according to customer needs. 

Finishing up her house, she is thinking about completing her fence by using the profits generated from her business.

loans.use: to acquire platters of salad to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green groceries from producers to sell.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 26 years old, married and the father of one child who is four years old. For the last nine years, he has earned a living by repairing motorbikes and also by offering transport services. He earns about 40,000 Kenyan shillings a month, which he uses to meet his family's needs. Andrew has applied for his second loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy a new motorbike to provide transportation services to his clients. In the future, he would like to expand his business and become more successful.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Joebert

texts.en:
Joebert joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2014. He appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. He is a member in good standing and actively participates in the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000. This loan is intended to purchase additional sacks of feed and chickens. Joebert hopes to live a happy life and earn an adequate income from his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sandals to strengthen her inventory

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 41-year-old married woman who is blessed with five children, ages 12 to 26. She has been poultry farming for the last six years and has been able to enjoy good profits of about 5,000 KES every month. Her husband is employed and brings in income to support the family.

Monica just joined VisionFund Kenya after being introduced by one of its officers and has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy five chickens and layers mash feed. She will use the income to repay her loan.

In future she would like to have a flourishing business and a healthy family.

loans.use: to buy five chicken and layers mash feed.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta lives with her family in Ararat village in the Ararat region of Armenia. Julieta's main income comes from the family's farming business. They keep cattle and cultivate the land. Their machinery is very old and often breaks down. With the help of this loan Julieta and her son will be able to purchase new farming machinery, fertilizer and seed. 
Please help Julieta's loan to be funded.

loans.use: to purchase new farming machinery, fertilizer and seed.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a repeat client, aged 30 years. He is married with a 6-year-old child who attends school. He has applied for a loan of 4.5M Ugandan shillings (UGX) to buy fertilizer and a motorcycle for his businesses. For 14 years, he has been operating a business farming tea, which he does eight hours a day and six days a week. His customers are tea traders. 

Nathan also has a boda boda (motorcycle taxi) business to supplement his daily income. He hopes to be financially stable and to be able to look after his family after getting the loan money and investing it in his businesses. He is faced with the challenges of the dry season and price fluctuations which affect his business negatively. However, through hard work, he is determined to grow his businesses significantly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for hired labor to help with the coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: metal sheets, wood, nails, sand, and cement to repair the roof and put a concrete floor into her house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel de 38 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposa y su hijo, él posee una panadería en el cual elabora pan francés, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el pan está hecho con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además tiene el mejor servicio de la zona; Samuel es un hombre muy activo siempre con la mejor disposición para dedicarse a su labor, el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, Samuel tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Samuel is 38 years old and lives in his family's house with his wife and their son. He has a bakery where he makes French bread. Recently he has had a lot of customers, as the bread is made with the highest quality materials and he sells it at affordable prices. He also has the best service in the area. 

Samuel is a very active man who is always willing to dedicate himself to his work. He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will enable him to buy flour wholesale. Samuel is confident that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life in this way.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes qui en plus des liens de solidarité et parental qui les unies, viennent d’avoir quatre cycles qui ont soudé d’avantage ces liens. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 52 ans et mère d’un garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de légume frais (carotte, chou, navet…) et divers autres condiments qu’elle achète à l’occasion de la tenu du marché hebdomadaire pour la revente au détail dans le village.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter deux paniers d’aubergine, deux seaux de pâte d’arachide à 24 000 F CFA, un bidon d’huile raffinée de 20 litres à 15 000 F CFA pour la revente au village.

Ses  bénéfices, lui servent à renforcer son épargne et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille sur le plan de la nourriture et sanitaire.
texts.en:
This group was set up on October 18, 2012 and carries the name of the village where it is housed. Within the group are women who, in addition to ties of solidarity and kinship uniting them, just finished four loan cycles, which have further strengthened these ties. The women have as their main work small-scale commerce along with rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Fatou (standing at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 52 years old and a married mother of one boy. She is active in selling fresh vegetables (carrots, cabbage, turnips, …) and a variety of other condiments that she purchases at the weekly market. Then she sells the good at the retail level in the village. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 2 baskets of eggplant, 2 pails of peanut butter at 24,000 francs CFA, and a 20-liter container of refined oil at 15,000 francs to resell in the village. 

Her profits will be used to bolster her savings and to improve her family’s living conditions regarding nourishment and healthcare.

loans.use: to purchase eggplant, peanut butter, and refined oil to resell in the village

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes qui en plus des liens de solidarité et parental qui les unies, viennent d’avoir quatre cycles qui ont soudé d’avantage ces liens. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatou (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de 05 enfants  dont 04 garçons et une fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de produit alimentaires (sucre cristalline, thé vert, et divers bonbons pour enfant) et des épices. Elle achète sa marchandise au marché hebdomadaire communal pour la revente au détail dans son village.

Avec ce prêt, elle désire acheter une grosse de thé vert pour 9 000 F CFA, un sac de sucre à 22 750 F CFA et le reste pour diverses sucreries.

Les bénéfices servent à aider son mari dans les charges de la famille ainsi qu’a assurer une meilleure scolarité aux enfants.
texts.en:
This group was set up on October 18, 2012 and carries the name of the village where it is housed. Within the group are women who, in addition to ties of solidarity and kinship uniting them, just finished four loan cycles, which have further strengthened these ties. The women have as their main work small-scale commerce along with rainy-season farming. 

Ms. Fatou (standing at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 51 years old and a married mother of five children, of whom four are boys, and one is a girl. Ms. Fatou is active in selling grocery items (crystalline sugar, green tea, and a variety of candies for children), and spices. She purchases her merchandise at the weekly communal market and then resells the goods retail in her village. 

With this loan, she wishes to purchase a quantity of green tea at 9,000 francs CFA, a bag of sugar at 22,750 francs. and a variety of sweets. 

The profits will be used to help out her husband in covering family expenses, as well as to ensure a better education for the children.

loans.use: to purchase green tea, sugar, and variety of candies

loans.name: Dieynaba's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été mis en place le 18 Octobre 2012 et porte le nom du village qui l’abrite. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes unies par des liens de solidarité et de parenté. En plus du commerce les femmes pratiquent l’aviculture et l’agriculture.

Madame Diénaba (debout à l’extrême  gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons et 02 filles. C’est une femme très active dans la vie du banc villageois, son activité s’inscrit dans la vente de denrées alimentaires : huile de palme, sucre, lait en poudre, bouillons, thé vert, …. Elle achète sa marchandise en gros et demi au marché central de sa localité pour la revente au détail dans le village. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter un bidon d’huile de palme de 20 litres, du sucre cristalline 05 paquets de lait en poudre 500 gr deux paquets de bouillons et du thé vert.

Les bénéfices servent à aider son mari dans les charges de la famille ainsi qu’a assurer une meilleure scolarité aux enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on 18th October 2012 and is named after the village where its members live. It brings together women who are united through the bonds of solidarity and family. As well as retail, these women also practise poultry farming and agriculture.

Diénaba (the woman standing to the far left at the end of the back row with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother of four boys and two girls. She plays a very active role in the life of the banc villageois. Her business involves the selling of foodstuffs: palm oil, sugar, powdered milk, stock, green tea... She buys her merchandise in bulk from the central market in her area so that she can resell it at retail in the village. She has benefited from many positive experiences in this field.

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing one 20-litre can of palm oil, granulated sugar, five 500-gram packets of powdered milk and two packets of stock and green tea. 

The profits will allow her to aid her husband with the family's expenses, as well as ensuring that their children receive a better education.

loans.use: to purchase one 20-litre can of palm oil, granulated sugar, five 500-gram packets of powdered milk and two packets of stock and green tea

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has one child who goes to school. She has been operating a restaurant in the market for the last five years, working six days a week. She does not have another source of income.
She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy sacks of rice and Irish potatoes, cooking oil and plastic chairs for the business. Her challenges include seasonality and fluctuation of prices for the different inputs that she uses in her business. Her dream is to be able to serve all meals in a day and sell drinks as well. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans.
She lives in her house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of rice and Irish potatoes, cooking oil and plastic chairs for the business.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 32-year-old married woman and has two children ages 2 and 13. She sells cereals in her area and makes a profit of about 4,000 KES per month.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to use it to buy two bags of maize for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay her loan.

In the future, she would like to see her business expand and be able to educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: to buy two bags of maize

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet James, a 36-year-old husband, father and farmer from Eldoret. His 1.5-acre farm is located at Lelmokwo location, which is close to the homes of world-class marathon runners. For four years now, he has been practicing horticulture and poultry farming for a living, with the help of family members and one employee.
 
James is seeking a loan to purchase a Fresian dairy cow. This cow produces more than 15 litres of milk daily. Income from milk sales is enough to repay the loan and save some money comfortably.

James believes hard work and determination will bear him fruit. He projects that, eventually, dairy farming will outperform all other activities. By virtue of his background, he has an upper-hand in running the livestock business. “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers,” he says.

Make James’ dream come true. He enjoys physical work and handling dairy animals. He is very realistic about the scale of his operation. His dream is to produce farm-fresh milk and dairy products for friends and neighbours. His family will benefit from the modest profits he will generate.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more farm materials to facilitate his daily progress.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs, pants, shirts, skirts, blouses, dresses, and t-shirts for her business

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 23-year-old Ugandan man who is single. He ventured into the business world two years ago and operates a retail shop stocked with general merchandise. His plan is to expand his business into a wholesale store, thus becoming a major supplier to the entire town. He hopes to buy land and build a good house if he gets the money. A major challenge he faces are defaulters who take his stock. Richard needs a loan to buy general merchandise like bread, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like bread, salt and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano de 71 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado comenta que sus padres no lo pusieron a estudiar debido a que no contaban con los recursos económicos para que él continuara con sus estudios en lugar de eso lo pusieron a trabajar la tierra y el cuido de ganado que poseían los vecinos de esta manera él tenía desde pequeño una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su familia.

 Actualmente,  está casado vive en su casa junto a su esposa y dos de sus hijas ya que los otros hijos han formado sus familias y viven en otros lugares, las que viven con él una estudia el último ciclo universitario en mercadotecnia, la otra estudio hasta 3° grado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, en la casa solo vive con su esposa y dos hijas.
	
Victoriano se dedica a trabajar la agricultura desde que él era un niño ya que al no tener la oportunidad de estudiar sus padres lo pusieron a cultivar la tierra de esta manera aprendió desde que era un niño a trabajar duro y así salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, aparte de esto él se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años al cuido de ganado compra y vende y también tiene para la producción de lácteos, en la agricultura se dedica él solamente,  ya que su esposa pasa realizando los quehaceres del hogar junto a su hija mientras la otra está estudiando, todos son una familia muy unida él tiene que levantarse a las 4:00 de la mañana para ordeñar el ganado y darle de comer para ir a trabajar donde tiene sus cultivos durante todos los días de la semana siempre pasa la misma rutina para llevarle a su familia el alimento y darles una mejor condición de vida.

Con el crédito comprara una vaca parida,  para extraer la leche y procesarla para luego vender sus derivados de esta manera tendrá un ingreso extra en su bolsillo con el cual le dará una mejor vida a su familia, su vida mejorara ya que el tendrá un activo más en su casa y tendrá la producción de lácteos que sumada a la que ya tiene le generara un ingreso mejor que con el que actualmente cuenta, teniendo el dinero a tiempo el podrá realizar el negocio de la compra del semoviente a un precio justo.  

Él quiere para su futuro que su hija que está estudiando pueda graduarse con todos los honores y realiza un trabajo digno y acorde a sus estudios desea también realizar mejoras en su vivienda hacerla más grande, ya que piensa que cuando sus hijas se casen vivan con él para ver crecer a sus nietos, a quienes le enseñara a realizar trabajos agrícolas para que ellos también puedan desempeñarse en la vida y puedan llevar el sustento a sus hogares cuando los formen, desea que todos sus esfuerzos sean aprovechados por su familia y ser muy recordado por ellos.
texts.en:
Victoriano is 71 years old and studied through second grade.  He says his parents did not send him to school since they did not have the financial resources for him to continue and instead he worked in the fields and caring for the livestock that his neighbors owned.  He has been a source of income to help his family since he was small.  He is currently married and lives in his house with his wife and two of his daughters, since his other children have started their own families and live in other places.  One of the children that lives with him is in the last semester of a university degree in marketing and the other attended school through third grade.  His wife cares for their home.  His wife and two daughters are the only ones who live with him.

Victoriano has worked as a farmer since he was a child since he did not have the opportunity to attend school.  His parents sent him to work in the fields, so he learned as a child to work hard and move forward with the household expenses.  In addition, he has also worked for many years caring for livestock.  He buys and sells them and also keeps them to make dairy products.  He works as a farmer alone, since his wife does the housework together with his daughter while his other daughter is studying.  They are a very united family.  He has to get up at 4:00am to milk the livestock and feed them to go to work where he has his crops.  Every day of the week he always does the same routine to bring his family food and give them better living conditions.
	
He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow to extract milk and process it to later sell its derivatives.  This will allow him to have extra income in his wallet so that he can give his family a better life.  His life will improve since he has another asset in his house and he will have dairy production which added to what he has, will generate more income than what he has now.  Having the money on time will allow him to purchase the livestock at a good price.

He hopes that in the future his daughter will be able to graduate with honors and find a good job in her field.  He also hopes to make improvements to his home to make it larger, since he thinks that when his daughters get married, they will live with him so he can see his grandchildren grow up.  He will teach them to do farm work so that they can also succeed in life and support their households when they start them.  He hopes that all of his efforts will be appreciated by his family and remembered by them.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
Productos de calidad y una sonrisa amable es lo primero que recibes al poner un pie en la pulpería de Alicia, una señora que día a día lucha por lograr sus ideales. Tiene 57 años, está casada y tiene un hijo, mayor e independiente. Inició en el mundo de los negocios hace 18 años, estableció un pequeño bar, pero fracaso; después puso una pequeña pulpería la cual ha venido creciendo poco a poco, todo gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, sin olvidar el apoyo incondicional que recibe por parte de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su negocio, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; condimentos, golosinas, gaseosas, refrescos, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza entre otros. Alicia deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que anhela ganar más clientela para obtener mejores ingresos y de esta manera lograr establecer otro negocio. Su meta es seguir trabajando, administrar bien su negocio, para lograr un futuro seguro y tranquilo.
texts.en:
Quality products and a smile are the first things you receive when you enter Alicia's small grocery store. Alicia is a woman who works each day to achieve her ideals. She is 57 years old, married, and has one son, who is economically independent. She started out in the world of business 18 years ago. She started a small bar, but it wasn't successful. After that she opened a small grocery store which has been slowly growing, thanks to her hard work and dedication and the unconditional support that she has received from her family.

She is requesting a loan to increase her business's production. She needs to buy basic grains such as rice and beans and also condiments, sweets, soft drinks, dairy products, and cleaning products, among other things. Alicia is putting her trust in the loan because she very much wants to gain more customers so she can earn a better income, so that she will be able to open another business. Her goal is to continue working and manage her business well so that she can have a sure and peaceful future.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice and beans and also condiments, sweets, soft drinks, dairy products, and cleaning products, among other things.

loans.name: Rosali

texts.es:
Rosali es una persona de 42 año de edad, muy trabajador y responsable con excelentes principios morales es muy conocido en su comunidad, por ser una persona muy dedicada al servicio a los de más y buena educación lo que lo han llevado a ser muy respetado por sus vecinos y de más personas de la comunidad.

Él vive con su familia su esposa, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos de su hogar,  además vive con una hija y dos nietos. Él se dedica a la agricultura especialmente, a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y maicillo,  él se creció con su padre y su nivel educativo es de 4° grado y el motivo por el cual ya no continuo sus estudios fue por la falta de recursos económicos y por lo lejos que le quedaba su centro educativo a medida que trascurrió el tiempo adquirió experiencia y muchos conocimientos sobre la agricultura y es la actividad, que en la actualidad se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos

vende casi el 50% de sus cosechas y la demás queda para el consumo de su familia, el lugar de su trabajo le queda a 3 km de su casa y a realizar esta actividad se suma la ayuda de uno de sus hijos quien le ayuda en horarios de 6:00 am a 11 pm, ya que realiza sus estudios de educación básica por la tarde en la escuela de su comunidad.  


El dinero será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, los cuales serán empleados en los cultivos de maíz y frijol, ya que esta época es de siembra y es necesario aplicarle las respectivas dosis de fertilizante para tener una mejor producción y llevar el sustento diario a su familia. 

Las metas que él tiene a futuro son las de ampliar sus cultivos y diversificarlos, en cuanto a sus hijos y nietos apoyar en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica, ya que manifiesta que uno de sus nietos quiere prepararse y estudiar para veterinario, y todo esto lo va lograr con la inversión de sus ganancias el buen manejo de un nuevo crédito, ya que cuenta con mucha experiencia en el manejo de créditos para la agricultura.
texts.en:
Rosali, age 42, is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He has excellent moral values, and he is well-known in his community for being a person who is very devoted to serving others and for having good manners.  This has caused him to be very well-respected by his neighbors and other people in the community.

He lives with his family; his wife, who does the household chores; a daughter; and two grandchildren.

He is a farmer, and he grows basic grains like corn, beans, and sorghum.  He grew up with his father, and he has a fourth grade education.  The reason that he did not continue his education was the lack of financial resources.  His school was far away, and as time passed he acquired experience and a lot of knowledge about agriculture.  This is the business activity that has now become his main source of income.

He sells almost 50% of his harvest.  The rest is for his family’s consumption.  The place where he works is three kilometers from his house.  He does this work, and he is helped by ones of his children from the hours of 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.  This is because he goes to the community school in the afternoon.

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, which will be used on his corn and bean crops.  It is now the planting season, and fertilizer needs to be applied in order to have a better production and to bring daily sustenance to his family.

The goals that he has for the future are to expand and diversify his crops.  Regarding his children and grandchildren, his goal is to support them in everything that is necessary for their preparation and academic formation.  He states that one of his grandsons wants to prepare to study to be a veterinarian.  He will achieve all of this with the investment of his profits and the good management of a new loan.  He has a lot of experience with the management of agricultural loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
Juan tiene 38 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por lo que solo aprendió a firmar, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos entre 5 y 11 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la comunidad, y solamente su pareja e hijos dependen de él.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que realiza desde muy pequeño y que aprendió junto a su padre, ahora está enseñándoselo a sus hijos, Juan tiene otra fuente de ingresos ya que posee un vehículo que le permite realizar viajes y así obtener ingresos extra para los gastos de la familia, sus horarios de trabajo en la agricultura es de 6:00 AM a 12.00 MD y con el vehículo a todo hora está listo para trabajar.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para invertirlo en una hectárea de maíz que está cultivando, cancelará la mano de obra, comprará herbicidas y fertilizantes que le permitan obtener una buena cosecha.

Su sueño principal es obtener una buena cosecha para responder con el compromiso obtenido con el préstamo, de igual forma el está pensando en el futuro de sus hijos y espera apoyarlos en lo que sea necesario para qe logren seguir estudian y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan is 38 years old. He did not have the opportunity to study as he only learned to sign. He is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children who are 5 and 11 years old who are studying in the community. Only his wife and children depend on him.

Juan is in agriculture for a living. He worked from a very young age and learned together with his father. Now he is teaching his children. Juan has another source of income as he has a vehicle that allows him to do trips and obtain extra income for the family expenses. His work schedule for agriculture is from 6:00 AM to 12:00 PM and he is ready to work with his vehicle at all hours.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to invest in a hectare of corn that he is growing. It will pay for manual labor, herbicides and fertilizers that allow him to obtain a good harvest.

His main dream is to obtain a good harvest to respond to the promise that comes with the loan. In this way he is thinking of the future of his children and hopes to support them with what is necessary to be able to continue studying and be professionals.

loans.use: to invest in a hectare of corn that he is cultivating, to pay for manual labor and to purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is married and has nine children, ages 30, 28, 26, 24, 22, 20, 18, 15 and 13 years old. He has been trading goats since 2004 so that he can generate income and support his family. His customers are also goat traders. 

He has applied for a loan of 1.5M UGX. He is a hard working man who works 12 hours per day and three days per week on his goat trading business. He also sells coffee from his own plantation to supplement his monthly income. 

In the future, Laban hopes to grow his businesses and, in the long run, educate all of his children. He believes this loan will help advance his goals. He is faced with the challenge of competition but is ready to beat it through hard work.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Alvaro Francisco

texts.es: Alvaro es habitante de santa maría de fantasma acá nació y ha crecido rodeado de su familia y vecinos de la misma comunidad , dice  que el nunca fue a la escuela solo a aprendido a hacer su firma  ya que no había  en ese entonces escuela cerca de la comunidad por eso no estudio , se dedica a la agricultura de eso sobrevive y mantiene a su esposa y sus dos hijos , dice que su familia son su todo su felicidad mas grande por los que  se esfuerza para que ellos estudien ya que el no pudo hacerlo , carecen de tener energía eléctrica en su vivienda el quiere darles un mejor nivel de vida a su familia es por tal razón que desea aplicar a tramite de crédito para comprar un sistema solar e instalarlo en su casa de esta manera su familia podrá disfrutar de hacer actividades familiares.
texts.en:
Alvaro lives in Santa Maria de Fantasma. He was born and raised here, surrounded by his family and neighbors from the same community. He says that he never went to school; he only learned to sign his name, because at the time, there was no school near the community, so he wasn't able to study. 

He works in agriculture, which provides him a living and supports his wife and two children. He says that his family is everything to him, his greatest happiness. He works hard so they can study, since he wasn't able to. They don't have electricity in their home. He wants to give his family a better standard of living, that's why he wants to apply for a loan to buy a solar energy system and install it on his house. That way, his family will be able to enjoy family activities.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.en:
Maria Gabriela is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Maria Gabriela is 49 years old and married with two sons. She lives in a house with her relatives and sells different products such as toys and perfumes using a catalog. 

Maria says that she enjoys spending time with her sons, one of whom has a disability so most of her spare time is spent with him. She is asking for a loan to buy some merchandise to increase her sales and also to pay for her son's music academy.

She started the business four years ago and her biggest accomplishment is being able to maintain it and provide support for both of her sons.

loans.use: To stock up her business with toys and perfumes, looking forward to pay for her son's music academy.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya is a male Ugandan aged 43. He is married to Topista and they have nine children, ages 3 to 27. They are residents of rural Kagadi.
His main business is the sale of bricks and carpentry work, a business he started in 2010 and which has helped him to sustain his family.
He has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX to make more bricks for sale. He hopes to pay back the loan after selling his bricks.
He faces challenges of changing weather, especially during the rainy seasons which affects his business.
He is hard working and thanks Kiva for a job well done.

loans.use: To make bricks to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофат молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 26 лет. У нее трехлетний сын и годовалая дочь. Она живет в районе Кубадиён с мужем, детьми, свекром и свекровью. Их семья занимается растениеводством. Сама Шарофат занимается этой деятельностью уже три года. Она научилась технике выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур у своего свекра. Сейчас им необходимо обработать посевы, чтобы в будущем получить хороший урожай. С такой целью Шарофат обратилась за кредитом для купли минеральных удобрений. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Sharofat is a 26-year old married woman. She has a three-year old son and a one-year old daughter. She lives in the Qubadiyon Region with her husband and parents-in-law. Their family grows farm produce. Sharofat has been in this line of work for three years. She learned the techniques of growing farm produce from her father-in-law. At present they need to treat the soil in order to  obtain a good harvest in the future. This is why Sharofat has applied for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers. She is hoping for your support.

loans.use: to buy  mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Djagne Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes, les membres du groupe Djagnè sont majoritairement  mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 36 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et  de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Les membres du groupe font la vente des légumes (concombres et laitues), arachides, tubercules et poissons fumés. Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à  Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont  à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adiaratou (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente de légumes (concombres et laitues). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 6 sacs de concombres et 5 corbeilles de laitues. Elles s’approvisionnent en légumes au marché de Médine. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à Djelibougou et à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Adiaratou compte  réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 140 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en: Made up of 6 women, the Djagnè group's members are, in general, married in monogamous households. On average, they are 36 years old and have 6 children. They all live in Djelibougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They know one another through parental ties, neighborhood relations, and their revenue-making businesses. The members of the group sell vegetables (cucumbers and lettuce), peanuts, tubers, and smoked fish. In the interest of building up their inventory, the members of the group decided to appeal to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle. Ms. Adiaratou (the woman seated in the center of the photo) has a good reputation in the sale of vegetables (cucumbers and lettuce). She expects to use her loan to buy 6 bags of cucumbers and 5 baskets of lettuce. They stock up on vegetables at the market in Médine. The resale takes place for cash and for credit in Djelibougou to a clientele made up largely of women. With this loan, Ms. Adiaratou expects to make an average monthly profit of 140,000 francs CFA which will be used to ensure her children's education and healthcare.

loans.use: Achat des légumes

loans.name: Julio Ricardo

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre  de 37 años de edad soltero y padre de 2 hijos.
Él vive del comercio desde muy niño, no logró terminar sus estudios secundarios porque tenía que trabajar para ayudar a su familia. Desde la edad de 7 años su madre lo colocó al frente de las ventas y desde ese día se dedica al comercio: ¨hé vendido toda mi vida, de todo; zapatillas, ropa, juguetes, actualmente vendo relojes en el mercado cambio constantemente y seguramente ya cambiaré de producto¨.
Su vida la comparte junto a sus dos hijos quienes al momento se encuentran en la escuela primaria por las mañanas en las tardes ayudan a su padre y también realizan las tareas de su escuela.
Julio sueña con tener su auto propio para salir con sus hijos a pasear, actualmente él se encuentra tratando de comprar un inmueble porque vive en alquiler en una casa demasiado pequeña, los niños crecen cada día más. Es por ese motivo que julio solicita un préstamo para dar adelanto para la compra de un bien inmueble para convertirlo en el hogar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio is a thirty-seven year old single father of two children. He has made his living in sales since childhood and was not able to finish secondary school because he had to work to help his family. Beginning at the age of seven, his mother started him selling and from that day he has worked in sales. "I have been selling all my life, everything: tennis shoes, clothing, toys and right now I am selling watches in the market. I change goods constantly and I´m sure I will change products again." 

He shares his life with his two children, who at the moment are in primary school in the mornings. In the afternoons, they help their father and also do their homework for school. Julio dreams of having his own car to take his children for a ride. Right now he is trying to buy a house because he is renting a house that is too small. The children are growing every day. It´s for this reason that Julio is asking for a loan to make an advance payment on a piece of property to turn into a home for his children.

loans.use: to make an advance payment on a building

loans.name: Tempora Mercedes

texts.es:
Tempora Mercedes tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, vive en casa propia en el Centro Poblado de Laynas una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de animales menores, es conocida por el buen servicio que ofrece con la venta de chicha de jora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo que es materia prima para la elaboración de esta bebida.

Con el apoyo del prestamo podra preparar mayor cantidad de chicha de jora y de esta manera tendra mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tempora Mercedes is 47 years old and married with four grown-up children. She lives in her own house in the village of Laynas, which is a rural district of La Matanza. The main industry in her village is agriculture, trade and cattle-raising. It is located in Morropon province, part of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru. She works selling "chicha de jora" [traditional corn liquor] (a beverage native to the Incas), beer, and raising small animals. She is well-known for the good service that she offers when selling the "chicha." She is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy yellow corn, which is the core ingredient used to make this drink. 

With the support of the loan, she will be able to make a larger quantity of chicha de jora and thus increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like maize, sugar, and canola oil for the preparation of corn beer

loans.name: Elise

texts.en: Elise is a student at one of the private institutions for higher education. He has requested a Kiva loan to pay for his tuition. He expects to graduate by the end of this year (2014). He plans to use this chance to focus on the materials provided by his lecturers and by working on research projects so that he gets better grades. He expects to graduate with a degree in business administration.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees at the university.

loans.name: Miguel Justino

texts.es:
Miguel Justino tiene 61 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, que viven en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima variado que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.


El se dedica a la compra de reciclaje para posteriromente llevarlo a una empresa de la zona que le compran a mayor precio, también se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz amarillo, que luego de cosechar lo comercializa en el mercado de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de producos de reciclaje y una pequeña parte para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una mejor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miguel Justino is 61 years old, with a life partner and three children. They live in the district of Buenos Aires, a community with a varied climate that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and ranching, located in the province of Morropon that belongs to the Piura Region in the north coast of Peru. 

He is dedicated to buying recycling, which he takes to a company in the area that purchases it for higher prices, and he is also dedicated to agriculture, specifically the cultivation of yellow corn, that after harvesting he sells in the market in his district. 

He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a better quality of recycling products and he is using a small part to maintaining the cultivation of corn. This way he will have a better product to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy recycling products and to maintain his maize cultivation

loans.name: Aida Miria

texts.es:
Aida Miria tiene 58  años de edad, de estado civil casada, vive junto con su esposo, en una comunidad grande  en la  zona urbana  de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la actividad de  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, desde  hace  más de 5 años de antigüedad, su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, sin embargo el día martes traslada su mercadería a Oyotún, dado que es ese día se reúnen la mayoría de la población para hacer sus compras, y el día principal de venta en su distrito es el día domingo.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 400 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
58-year-old Aida Miria is married and lives with her husband in a big district in the city of Cayalti, in Chiclayo province. In the province, which lies within the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru, people work in farming, trade and cattle rearing.
