Aida Maria has been running a business selling women's, men's and children's clothing for over 5 years. She runs the business from her home but, on Tuesdays, she moves her merchandise to Oyotún, as that is the day when most of the people there do their shopping.  The main day for selling her goods locally is Sunday.
She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,400 nuevos soles to buy clothing of different types to stock her shop and, as a result, generate greater income for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the fall and winter seasons to offer to her clients

loans.name: Benicia

texts.es:
Benicia de 58 Años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos,  ella vende en la escuela de la localidad desde hace 10 años, y en el pequeño chalet de la escuela junto a otros compañeras que trabajan con ella preparan ventas tales como: Enchiladas, Yuca Frita, Enredos, Conservas y Otros, de los cuales ella obtiene sus ganancias para lograr apoyar a su esposo y a sus hijos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales para la elaboración de conservas y la yuca frita entre otros para que los jóvenes disfruten de ello a la hora del recreo.

Ella planea construir un chalet mas grande ya que el espacio es muy pequeño y muchas veces tienen problemas para desplazarse.
texts.en:
Benicia, 58 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has 4 children. She has been selling at a school in the area for 10 years. In a small bungalow at the school, along with other companions who work with her, she prepares food for sale, such as enchiladas, fried yucca, enredos, preserves and other items. The profits she earns enable her to support her husband and children.

The loan will be used to purchase ingredients for the food she makes, such as preserves and fried yucca among other items, so that the youth can enjoy them during recess. 

She plans to build a bigger bungalow because her current space is limited and many times they have problems moving about.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make preserves and fried yucca, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton cloth, lace, and different kinds of clothing material for resale

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
Andres es un hombre emprendedor siempre en busca de oportunidades de progreso y de salir adelante.
El se dedica a la venta de productos Amway desde hace 1 año y manifiesta un profundo gusto y pasión por esta actividad desde muy joven.
El desea aumentar sus ventas e ir escalando en los niveles que ofrece la marca y es por esto que solicita un préstamo pues desea comprar un inventario de productos de ésta reconocida marca para tenerlos disponibles para sus clientes en estas fechas.
Tiene grandes expectativas con este préstamo pues ahora si va poder establecerse como un comerciante más fuerte y con mejor desempeño en el comercio.
Su principal desafío es la falta de oportunidades para conseguir capital, sin embargo aun conserva mucha esperanza.
texts.en:
Andre is an enterprising man, always looking out for opportunities to progress and move up in life.  He has been selling Amway products for a year and has developed a profound pleasure and passion for this work from a young age.  He wants to increase his sales and continue climbing the levels offered by the brand and this is why he is requesting a loan.  

He wants to buy an inventory of products from this well-known brand to have them available for his current clients.  He has great expectations for this loan as now he will be able to establish himself as a stronger salesman with better performance in sales.  His principal challenge is the lack of opportunities to obtain capital. Despite this, he is still full of hope.

loans.use: to buy Amway brand-name products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a flatbed sewing machine.

loans.name: Jose Isabel

texts.es: José de 27 Años de edad, es un hombre luchador agricultor que desde temprano se levanta a trabajar en su parcela, su compañera de vida muy de mañana le prepara un humilde café para que se vaya a trabajar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales tienen edades entre 4 y 6 años de edad y estudian.José cultiva maíz y frijol desde hace mucho tiempo, junto a su padre el aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ahora con su esposa y sus hijos juntos están saliendo adelante poco a poco.El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos para la temporada agrícola ya que la milpa esta necesitando abono y de los agro químicos necesarios para su manejo y control de plagas y malezas.Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y su producción de granos básicos ya que así su calidad de vida sera mejor.
texts.en: José is 27 years old. He is a plucky farmer who wakes up very early in order to work on his land. José's partner prepares coffee for him very early for work. The couple has two children, aged six and four years old each; they are in school. José has been growing corn and beans for a long time. He learned to work the land alongside his father. Now, with his wife and children, the family is trying gradually to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy farming supplies for the season. José's corn fields need manure and chemicals in order to look after them and to kill weeds. José's dream is to make improvements to his home and increase his production of basic grains. By doing this, José would be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the farming season.

loans.name: Francisca De Jesus

texts.es: Francisca de 47 Años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos que le ayudan en lo que sea necesario.Francisca se dedica a la venta de pupusas su hija le ayuda en esta actividad, ya tiene 6 años en este rubro, el engorde de cerdos Francisca y su esposo lo realizan desde hace mucho mas tiempo porque como familia humilde de escasos recursos este tipo de actividades les permite subsistir y mejorar así un poco su calidad de vida. El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo será utilizado para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de pupusas y para comprar algunos cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.sus planes son tener un local en donde vender las pupusas ya que por el momente vende en su casa.
texts.en: Francisca is 47 years old. She has a partner who works in farming. The couple has three children who help with whatever is needed. Francisca has been making a living selling "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) for six years; her daughter helps her with this work. For many more years Francisca and her husband have been raising pigs to fatten up. As a poor family with little money, this work allows them to survive and improve their quality of life a little. This loan from "CrediCampo" will be used to buy ingredients for making "pupusas" and for buying some pigs to fatten up and sell. Francisca wants to have premises where she can sell the "pupusas" as she currently sells them from her house.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making "pupusas" and to buy pigs to fatten up and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton, lace, and different kinds of clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades variadas, cada una de ellas se esfuerzan por poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo y ayuda mutua de todas.
Luisa, es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de comidas variadas, que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante, y que comenta que ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela gracias a que sus comidas son muy ricas.
Luisa comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como ser tomates, cebollas, carne, pollo y demás,  y de esa forma seguir trabajando y luchando como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo de todas.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this group are involved in a variety of activities. Each one of them works hard to be able to help her family through her own work and the mutual aid of all. Luisa is one of the members of the group. She works preparing and selling a variety of food, which she makes herself and then goes out to sell as a street vender. She says that she now has a good number of clients, thanks to the fact that her food is very tasty.

Luisa says that she is asking for this loan to be able to buy ingredients to make the dishes she sells: tomatoes, onions, meat, chicken and so on. In this way she will continue working and striving as she has been doing. She expresses thanks for the opportunity they are receiving to be able to help their families through the work of all of the group members.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, meet, chicken and other ingredients to make meals

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Roque está en su 5to ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liria, quien se dedica a la confección con lo cual ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar.  Es una señora muy trabajadora y responsable. A parte de las capacitaciones correspondientes y de los seguimientos también lucha por poder superarse y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, botones y demás, para poder seguir con sus confecciones, dando buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is in its fifth loan cycle of the women's communal bank program, where all promised to work and help each other to move forward. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, in which each one is putting in their best effort in order to improve.

One of the members is Liria, who works in dressmaking, with which she helps her family with the household expenses. She is a very hardworking and responsible woman. Apart from the training and monitoring she receives, she is also fighting to be able to better herself and move forward.

She is applying for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fabrics, threads, glues, buttons and more, in order to continue with her dressmaking, giving a good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, glues, buttons and more.

loans.name: Mario Ernesto

texts.es:
Mario de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado de educación básica, esta casado, su pareja realiza los oficios domésticos y a parte lava ropa y por lo tanto tiene un ingreso económico; tiene 2 hijos que viven con ellos. Solamente dependen tres personas de él. 

Mario trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por unos 3 años, lo aprendió de un cuñado y decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque es una manera de obtener un ingreso económico extra. También trabaja la agricultura y trabaja en carpintería, antes solo trabajaba como empleado. La distancia esta cerca ya que en el mismo terreno trabaja la agricultura, mantiene el ganado y también tiene la carpintería y se mueve a pie. Se involucra su esposa y el hijo mayor en las diferentes actividades, su horario es de 6:00 am a 3:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar ganado de repasto, le mejorara mucho ya que podrá tener mas ganado y por lo tanto mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha es que va a tener mas ganado y que puede comprar de una vez y rápido. Sus sueños son trabajar muy fuerte para  crecer en los negocios y en cuanto a sus hijos que estudien y se preparen académicamente.  Las ganancias las utiliza para su familia y para ir pagando el préstamo, porque con una buena administración y el apoyo de Credicampo con los prestamos se puede superar.
texts.en:
Mario is 39 years old and completed up to seventh grade at school. He is married; his partner looks after the household chores and also washes clothes to earn money. The couple has two children who live at home. Only these three people depend on Mario.

Mario has been working with grazing cattle for three years. He learned the trade from one of his brothers-in-law and decided to work in this area as it allows him to earn an extra income. Mario also works in farming and as a carpenter, though previously he was employed by somebody else for this. Mario does not have to travel for work as he does his farming, carpentry work, and cattle raising on the same land. He arrives at work on foot. Mario works from 6am until 3pm, and his wife and eldest son help with his different businesses.

This loan will be used to buy grazing cattle. With more cattle, Mario can  enjoy a higher quality of life. This loan will help Mario to buy the cattle in one payment. Mario has big dreams of expanding his businesses; he also wants his children to study and have a good education. Mario will use his profits to help his family and to pay off his loan. With good management, and the help of "Credicampo", these loans can help Mario to do better in life.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Véronique Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Véronique, une dame de la trentaine d’année est active dans le domaine du commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Son commerce consiste à vendre des tissus de diverses variétés. Elle possède une clientèle fidèle à proximité comme dans d’autres localités hors du village. Elle a démarré à développer son activité avec les crédits pris à Imcec qui l’ont aidé à renforcer son stock. Quand, elle a de la marchandise, elle peut commencer sa journée à 7h en faisant le tour des maisons de ses clients pour leur proposer le produit. A 18h, elle replie chez elle pour s’occuper des taches domestiques.
Avec les revenus, elle appuie son époux dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et met aussi un peu d’argent de coté. Car elle désire avoir son propre toit à elle et développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Véronique, who is in her thirties, has been selling different kinds of fabric for more than five years. She has a group of loyal customers from inside and outside the village. She started to develop her business with loans through UIMCEC who helped her increase her stock.

When she has merchandise, she begins her day at 7 a.m. and travels around to her customers' houses to make her sales. At 6 p.m. she returns home and attends to household chores.

With her earnings, Véronique helps her husband cover the everyday expenses. She also puts [some of her earnings] aside, because she wishes to own a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy various fabric to resell

loans.name: Abasangirakiyago Group

texts.fr:
Claudine  fait partie du groupe Abasangirakiyago  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 35 ans et est mariée à J. Paul un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 4 âgés de 10 à 16 ans.  

Elle  fait le commerce de farine de manioc depuis 15 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de kilos de  manioc sec  pour préparer une grande quantité de farine  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années  prochaines, elle  voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Claudine is a member of the Abasangirakiyago group and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and is married to J. Paul, who is a driver. Together they have four children, aged from 10 to 16 years old. 

Claudine has been selling manioc flour for 15 years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to buy many kilograms of dried manioc. She will make this into a large quantity of flour which she will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, Claudine would like to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy dried manioc

loans.name: La Reponse Group

texts.fr: Kisuba est un brave commerçant depuis 34 ans, trésoriѐre et membre d’une association d’affaires «La Réponse», âgée de 54 ans, femme vivant seule et mère des 2 enfants, tous majeurs. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale ses marchandises à domicile dans un quartier animé de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima. Elle va acheter 50 sacs de farine de manioc etc. pour accroitre son entreprise.  Elle commença  avec de fonds reçu de ses parents. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, construire une belle maison et soutenir ses deux enfants pour scolariser et nourrir ses petits fils et filles. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kisuba has worked as a brave merchant for 34 years and is also the treasurer and a member of the "La Réponse" business group. She is 54 years old, lives alone, and has two children, who are grown up. She started her business with funds from her parents.

Kisuba sells basic food products. She displays her household goods in a busy part of town. She is seeking a loan with Hekima to buy 50 sacs of manioc flour, etc., in order to increase her business. 

In the future, Kisuba hopes to buy a piece of land, build a nice house, and help her children feed and educate her grandchildren.

Kisuba thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy 50 sacs of manioc flour, etc.

loans.name: Noyaa Group

texts.en:
The two members are part of the group called Noyaa. They are married women and they are, on average, 40 years old with three children each. Both of them live in traditional families in Teshie-Accra, a working-class neighborhood of the city. In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are taking their eighth loan with the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana. Their previous loans have all been duly repaid. They are now requesting an amount of GHS 1900 to sell fish and foodstuff. 

Teley, a member of the group, sells smoked fish. In the photo, she is standing on the right. She is planning to use her loan to buy three cartons of fish from fishermen, smoke them, and sell them to customers. Thanks to the quality of the fish that she resells on a retail basis, she receives a high demand from her customers. She sells to both men and women and is paid in cash. She is expecting to make a good monthly profit, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the interest, and the rest will go into savings.

loans.use: To buy three cartons of fish from fishermen, and smoke and sell them to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal, rice, and red oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy charcoal, peanuts, etc.

loans.name: Msingi Group

texts.fr: Madame Kasamba, femme ambitieuse et  courage de l’association d’affaire  Msingi ;  est  commerçante depuis  1999 dans le marché public de la ville.  Agée de 35 ans, elle est mère de 6 enfants qui  vont  tous à  l’école et  est  engagée  à un homme d’affaire. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  1 sac de riz, 1 sac de haricot  et  2 bidons d’huile de palme.  Elle souhaite construire une maison et  couvrir régulièrement les frais  scolaires de ses enfants. Au final,  elle remercie Hekima pour tout.
texts.en:
Kasamba, an ambitious and courageous member of the Msingi group, has been a merchant since 1999 at the town market. She is 35 years old and is engaged to a businessman. She has six children who all go to school.

Kasamba is seeking this new loan to buy one sac of rice, one sac of beans, and two drums of palm oil.

She wishes to always be able to cover her children's school fees and build a house. 

Finally she thanks Hekima for all their help.

loans.use: to buy one sac of rice, one sac of beans, and two drums of palm oil

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, four of whom are attending school. She is not looking after any other member of her family.

She has been selling charcoal in the market at retail for the last ten years, working seven days a week. She does not have another source of income.

She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her stock more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include seasonality. 

Her dream is to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charged on loans.

loans.use: To buy more backs of charcoal.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisemè est majoritairement composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djelibougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre et bananes plantains, poissons et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pommes de terre et bananes plantains. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de pommes de terre et 2 sacs de bananes plantains en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Djelibougou et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Mariam                espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djiguisemè group is made up mostly of polygamous women. They are, on average, 31 years old and have five children. They live in Djelibougou, one of the areas of Bamako, and know each other from neighborhood ties. All the woman engage in small-scale commerce, selling potatoes and plantains, fish, and vegetables.

In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their third group loan.

Mariam (the woman seated on the far left in the photo) has a good reputation selling potatoes and plantains. She plans to use her loan to buy three sacs of potatoes and two sacs of plantains at wholesale in Médine. She will resell these goods at retail in Djelibougou to mostly female customers.

With her loan, Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

She hopes to buy a residential plot of land with the help of Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton, lace and different kinds of clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with three children and all of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She has a food stall. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 12 years. She has requested a loan of UGX 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy raw food like yams, green bananas, fingers (okra), and cassava. Her major  business challenge includes transportation and seasonality. 

Her goal and aspiration is to become a wholesaler and also to start growing foodstuff. She rents a house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more raw food like yams, green bananas, fingers (okra), and cassava

loans.name: Felix Octavio

texts.en:
Felix is a farmer, planting beans and corn, tending cows and has a raises fish (Tilapia), age 66 years who lives with his spouse Raymunda age 61, and children.   His spouse raises chickens.   
It is clear that Felix and Raymunda work hard to maintain their household and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  The kerosene lamps, which must be lit by striking a match, produce substantial contamination in the house, present a risk of fire and produce a very low level of lighting. 
He mentioned that he hopes to stop paying for charging the cellular phone which for which he must also walk 40 minutes to where he can get a charge.
To improve living conditions for his family, Felix is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.  With this system the illumination in the house will be with highly efficient and long life LED lamps.  With electrical light it is much easier to study and other activities are much more pleasant, such as cooking in the kitchen or gathering the family at the dinner table or in the living room. The solar electric system can power a television and radio which provide entertainment, news and education in this rural area providing better access to information from within the country and around the world. The system can also maintain the charge in a cellular telephone to allow essential communications from this rural area.
In addition to the reduction of toxic fumes from kerosene lamps, the solar electric system reduces the family’s energy costs by eliminating the cost of kerosene, the cost of dry cell batteries for radios and the cost of cell phone charging with related cost of transport to an urban center for charging.  These savings will provide Felix a return on his investment in the solar electric system.  The solar panel has a 25 year warranty. Soluz Honduras installs, guarantees, and maintains the system to assure that the benefits will continue for many years. 
A positive global environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions (0.25 tons per year) that results from the elimination of kerosene consumption.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Alex Bladimir

texts.en:
Alex is a farmer (raising African Palm trees) and dairy farmer, age 37 years who lives with his spouse, Liliana and 3 children.   He gets up early in the morning before sunrise to milk the cows. 
It is clear that Alex works hard to maintain his family and at night, after a hard day of work, the conditions in the house are not very good due to the lack of electricity.   The family currently illuminates their home with kerosene lamps the electrical utility grid does not reach this rural area.  The kerosene lamps, which must be lit by striking a match, produce substantial contamination in the house, present a risk of fire and produce a very low level of lighting. 
He mentioned that he hopes to be able to eliminate the kerosene lamp for his children’s studies. He also needs to charge a cellular phone to keep in contact with the customers who buy his milk.  To improve living conditions for his family, Alex is requesting a loan to purchase a complete solar electric system from Soluz Honduras.  With this system the illumination in the house will be with highly efficient and long life LED lamps.  With electrical light it is much easier to study and other activities are much more pleasant, such as cooking in the kitchen or gathering the family at the dinner table or in the living room. The solar electric system can power a television and radio which provide entertainment, news and education in this rural area providing better access to information from within the country and around the world. The system can also maintain the charge in a cellular telephone to allow essential communications from this rural area.
In addition to the reduction of toxic fumes from kerosene lamps, the solar electric system reduces the family’s energy costs by eliminating the cost of kerosene, the cost of dry cell batteries for radios and the cost of cell phone charging with related cost of transport to an urban center for charging.  These savings will provide Alex a return on his investment in the solar electric system.  The solar panel has a 25 year warranty. Soluz Honduras installs, guarantees, and maintains the system to assure that the benefits will continue for many years. 
A positive global environmental impact of this investment is the reduction of carbon dioxide emissions (0.25 tons per year) that results from the elimination of kerosene consumption.

loans.use: To buy a solar energy system for his home

loans.name: Shaba Group

texts.en:
Upendo is a business woman who is aged in her twenties. She is married and has got two small kids. She supports her family with a mamalishe business where she serves breakfast and lunch food. She has been in this business for a period of six years. She starts serving people from 08am to 04pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request. She used the previous credit to buy the missed food cooking ingredients. Upendo paid back the loan successfully. She earned a profit which she used to add to her building costs. She is now requesting new credit to replenish her business with cooking ingredients (vegetables, kilos of sugar, beans and meat, maize flour, liters of cooking oil, rice etc). She dreams of finishing building her house and improving her business. 

Upendo will share this loan with her loan group "Shaba" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with cooking ingredients (vegetables, kilos of sugar, beans and meat, maize flour, liters of cooking oil, rice).

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Anna who is in her late 30s is single with two children who are still going to school.  She has been selling fresh and fried fish for ten years now.  She works from 06am to 8.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Anna's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more fish, cooking oil and firewood.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy fish, cooking oil for frying fish and fire wood.  She dreams of becoming an international fisherwoman.

Anna will share this loan with her loan group "Muungano - Beach" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil for frying fish and fire wood.

loans.name: Sewa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Sewa sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Djelibougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djelibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre, restauration, condiments et pâtes d’arachides. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme  assise à l’extrême  gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de pommes de terre ; elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de pommes de terre à Médine en gros; la revente se fait à Djelibougou et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women of the Sewa Group are all married into polygamous households. They each have an average age of 35 and an average of six children each. They all live in Djelibougou District, one of the districts of Bamako. They know each other through the bonds of community and the money-generating activities they carry out at Djelibougou Market. The members of this group sell potatoes, condiments and peanut paste, as well as run restaurants. In order to replenish their cash reserves, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their third loan.

Fatoumata (the woman squatting on the left in the photo) has a solid reputation as a potato seller. She plans on using her loan to purchase 10 sacks of potatoes from the wholesalers in Médine. She will then resell them in Djelibougou to mostly female customers. With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business and used to ensure the good health of her children.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products such as coal and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, slippers, water and dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Henrita

texts.en:
Henrita is married and a mother. She is dedicated to the well-being of her family. For this reason, she decided to open her own business selling jewelry to generate additional income that would help to cover her family's expenses. Henrita works from 6 am to 5 pm. She is in need of capital to buy jewelry to sell to customers. This loan will help her to buy enough jewelry so that she can serve a wider spectrum of customers. 

Henrita's goal is to improve her service, attract more customers, and increase her sales and income. Her dream is to continue growing her business so that her financial situation becomes more stable and she is able to pay off her debts from her loans. In this way, she will also be able to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy enough jewelry to serve a wider spectrum of customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more green vegetable to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby toys to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for resale

loans.name: Silvia Carolina

texts.es:
Silvia, es una mujer responsable que ha buscado los medios de tener ingresos económicos  para apoyar a criar y educar  a sus hijas, posee una sastrería, no tiene un horario establecido ya que también realiza las actividades del hogar, ella se preparó mediante cursos de costura y así descubrió que tenía vocación para desempeñar dicho trabajo, como ventaja tiene contratos para surtir de uniformes a las escuelas nacionales. Silvia es casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijas.
El capital que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de telas, botones, zippers, broches, hilos, agujas, encajes, etc., con lo que tendrá la oportunidad de trabajar sin escases de material, entregar con mayor calidad las prendas y cumplir en menor tiempo sus encargos.
Su aspiración es seguir trabajando para ahorrar y dar a sus hijas una educación superior Universitaria.
texts.en:
Silvia is a responsible woman who has sought ways to have an income to raise and educate her daughters. She owns a tailor shop. She does not have a set schedule as she also has to take care of her home. She learned how to sew by taking courses, and discovered that she had a skill for it and could make it her vocation. She has contracts to supply uniforms to national schools. Silvia is married, and lives with her husband and kids.

The loan she is requesting would be invested in the purchase of fabrics, buttons, zippers, snaps, thread, needles, lace, etc. With this loan she can have continued work with no shortage of materials, will be able to deliver high quality garments, and meet her orders quicker. Her dream is to keep working to save money to give her children a university education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, snaps, thread, needles, lace, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Vigae Group

texts.en:
Mussa is a father of four children. Two are in school, and the other two are still small. He is in his thirties and married with two wives. 

He supports his life with three businesses. Mussa has two fishing boats which he has handed over to his two helpers who fish at night and take the stock to him everyday. He wakes up in the morning after his two boats arrive and sells the stock to small business clients at the market. He also leave aside a few buckets for his fried fish business. 

Despite having no education, he is still able to manage his projects well. He has been in this fishing business for 15 years. 

After managing his fish business well, Mussa came up with a new business, a shop selling CDs, fridges, freezers, and TVs. 

Mussa is requesting a ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to open his shop selling CDs, TVs, decks, freezers, and fridges. He earned a profit which he used to plow back to his plan and built four houses, two for living and the others for renting. He has successfully paid back all of his previous loans.

He is really working hard and it shows. He dreams of having a farm and starting a poultry business. Mussa will use this loan to buy used boat equipment. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Vigae" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Mussa is so proud to have Kiva's support and thanks everyone who has supported people around the world.

loans.use: to buy used boat equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and coal nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water and assorted drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
ID Ghana, a partner of Kiva, in Accra is very pleased to present to you members of the “Blessing” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to ID Ghana/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 1,700 GHS in order to invest in their respective businesses (wigs, firewood, pomade, and underwear.)
 
Esther is the featured borrower of this group. She is 56 years old and married with children. She sells wigs, firewood, and pomade. She has been working in this business for seven years now. 

With the help from this loan, Esther will invest in her business by buying wigs, firewood, and pomade in larger quantities to add to her current stock. 

She is a very hardworking woman with ambition to build her own house. Currently, she and her family are living together in the family house.

loans.use: to buy wigs, firewood, and pomade in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Adom Group

texts.en:
They live in Teshie, a neighborhood of Accra, and they know each other as neighbors. The group members work as vendors selling cosmetics, shoes and foodstuff. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana and are now on the fourth loan cycle. 

Maureen is is well known in the entire neighborhood as a vendor of high-quality cosmetics and shoes. She plans to use her loan to buy cosmetics and shoes from the wholesale market in Accra. The cosmetics and shoes would be sold to customers and she promise to be ever ready to sell to a customer base composed mainly of local people in her community. With this loan, Maureen hopes to earn good monthly revenue, which will be reinvested in her business. She is 42 years and married with three children. 

They need a total amount of GHS 1,900 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes from the wholesale market in Accra.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.en:
Leonel is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero client, and this is his story:

Leonel is 33 years old, married and has no children. He and his wife live in a house with some relatives, and both of them are in charge of a business to make a living, He has a taco stand in a high street, and his wife has a small grocery shop.

Leonel asks for this loan to resolve a family emergency that has arisen. His sister, who lives in the Mexican state of Veracruz, presented health problems requiring medical assistance and was admitted into the hospital. Leonel is a big support for his family, so he agreed to support this situation financially. 

He considers himself a responsible person when managing credits. With the previous loans he has asked for, he has been able to grow his business.

loans.use: to fund medical expenses for his sister

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia is a small entrepreneur and Kubo Financiero client, and this is her story:

Engracia is 58 years old, married and has no sons dependent on her. She has been in commerce and trade for her whole life; since she was a child she helped her father with a grocery store, and then when she got married they opened a hardware store which prospered, enabling Engracia to open up her own grocery store.

Her store, which has been open for 13 years now, sells soda, food, dairy products, canned products, etc. Engracia asks for this loan to purchase more goods to sell and thus increase her business.

With the effort she puts into her work, Engracia has been able to build the upper part of her house and provide for her sons. Her goals are to keep growing her business and improving her house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a shawarma grill machine and sandwich toaster and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María de 37 Años de edad, es una mujer la cual se esmera por cumplir sus obligaciones con su familia ya que cuando sus esposo se fue para los Estados Unidos de América, ella quedo sola con su primer hija, es madre soltera, y fue así como decidió trabajar en el pequeño chalet de la escuela local.
María trabaja en el chalet desde hace 12 años y siempre lo ha hecho sin apoyo de nadie, hasta ahora que su hija ha crecido se involucra y le ayuda a María en su tiempo libre. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mas productos y así poder incrementar su pequeño inventario con ello pretende alcanzar un incremento en sus ventas y mejorar así sus ingresos.Sus planes son muy grandes pero sobre todo desea mejorar su pequeño chalet en la escuela y surtirlo de mercadería para así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old. She is a woman who is very dedicated to looking after her family. When her husband went to the United States of America, she stayed behind alone with her eldest daughter, as a single mother. It was then that she decided to work in the small snack bar of the local school.

Maria has worked in the snack bar for 12 years, always without support from anyone else, until now, as her daughter has grown up she is involved and helps Maria in her spare time.

She needs the loan to buy more products and be able to grow her small inventory with a view to increasing sales and thus improving her income.

Her plans are great, but above all she wishes to improve her small snack bar in the school and stock it with produce in order to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy more products for her snack bar.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Inhambane tem 32 anos é solteira mãe de 1 filha que frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pelo seu pai que se encontra em Inhambane enviando lhe 500 mt mensalmente.
É monitora já há bastante tempo auferindo um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como: cimento, área, varões e muito mais para finalizar a sua obra.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e abrir um salão de beleza e tem como desafio garantir o ensino a sua filha até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Marcela was born in Inhambane. She's 32 years old and single, and has a daughter who attends school. She supports her father who lives in Inhambane by sending him 500mt each month.
She has worked as a monitor for a long time and earns an income that she uses to pay for her household expenses. With this loan she intends to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, rods and many other items, so that she can finish the construction work.
In the future she hopes to finish building her house and open a beauty salon. Her challenge is providing her daughter with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, sand, rods and many other items, so that she can finish the construction work.

loans.name: Ruzigul

texts.ru: Рузигул милая и доброжелательная женщина из района Кубадиён. Она живет там с мужем, сыном и дочерью. Ей 46 лет. Рузигул год назад начала бизнес по откорму и продаже мелкорогатых скотов. Она в течение месяца выращивает маленьких козлят, ягнят и барашек, и затем продает на скотном рынке по прибыльной цене. Эта деятельности ей очень нравится, так как наряду с этой деятельностью она спокойно может заниматься своими другими делами. Целью запрашиваемого кредита Рузигул является увеличение поголовье своих барашек, ягнят и козлят. Таким образом она хочет увеличить доходность бизнеса и бюджет семьи.
texts.en: Ruzigul is a cute and kind woman from the Qubadiyon district. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter. She is 46 years old. Ruzigul started a business of fattening up and selling small livestock one year ago. She raises small baby goats and lambs for a month, and then sells them at a livestock market at a profitable price. She likes this business very much because along with this business, she can calmly do other things. The goal of the loan being requested by Ruzigul is to increase the headcount of lambs and baby goats. This is how she wants to increase the business profitability and family's budget.

loans.use: to buy baby goats and lambs in order to develop her business

loans.name: Eliazar Bladimir

texts.es:
Eliazar, opta por un nuevo préstamo para preparar el terreno en el que cultiva pipián, comprara semilla, herbicidas, abono, insecticidas y plaguicidas, continuara fortaleciendo su negocio para tener los ingresos que necesita para subsistir.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo como resultado una cosecha muy abundante, sus nuevos ingresos han sido de mucha ayuda para mantener su estabilidad económica y lograr culminar sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Eliazar is asking for a new loan to prepare the ground in which he grows pipián (squash). He will buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides. He will continue to strengthen his business in order to obtain the income he needs to survive.

As the result of his previous loan was a very abundant harvest, his new income has been of great help in order to maintain his economic stability, and to manage to finish his university studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicides, fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a shawarma grilling machine and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an embroidery machine and a table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, and an over-sewing machine.

loans.name: Angelino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província De Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é Pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, somente 2 é que frequentam escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É Segurança a mais de 3 anos, aufere um valor mensal que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende dar continuidade a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: blocos, cimento, varões e mais. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que todos foram aplicados para o mesmo fim.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e adquirir mobiliário para a mesma. O seu maior desafio é a falta de fundo suficiente para transportar o material.
texts.en:
Angelino comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 31 years old and married. He has three underage children and only two of them attend school. He doesn't have anyone under his responsibility.
He has worked as a security guard for over three years and earns a monthly income which he uses to pay for his household expenses. With this loan he intends to move forward with his construction work by purchasing construction supplies such as bricks, cement, rods, etc. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and all of them were used for the same purpose.
In the future he hopes to finish the construction work and furnish his house. His biggest challenge is not having enough funds to transport the supplies.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, rods, etc.

loans.name: El Sol Sale Para Todos 2 Group

texts.en:
Alida is a single mother of four children and the coordinator of her group, El Sol Sale Para Todos (The Sun Shines For Everyone) 2. Along with her, the group’s other four members live in a small rural community called Sabana de la Mar outside the city of Hato Mayor.

With her first Esperanza loan taken almost five years ago, Alida was able to reinvest in her fish market. She is now applying for her ninth loan, which she will use to buy fish and other meat. She says that her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business, something she continues to work very hard at.

In the meantime, she plans to continue attending church and serving the people. Alida and her group thank you for your help in achieving their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: To buy fish and meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a generator and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business, to buy products and cooking ingredients, as she also sells cooked food.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo Província do mesmo nome, tem 38 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 3 filhos, apenas 1 é que frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É negociante mais de 5 anos proprietária de um estabelecimento comerciaL, com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o volume da sua criação adquirindo ração, pintos e vitaminas.
Futuramente pretende ampliar o seu aviário para o desenvolvimento da sua criação e adquirir uma viatura para transportar a sua mercadoria.
 O seu maior desafio é manter o seu negócio como base de sustentabilidade.
texts.en:
Celeste comes from Maputo, located in the province of the same name. She's 38 years old and single. She has three children, only one of whom attends school. She doesn't support anyone else.
She has been a trader for over five years and owns a store. With this loan she intends to expand her chicken farm by purchasing feed, chicks and vitamins.
In the future she intends to enlarge her aviary so she can further develop her farm. She also intends to acquire a vehicle for carrying her merchandise.
Her biggest challenge is keeping her business afloat as a means of livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is an Ashkali woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is single, 23 years old and fortunate to have employment, unlike many in her community. Ardiana is working in a church and is the main source of income for her family, living with elderly parents and her sister in very bad conditions. 

They live in a small old house under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. It has not had any repairs or renovations in the past several years. The biggest problem is inadequate insulation; the loss of heat every winter means it costs a great deal to buy the coal to keep this house warm. As well, their dwelling becomes very cold and drafty, affecting the health of everyone. 

Because it would be beneficial for her family to live comfortably and stay warm, Ardiana is requesting a loan to buy windows and doors to renovate her house to address part of the problem. After repairing the house Ardiana will be able to create better living conditions for the family. She thanks Kiva for its help.

loans.use: To buy windows and doors to renovate her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Esau

texts.es:
Esau de 40 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9º grado de educación básica, esta casado, su pareja trabaja realizando los oficios domésticos, tiene 1 hija que vive en su casa y a la vez estudia parvularia, con él viven 2 personas mas que es un hijastro y la suegra, pero de él solamente dependen tres. 

Esau posee un negocio de ganado, lo ha hecho por unos 6 años y lo aprendió de unos amigos y del hijastro y se decidió para  darle un mejor futuro a su familia, si tiene otras actividades económicas y es que trabaja la agricultura y además es empleado, antes solamente era empleado, donde trabaja con ganado y la agricultura esta como a 2 km y viaja a pie, se involucra su esposa y su hijastro. Su horario es de 8:00 am a 1:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta soliictando, es para comprar ganado, el préstamo le mejorara ya que compra y vende ganado, y por lo tanto tendrá mas ingreso económicos para darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida.  sus sueños son seguir trabajando de la mejor manera para crecer en el negocio y en cuanto a su hija poder darle un mejor futuro. El préstamo le ayudara mucho para lograr un crecimiento en el negocio. Las ganancias las utiliza para su familia y para ir pagando el préstamo, ya que solo así se puede superar.
texts.en:
Esau is 40 years old. He studied up to 9th grade. He is married and his wife works as a domestic. He has a daughter who lives at home and attends nursery. Two further people live with him, his step-son and mother-in-law, but only three people depend on him. 

Esau has had a cattle business for the last six years. He learnt the trade from some friends and his step-son and it was decided that it would provide him with a better future for his family. Previously he was an employee only but now in addition to this he works in agriculture, where he works with cattle. The business is approximately 2 km away and he travels on foot. His wife and step-son are involved in the business. His timetable is from 8.00am until 1.00pm. 

The loan which he is applying for is to enable him to buy cattle. The loan will improve his situation because he buys and sells cattle and so he will have a larger income in order to provide his family with a better quality of life. His dreams are to continue working in the best way possible to in order to make the business grow and for him to be able to provide his daughter with a better future. The loan will really help him to achieve growth for the business. He uses his earnings for his family and to go on paying his loan, because only in this way can he improve his situation.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A loan of 4,200 helped Shadha to buy new sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Faafili Iemaima

texts.en: Faafili is a 66-year old-married woman with six children. She sells cigarettes and ice pops to the members of her community and has been doing this for more than three years. With this money, Faafili will purchase more packets of cigarettes for cigarette business, plastic cups, cordial, sugar, and packets of chinese lollies for ice pop business. Faafili has managed to make some changes in the livelihoods of her family ever since she joined the SPBD program. With her profits, she hopes to save a lot of it so that it would continue to help not only in reinvesting it back to her business, but to keep providing for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to purchase packets of cigarettes, plastic cups, cordial, sugar, packets of chinese lollies.

loans.name: Pablo Gustavo

texts.en: Pablo is an innovative farmer and community leader in the Zumpango region of Mexico State and is constantly searching out new alternatives to improve his farm. He is constantly implementing new technologies and is excited about his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. The digester will help him treat about 80 kg of cow manure per day to produce 5 to 8 hours of renewable biogas per day. This will help him displace the propane he currently uses to cook and heat bathwater. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and air conditioner

loans.name: Gs El Relleno Group

texts.es:
EL señor   SAUL de  49 años  de edad es casado y se dedica la venta de mariscos desde hace 11 años sus ventas son en diferentes aldeas donde se transporta en su motocicleta vendiendo mariscos, esta solicitando el refinanciamiento ya que quiere invertir mas en compra  de pescado y camarones, su lugar de residencia es en aldea el chircal al sur de Honduras.
 El grupo está solicitando 24, 000.00 lempiras para compra  de mariscos. Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo  Don Saúl desea seguir  invirtiendo en su negocio al igual que su demás compañeros de grupo  quienes  también  venden mariscos Y LECHE  ellos son  Don  Jorge y DOÑA YESENIA,  quienes desean salir adelante y seguir mejorando sus ingresos.
Su sueño es tener sus negocios mas surtido y así obtener mejores ganancias.
San Lorenzo, honduras – MAYO 2014
texts.en:
Saul is 49 years old. He is married and has been selling seafood for 11 years. He sells seafood in different small villages where he travels using his motorcycle. 

He is requesting the financing so he can invest more in the purchase of fish and prawns. He resides in the little village of El Chircal, south of Honduras.
The group is requesting 24,000 LEMPIRAS to buy seafood. With the profits and support from this loan, Saul wishes to keep investing in his business like his group's members, who also sell seafood and milk. They are Don Jorge and Doña Yesenia. They wish to get ahead and keep improving their income. Their dream is to offer a bigger selection to obtain better profits.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – MAY 2014

loans.use: to buy seafood and fish to sell

loans.name: Gs Triunfando Juntos Group

texts.es:
La señora Nohelia es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio, venta de ropa americana mixta desde hace 2 años, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, y también lo atiende en su casa de habitación, sus clientes  principales son personas que viven en su zona  y clientes que viven en las afuera, ella vende blusas, pantalones, camisas, calcetines, ropa de cama, también trabaja vendiendo productos por catálogo de Avon.
Nohelia solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano, como ser camisas, sabanas, pantalones, blusas, y otras prendas de vestir, ella solicita el préstamo de manera grupal con las siguientes personas.
Irma se dedica a la venta de tamalitos de elote y variedades de plásticos desde hace 15 años.
Juan se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general desde hace 3 años.
Guadalupe se dedica a la venta de producto por catálogo de Avon.
Ellos solicitan el préstamo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente para hacer que sus negocios crezcan. 
Danlí, Honduras – Mayo  2014
texts.en:
Nohelia is an enterprising woman, she has been selling clothes (American mixed) for 2 years. She sells as a street vendor and also serves customers from her home. Her main customers live in her area but also come from further afield.
She sells blouses, trousers, shirts, socks, bedlinen and also works selling products from the Avon catalogue. 

Nohelia is asking for the loan to buy secondhand clothing, such as shirts, sheets, trousers, blouses and other clothing items. She is asking for the loan as part of a group along with the following people;

Irma has been selling corn tamales and various plastic items for 15 years.
Juan has been selling general groceries for 3 years.
Guadalupe sells products from the Avon catalogue.

They are asking for this loan as they do not possess sufficient capital to grow their businesses.

Danlí, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing such as shirts, sheets, trousers, blouses and other clothing items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner  and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and an air-conditioner.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an air-conditioner, and fabric.

loans.name: Zabdiel

texts.en:
Zabdiel, a dairy farmer from Mexico State, wants to improve farming in his region. He is investing in a 25 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa in order to use it as a technology demonstrator with the goal of promoting anaerobic digestion, the use of biomass energy, and biofertilizer production in his region. 

His digester will convert cow manure into renewable biogas, displacing firewood and propane currently used to cook and heat bathwater. Concurrently, the system will generate a potent soil amendment, allowing Zabdiel to improve crop yields without having to spend on expensive agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 42% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Vanntha

texts.en:
Vanntha is 57 years old. She is a married mother of three children at Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

For a living, she has been involved in planting vegetables since 1990 and her husband is a farmer and a fisherman. Both of them can earn approximately $9 per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of $800 to purchase timber and to pay the construction fee. This loan will help her renovate her house. In the future, Vanntha hopes that she can buy more farmland.

loans.use: To purchase timber and to pay the construction fee

loans.name: Vaeluaga

texts.en: Vaeluaga is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. She runs a small plantation and also a canteen business selling to the school children, members of her community and members of the traveling public. Her husband helps out in the business if needed. She plans to use this loan to purchase chemicals, bush knives, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow, and a knife sharpener for her plantation business. Vaeluaga has been a member of SPBD for more than three years and she has managed to improve their family's livelihood with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, Bush knives, a mist blower, a wheelbarrow, and a knife sharpener for her business

loans.name: Faavela

texts.en: Faavela is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small plantation business selling to the members of her community and to the traveling public. She plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and a knife sharpener to further improve her plantation, and to pay school fees for her children. Faavela has been a member of SPBD for three years and she has managed to meet her family's daily essential needs with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, and a knife sharpener for her business, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Tauleva

texts.en:
Tualeva is a 39-year-old married woman with eight children. She runs a small retail shop with the members of her community as her common customers. 

She plans to use this loan to purchase stocks for her shop such as sacks of flour, sugar, rice, chicken leg quarters, milk, snacks, soft drinks, boxes of tinned fish, laundry soap, onions, and toilet rolls. She has been quite successful with the operation of her shop ever since she became a member of SPBD and has managed to improve the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of flour, sugar, rice, chicken leg quarters, milk, snacks, soft drinks, boxes of tinned fish, laundry soap, onions, and toilet rolls

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Beira província de Sofala tem 40 anos de idade vive maritalmente, pai de 3 filhos menores de idade, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha no Hospital a mais de 10 anos como Técnico de Administração, aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende concluir a sua obra adquirindo material de construção como: janelas e portas.
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra e mudar de carreira profissional. 
O seu principal desafio é de dar continuidade com os estudos  até ao nivel superior .
texts.en:
Celestino comes from Beira, province of Sofala. He's 40 years old and married. He has three underage children and doesn't support anyone else.
He has worked as an administrative assistant at a hospital for over 10 years and earns an income which he uses to pay for his household expenses. With this loan he intends to finish his construction work by purchasing construction supplies such as windows and doors.
In the future he intends to finish his construction work and change his career path.
His main challenge is moving forward with his studies all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as windows and doors.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is 59 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.  This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà is 38 years old and she is married with one child. She supports her one dependent with her business in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hà works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. In the future, Hà hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos vive en Lima, tiene 21 años, es un estudiante brillante y un joven independiente. El por voluntad propia se costea sus estudios a la vez que ayuda a sus padres en el sostenimiento de su hogar, personas emprendedoras que se dedican al comercio. 
Juan Carlos es el mayor de tres hermanos y desea ser un ejemplo a seguir para ellos. El vive actualmente fuera de la casa de sus padres en un cuarto que alquila por cercanía a su trabajo, un taller de estructuras metálicas que gracias a su excelente desempeño lo patrocinara mediante el pago de sus estudios a partir del siguiente semestre académico, motivo por el cual necesita del apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva para poder pagar sus estudios el presente ciclo debido a que problemas económicos en su hogar han impedido que pueda pagarlos.
El agradece el apoyo que los prestamistas de Kiva puedan brindarle para poder costear este ciclo académico y así poder acceder a la ayuda que la empresa donde labora desea brindarle.
El piensa que una persona con acceso a la educación es una persona mejor preparada para poder afrontar los retos que le plantea el mundo moderno y es por esto que considera de vital y gran importancia la ayuda que brindan los prestamistas de Kiva en lograr nuevos y mejores profesionales.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives in Lima. He is 21 years old, a brilliant student and an independent young man. 
He pays for his classes, because he wishes to do so, and he also helps his parents to support the household. His parents are enterprising people who work in trading.

Juan Carlos is the oldest of three siblings, and he wishes to be an example to them. He currently lives out of his parents’ house. He rents a room in a place close to his work. He works in a metal frame shop. Thanks to his excellent performance, the shop will sponsor him paying for his classes the next semester. For this reason, he needs support from the Kiva lenders, to be able to pay for his classes this current semester, because some financial problems at home have stopped him from do in it.
He is thankful  to the Kiva lenders for their support to pay this semester, and to be able to get the help offered from the company where he works at.

He thinks that somebody with access to education is better prepared to face the challenges that the modern world brings. He considers vital and very important the help from the kiva lenders, to be able to get new and better professionals.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies to be a structural welder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over-sewing machine and an embroidery machine and to renovate her workplace.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 64 years old and she is married, with four children. Nhung supports no dependents with her business in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Nhung joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid one loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Nhung has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

The main hardship that Nhung faces in her life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase brick, cement, and sand to build a new toilet.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her business to do well and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, and sand to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell Barefoot Power Solar Lighting products

loans.name: Lumepa

texts.en:
Lumepa is a 49-year-old married woman with eight children. 

She makes popcorn and ice pops and sells them to the members of the community or to the school children. She also prints elei lavalava and also sells them to the public or delivers them to the nearby shops. 

Lumepa likes to use every possible way she is able in order to make money to take care of her family. She plans to purchase fabric paint, print designs, and fabric materials for her elei business, and to pay school fees for her children. 

She is multitalented lady who has managed to improve the livelihood of her family since joining the SPBD program and becoming self-employed.

loans.use: To purchase fabric paint, print designs, and fabric materials, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Davide

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 53 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 11 filhos dos quais 5 frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe e sua irmã que vivem em sua casa.
Trabalha na empresa de bananas (TROPICAL FRUTES) a mais de 6 anos auferindo  um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como blocos, cimento e chapas de zinco para a conclusão da casa. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku
Futuramente pretende adquirir algumas parcelas para a prática de agricultura. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino aos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Davide comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 53 years old and married. He has 11 children, five of whom attend school. He supports his mother and his sister, both of whom live with him.
He has worked for a banana company named "Tropical Frutes" for over six years and earns an income which he uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement and metal sheets in order to finish his house. This is his second loan with Hluvuku.
In the future he intends to purchase some plots of land for farming. His biggest challenge is providing his children with an education all the way to college.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement and metal sheets in order to finish his house.

loans.name: Constatino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namacha Província de Maputo tem 24 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua irmã que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha na Sociedade De Águas de Moçambique a mais de 4 anos, aufere um valor mensal que aplica nas despesas da casa, com este empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção como: área, cimento, chapas de zinco e pedrinhas. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku, sedo que os últimos  foram aplicados para mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende construir um aviários para a criação de frangos para venda e abrir um estabelecimento comercial. O seu maior desafio é concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Constantino comes from Namaacha, province of Maputo. He's 24 years old and married. He has an underage son and supports his sister who lives with him.
He has worked at the Mozambique Water Company for over four years and earns a monthly income which he uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan he intends to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, metal sheets and small pebbles. This is his third loan with Hluvuku, and the previous loans were used for the same purpose.
In the future he intends to build an aviary in order to raise chickens for selling. He also intends to open a store. His biggest challenge is finishing his construction work.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as sand, cement, metal sheets and small pebbles.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married father of two children, whom he works hard to improve and secure their living conditions.
He lives in a conflict zone, but he is working hard to keep his business improving and his family in a good living.
His shop's location is very attracting to new customers, but just like any business, Ali needs an external support to increase his business income and develop it through adding new released products.

Today, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his stock with special seasonal fruits and vegetables at good prices and with special offers.

He is working hard to start wholesale trade but he needs more capital to take this step forward, and hopes that the conflict in his region will be solved soon.

loans.use: To increase his stock with new season fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en:
Awatef is a 53-year-old married mother of five children. Awatef is a Palestinian refugee who lives and runs her business from a Palestinian camp. She has been working selling men's, women's and children's shoes since 2006 to provide the best living for her family.

Her income combined with her husband's isn't enough to cover all of their needs, thus she has to expand and develop her business properly to be capable of replying to her family's needs.
 
Awatef has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower for four consecutive cycles with effective and encouraging feedback.

Today, her requested loan will be invested in buying a special-released summer shoes collection, especially before the Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

She hopes to expand her working zone, to improve her income, and to develop her family's living.

loans.use: To buy a special-released summer shoes collection, especially before the Holy month of Ramadan celebrations.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is an 18-year-old single man who has been working since 2012 as a sales person in a grocery store in his village to cover his living expenses since he left school during his secondary education.

Michelle is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to  pay for necessary dental medication.

He hopes to establish his own grocery store in the future, and increase his income.

loans.use: To pay for necessary dental medication.

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias is 38 years old and lives in San Pablo, Dumingag, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married with four children who are now at their school ages. He is engaged in food vending and delivers his food products to the nearby schools in their town. He earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

Jeremias has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional ingredients and other consumable products for his business. He has been a member of PMPC for almost two years. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and dreams that someday his family will live a good life together.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and other consumable products

loans.name: Ayyob

texts.en:
Ayyob is a 23-year-old married man from Bethlehem City. He is a father for two young sons. 

For the past four years, Ayyob has been working in raising sheep; he sells the meat and milk to the local traders. Ayyob would like to improve his business and expand it so he took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy feed for his sheep. By taking this loan, Ayyob will be able to improve his project and increase the productivity. 

Ayyob appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy feed for his sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: Freddy de 19 años de edad, es propietario de una miscelanea donde vende articulos de papelería detalles para el hogar, vestidos para niños, medias, pantalonetas etc, Muchos de sus vecinos conocen su negocio y son sus principales clientes y tabien le refieren amigos que se convierten en sus compradores. Así poco a poco su negocio crece y requiere cada vez mas diversidad en su oferta. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito mientas sus compras las hace a acréidtos en almacenes que le oferecen oportunidades de descuentos. En la familia de Fréddy sus padres son comerciantes pues tienen una refresquería y ellos han sido los primeros impulsadores de su emprendimiento con el fin de que al terminar su bachillerato tuviera ingresos propios. Eso mismo fue lo que él hizodesde hace 2 años, cuando empezó vendiendo pocos articulos como libretas, boligrafoes y papelería en genera y hoy sus ventas no se detienen. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio mediante y buen surtido y generar ingresos para continuar profesionalizandose, pues actualmente es un técnico de mercadeo y ventas y de comercio exterior y quiere avanzar aun mas. En la actualidad está aplicano a un credikiva, primer finaciamineot que hace ala Fudnación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará utiles de papelería, ropa y detalles para el hogar.
