Con esta inversión su negocio tendrá aun mas surtido e impulsará el incrmento de sus ventas y responderá a su gran desafio de obtener recursos con los cuales invertir y ganar un poco mas, lo que hace que esta inversión sea exitosa
texts.en:
Freddy is 19 years old and the owner of a small general store that sells stationery, home accessories, children's clothing, socks, shorts, etc. Many of his neighbors know his business and are his principal customers. They also refer their friends to Freddy, who then become customers. This is why Freddy's business is growing and why more and more he needs to offer a greater variety of products. Freddy sells both on a cash basis and on credit, and he buys his inventory on credit from wholesalers that offer him discounts.

Freddy's parents also have their own business, a small store selling soft drinks. They encouraged Freddy to start his business so that he would have his own income when he finished high school. That is exactly what he did two years ago, when he started selling a few items such as notebooks, pens and other stationery. Today, his sales show no signs of slowing down. Freddy's goal is to grow his business by buying more inventory. He would like to earn more income so that he can continue in his profession. So far he has learned marketing, sales and cross-border trade, but he would like to go further.

This Kiva loan is Freddy's first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (FMSD). He will use the loan to buy stationery supplies, clothing and home accessories. This loan will allow Freddy to overcome one of his greatest challenges, which is to obtain resources so that he can invest in more inventory, increase his sales and earn more income, all of which would make this loan a success.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies, clothing and home accessories to sell in his store.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 53 years old, married, and a resident of Casul, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is a widow, with three children, two of whom are in school.  

Starting with capitalization of PHP 3,000, Esmeralda opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2008 and she has taken out three loans. 

Now Esmeralda is applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. 

In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday and she will be fully-satisfied, if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her sari-sari.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, jornalero, estudió hasta tercer grado porque no pudo continuar sus estudios, esta acompañado, es padre de 6 hijos de 32, 30, 28, 25, 23 y 21 años de edad de los cuales solo tres viven y dependen de él. Su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos. José junto con sus 3 hijos se dedica en tiempo de verano a la zafra (corta de caña) y en el invierno se dedica a la agricultura y hortalizas, José camina dos kilómetros y medio para llegar a su trabajo, él trabaja en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono, herbicidas y pesticidas, para la siembra de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, así podrá obtener mejores ingresos para darles una mejor alimentación a su grupo familiar.

José espera mejorar su cultivo con el préstamo otorgado, para sacar una mejor cosecha. El sueño de José es ampliar más su trabajo para obtener más ingresos en la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
José, age 56, is a day laborer.  He went to school through the third grade because he was not able to continue his education.  He is in a relationship, and he has six children.  They are 32, 30, 28, 25, 23, and 21 years old.  Only three of them live with him and are dependent upon him.  His life partner does the domestic chores.

In the summertime José and his three children cut the sugarcane.  In the winter they grow vegetables.  José walks two and a half kilometers to get to his work.  He works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.

He plans to use the loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides for his 7,000 square meters of corn.  This way he will be able to get better income in order to give his family better food.

José hopes to improve his crops with the loan.  He will do this in order to get a better harvest.  Jose’s dream is to expand his work in order to get more income in the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, and pesticides for his 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Sayama

texts.en:
Sayama is a 40-year-old woman.  She lives with her husband Trayajul and their two children in the small village of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and just knows how to sign her name because she could not study due to the financial crisis of her family.  Her husband is a professional businessman who buys and sells cows. Only one of her children is studying in grade 11. The other one is associated with farming vegetables.

Sayama 's husband does not have sufficient income to run the family smoothly. So Sayama has been working in animal husbandry for five years. She is a hardworking lady and has the courage to get ahead in life. She keeps her faith in her ability.  She has a milk cow and she sells milk in her neighborhood.Her husband also assists in her dairy business (as shown in the above picture).

In order to expand her business, she wants to purchase a cow and for that, she needs money. So she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to purchase another cow and she hopes to improve her milk supply business.  It will provide her with a steady income to tide them over rough patches and allow them to save for their future. She dreams of building a concrete house in the future with the profit from her business. She wants to save money to construct a concrete house for them to live in. She is thankful for her lenders, BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Эту профессиональную швею зовут Фарогат. Ей 48 лет. Она в течение 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных и европейских женских платьев. Фарогат замужем, у нее 20-летняя дочь. Она студентка и учится во втором курсе. В выходные дни дочь помогает матери в ее деятельности. Фарогат сейчас планирует расширить деятельность. Она хочет купить модернизированную швейную машинку и для этой цели просит кредит. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: The name of this professional seamstress is Farogat. She is 48 years old. She has been involved in sewing national and European women's dresses for 10 years. Farogat is married and has a 20-year-old daughter, who is a second-year college student. Her daughter helps her with the business on the weekends. Farogat is currently planning to expand her business. She wants to purchase a current sewing machine and is requesting a loan for this purpose. She hopes for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Tám

texts.en:
Mr. Tám works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. He has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Tám is 37 years old, and he is married with two children. He lives with one dependent in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tám’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Tám faces in his life is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a new toilet.

With his business profit, Tám hopes for his business to do well and for his children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement and sand to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Tân Lai 6 Xã Tân Khang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Là has a service business raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Là faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Là is 47 years old and married with four children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 Tân Lai 6 xã Tân Khang solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2010, Là joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Là hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Sergio De Jesús

texts.es:
Sergio de 45 años de edad, jornalero, estudió hasta segundo grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivían sus padres, esta casado y es padre de 3 hijos de 24, 22 y 20 años de edad de los cuales uno esta estudiando. Sergio se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales desde hace 30 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre. 

Para llegar a su trabajo, Sergio viaja en bicicleta un kilometro, trabaja junto con uno de los hijos en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de una vaca lechera, y así podrá tener más ingresos para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

El sueño de Sergio es que su hijo sea un profesional, llegar a tener 50 animales y pagar el crédito que tiene con la institución.
texts.en:
Sergio is 45 years old. He is a day laborer and he only completed the second grade. He couldn’t keep studying because his parents lived in poor conditions. He is married and has 3 children. They are 24, 22, and 20 years old. One of the kids is studying. Sergio has been a farmer and has been raising animals for over 30 years. He learned this job from his father. To get to work, Sergio rides his bike for one kilometer. He works with one of his sons from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m.

The loan he is requesting to CREDICAMPO is to buy a dairy cow so he can have more income to offer his family a better life.  Sergio’s dream is that his son becomes a professional. He would like to have 50 animals and to pay off the debt he has with the institution.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rita

texts.ru: Рите, 26лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Риты- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2003 году с 8,000 сом (KGS), благодаря целеустремленности и трудолюбию Риты, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть: 1 дойная корова, и 10 овец. Также в сезон Рита предоставляет гостиничные услуги туристам в джайлоо. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рита обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки овец. Рита намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что приведет к получению большей совокупной прибыли от перепродажи скота и мяса. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в улучшение жилищных условий семьи, а именно сделать ремонт.
texts.en: Rita is 26 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Rita has a secondary education and, to provide the primary source of income for her family, is involved in farming and animal husbandry. Started in 1995 with 8,000 som (KGS), thanks to Rita's drive and hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 10 sheep. Rita also provides hotel services in a jailoo (yurt) for tourists during the season. In order to further develop her business, Rita requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep. Rita intends to increase her livestock headcount, which would lead to earning a larger total profit from reselling livestock and meat. Rita plans to invest the earnings from the loan into improving her family's living conditions by making repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and lives in Lourmah, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four adult children. She has a small sari-sari store, and a small area of rice field near their house. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity and every 4 or 5 months from her rice crops. 

Virginia has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and fertilizer products for her rice field. She has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and live a good life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and fertilizer products

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 33 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently lives with her husband and three children. She is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Alma wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 37 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 4 filhos, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que se encontra em Maputo. 
É negociante a mais de 7 anos, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o seu negócio adquirindo produtos da 1ª necessidade como: óleo, arroz, coco, e tomate. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que todos foram aplicados para mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende adquirir um camião para transportar a sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Isabel comes from Maputo. She's 37 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom attend school, and she supports her mother who lives in Maputo.
She has been a vendor for over seven years and earns an income which she uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan she intends to expand her business by purchasing products that are household staples such as cooking oil, rice, coconuts and tomatoes. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and all of the loan were used for the same purpose.
In the future she intends to purchase a truck for carrying her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples such as cooking oil, rice, coconuts and tomatoes.

loans.name: Dinis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em manjacas Província De Gaza tem 64 anos de idade é casado oficialmente é pai de 3 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pelas seus cunhados que estão em xai-xai enviando lhes um valor. 
É agricultor a mais de 10 anos, explora uma área de 5 hectare. Com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o volume da sua produção na machamba adquirindo adubos e viveiros de repolho.
Futuramente pretende iniciar a criação de frangos e suínos para a venda. O seu maior desafio é conquistar novo mercado para a venda dos seus produtos da machamba.
texts.en:
Dinis comes from Manjacas, province of Gaza. He's 64 years old and officially married. He has three adult children and supports his brothers-in-law who live in Xai-Xai by sending them money.
He has been a farmer for over ten years and exploits a 5-hectare plot of land. With this loan he intends to increase production levels on his farm by purchasing fertilizers and cabbage gardens.
In the future he intends to start raising chickens and pigs for selling. His biggest challenge is conquering new markets in order to sell his farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cabbage gardens.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 46 years old. She is a woman in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Srey is a cook and earns approximately 7 USD per day. She would like to apply for loan of 1,500 USD to purchase rice to resell for profit. This loan helps her get more income. 

In the future, Srey hopes that she can expand her business of purchasing and selling rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell for profit

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha is 52 years old. She is a married woman with three children at Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For a living, she makes dried fish for sale, and her husband grows mushrooms for sale. Both of them can earn approximately $16 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 for purchasing plastic bags, rice bran and spawn for growing mushrooms. This loan will help her family make more income. In the future, she hopes that she can expand on growing mushrooms.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bags, rice bran and spawn to grow mushrooms.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for seventeen years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by collecting metal scraps and other fragments to be sold to junk shops.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 25,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit to continue operations of her business.

In the future, Rosalie hopes to be able to purchase a permit for her trading business, so that she could continually support her children in their studies.

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y vive en el Distrito de Parcona junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja como Obrero de Campo en una Agroexportadora y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. A pesar de ser joven trabaja día tras día para brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprarse una moto para poder movilizarse de su casa a su trabajo sin ningún inconveniente y así pueda ahorrar dinero para más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su negocio propio".
texts.en: Jose is an enterprising young man. He is 19 years old, single and lives in the district of Parcona, together with his family. For almost a year he has been working as a farm worker in an agricultural exporting company, and he is doing very well because he is a very responsible and hardworking person. He is very dedicated to his job and wants to move forward. Despite his age, he works day by day to offer the best to his family. Jose is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have given him. With it he will be able to buy a motorcycle to transport himself from his home to his work without problems, and be able to save money so in time he is able to fulfill his greatest dream: "to have his own business".

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for personal use

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is married with three children. She is 53 years old and lives in Señor Sinacaban, Philippines.

Juana sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Juana has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta requested a 14,900 PHP loan through PMPC to buy more coconut to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase coconut to sell

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is 63 years old and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Emerenciana is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy sacks of feed. Emerenciana has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. 

In the future, Emerenciana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has been operating her own direct selling business for many years, and she earns well from this. The couple had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide their child with a better education. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her child.

To improve sales, Delia would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantity of clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she hopes for her business to grow bigger and for her family to be always happy and to have sufficiency in everything.

She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta tercer grado, no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la economía, esta acompañada, es madre de 4 hijos de 25, 22, 20 y 13 años de edad de los cuales uno esta estudiando mientras que los otros tres se dedican a trabajar. Su compañero de vida trabaja como motorista. María se dedica atender su pequeña tienda desde hace 12 años, trabajo que fue aprendiendo poco a poco de su madre.
El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para surtir más la tienda, comprara huevos, azucar, embutidos, galletas, sardinas, lácteos, bebidas, etc. Para obtener más productos y así satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.

El sueño de María es tener un minisúper, que su hijo se gradúe como profesional y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, age 44, is a housewife who studied until the 3rd grade. She couldn’t continue her studies due to the lack of resources. She has a life companion and is a mother of 4 children, ages 25, 22, 20 and 13. The youngest is still studying, and the other three work. 

Her life companion works as a driver. María has worked at her own store for the last 12 years. This is an activity that she learned gradually from her mother. 

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to supply her store. She will buy eggs, sugar, cold meats, cookies, sardines, dairy, beverages, etc. With this, she will have more products to satisfy her clients’ needs. 

María’s dream is to establish a minimarket, see her son become a professional and improver her house.

loans.use: to supply her store: buy eggs, sugar, cold meats, cookies, sardines, dairy, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina has worked in the field for as long as she can remember. Being a single mom always gave her more responsibilities and more energy, she believes, to endure the hardships of labor. Marcelina lives now with her two youngest children. Although she gets a pension because of her age, she still does some work to cover the household expenses. In total, she makes around $800 USD as her monthly income. When she started receiving her pension, she expanded her house to include a bedroom, a living room, and a larger kitchen. However, she soon found that she miscalculated the expenses and did not have the right technical knowledge to do it alone and applied for a credit and technical assistance. Given her age and low income, Marcelina is not able to apply for a credit with other institutions. She is asking for this credit to buy materials needed to complete the house by installing windows, door and replace the dirt floor with cement. Marcelina will receive technical assistance and supervision visits by expert architects to make sure the construction work is not only finished, but also built for lasting quality. Marcelina is excited to see her house improvements completed; she has been investing for some years trying to complete it so she can live more comfortably. Now, with guidance and help, she'll be able to do so.

loans.use: to buy materials to install windows, doors and cement floor to her house

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Quelimane Província de Zambézia, tem 36 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade dos quais  2  frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Trabalha na Educação a mais de 8 anos  como docente e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende dar continuidade a sua obra comprando material de construção como: tinta, tijoleiras e cimento. Futuramente pretende continuar com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Julieta comes from Quelimane, province of Zambézia. She's 36 years old and married. She has three underage children, two of whom attend school. She doesn't support anyone else.
She has worked in the field of education for over eight years as a teacher and earns an income which she uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan she intends to continue her construction work by purchasing construction supplies such as paint, tiles and cement. In the future she intends to move forward with her studies all the way to a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as paint, tiles and cement.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn Cộng Hòa Vạn Thiện Group

texts.en:
Mai works in agriculture, farming food. She is applying for a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.  Mai is 46 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn Cộng Hòa Vạn Thiện Solidarity Group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Mai has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is a farmer and lives with wife Eloisa and his three sons.  Every morning Raul gets up before the sun comes up to work in the field.  He plants tomatoes, cactus and cucumber in Totolapan, Morelos.  Meanwhile, Eloisa stays home cleaning, cooking, and taking care of their younger child who is just 4 years old.  Their hard work earns them roughly $550 USD a month.  

Raul has worked hard for over 30 years and has been able to build a home for his family.  Recently, two bedrooms were added on the second floor.  Before this expansion, the whole family used to live in a single bedroom; now the children sleep in their new room with just mattresses and no windows.  

This loan will help him make the payment for the materials needed to finish the construction with proper doors and floor.  Raul has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and has irregular cash flows.  The whole family will work together to build this addition to their home.  They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and to prevent them from losing all the time and money they have already invested.  In less than 3 months, Raul, Eloisa, and the kids will be able to live in a better house with proper windows and floors.

loans.use: to buy materials to install windows, doors and cement floors in two rooms

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is married with two adult age children. He has had a coconut farm for five years. In this business he approximately earns PHP 10,000 each month. Alex wants a loan to buy a motorcycle for his transportation and he wants to give good services to his clients. In the future, Alex wants to expand his business, and to provide good living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is 64 years old, married, and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental.  She wants to help her husband through engaging in buying and selling whole nuts.  She is thankful that PMPC helped in her funding needs. Now, she has requested an amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks of whole nuts to sell.  She hopes to buy another cocoland out from her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of whole nuts to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Until recently Juana lived with her husband Pedro in what seemed to be a comfortable house.  Maria Elena, one of their children, moved in a couple of months ago with her four kids.  Maria Elena is a hard working mom with her own business, a beauty salon.  When her father, Pedro, couldn’t work as a farmer any more because of his age, Maria Elena employed her mother as an assistant at the salon. 

Maria Elena has been running her business for the last 15 years and making around $700USD a month.  However, Maria Elena was recently divorced and her parents welcomed her back to their home to give her and her children a place to live.  Maria Elena is saving to one day have her own place so tries to avoid complaining about the small space and the fact that she shares a tin ceiling bedroom with her kids and a bathroom with the rest of the house.  Juana knows the space is too small, and that it will be years before her daughter can save enough to move to a house of her own. 

Juana is thankful to her daughter for giving Pedro and her an income.  In return, Juana has been saving to build a new bedroom, install proper roofs and build a bathroom for the new family members in the house.  She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed.  Because of her age, Juana is not able to get a loan from other banks or organizations.  The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new room will give this extended family a safe place to live and grow.

loans.use: to buy materials to install windows, doors and cement floor in two rooms

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
egina,26, is a young mother of three that lives with her family in Totolapan, Morelos. Regina works selling the crops of her neighbor and roughly makes around one dollar per day. Her working hours are long and has to manage to cook and do other chores. Regina lives in a one bedroom house where she sleeps with her husband Eri, a local driver, and their two children Margarita and Santiago. Regina and Eri have been living here for the last 10 years, working hard to save and continuously improve their house. 
Since Regina and Eri do not have formal jobs and their income is low and variable, neither of them have access to credit from banks or other organizations. Regina wants to cover the dirt floor in there children's room with cement as well as the floor in the living room. She is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. With the new floor the room to give the kids their own space to play, sleep and study will be completed as well as the family room.  
Regina and Eri did not have the chance to finish their education and were forced to drop out after elementary. They want to make sure they take the right steps to give better opportunities to their children, and support them as they work their way through school.

loans.use: To buy materials to cover the dirt floor with cement in her children's room and living room

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela lives with her husband, Anastacio, and two children, Luis Felipe and Lucero, in Totolapan Morelos.  Maricela has been working in the market buying and selling crops for a local employer.  Anastacio works in the fields employed by one of their neighbors. 
Maricela and Anastacio bought a piece of land 8 years ago and had great plans to build a house for the whole family.  Maricela became pregnant with Lucero and had to delay their building plans since she had to stop working for a while. 
Today Maricela and Anastacio make around $700 USD a month through informal jobs, so accessing credit is impossible for them. Maricela and Anastacio have been saving to install doors and windows in their house and cover some parts of dirt floor with cement.  Maricela needs this loan to finish paying for the construction materials which include windows, doors and installing a cement floor.  This addition will give everyone a secure shelter and the space they need to fully develop.  
The family will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction.  The new construction will give this family the home they have been dreaming of for so long.  Maricela is aware that dedication and hard work is what makes dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy materials to install doors, windows and cement floor in her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a young resident of the Kawangware slum. After completing school he found it difficult to find a job that paid a decent wage, and he went through many jobs in the informal sector but none of them paid well or were fulfilling to him. He now sells eco-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves in slums around Nairobi. This earns him decent pay and also helps the community in which he lives.

He will use the loan to buy more stock to sell to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel efficient technologies to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 31 years old. He is a married man who has two children at Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For  a living, he repairs sofas and his wife is a tailor. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland to grow rice crops. This loan will help him make more income. In the future, he hopes that he can open a tailoring shop for his wife, and his children can get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase  farmland to grow rice crops.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through PMPC to buy fertilizer for corn production. She has been in this business for five years now. Roselyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn production.

loans.name: Janine

texts.en: For more than six years in farming, Janine was able to provide for the family along with her husband's income from barbershop services. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used on her farm. Their farm is still doing well. She took a new loan recently to buy new motorcycle to be used for their transportation and to carry their farm produce. In the future, Janine wants to make improvements to her house, to improve the general living conditions of her family, and to see her children successful.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to be used for their transportation and to carry their farm produce.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
Clarissa is 37 years old, and married with five children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Clarissa is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell to customers.

Clarissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, es ama de casa, no pudo estudiar por la economía, es madre soltera de 6 hijos de 48, 45, 43, 41, 38 y 35 años de edad de los cuales solo dos viven y dependen de ella, y cuatro que ya están casados. 

María se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde los cuales saca a vender cada 6 semanas, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como tomate, chile, etc. trabajo que aprendió en capacitaciones. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de concentrado para la crianza de 400 pollos, con eso ella podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para darles una mejor alimentación a su grupo familiar.
El sueño de María es poder comprar un terrenito y poder construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria, 63, is a homemaker.  She could not study due to the economy.  She is the single mother of six children 48, 45, 43, 41, 38 and 35 years old.  Of these children, only two live with her and depend on her.  The other four are already married. 

Maria makes a living raising chickens that she fattens and takes to sell every six weeks.  She also makes her living by cultivating vegetables like tomato, chile, etc., work which she learned in trainings.

The loan she is requesting in CREDICAMPO is to buy concentrate for raising 400 chickens.  With this, she will be able to obtain a little more income to better feed her family group.

Maria's dream is to be able to buy a little bit of land and to be able to construct a worthy house for her family.

loans.use: to buy concentrate for 400 chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en: Hillary (pictured left) is a budding entrepreneur from the slums of Kawangware, Kenya. He was unable to finance further education and decided to try on business to earn an income to pay rent and buy food. He has since become renown as the jiko man within the slum community and has great potential as a distributor of this life-changing product. Hillary will use this loan to finance his inventory in order to reach more customers who desperately need this product while at the same time slowly getting himself out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient cookstoves to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Guadalupe

texts.es: Esperanza es una señora de carácter tranquilo y muy amorosa con su esposo y sus 3  hijos de 5 y 7 años y uno de 3 meses, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillo juntamente con su esposo y un empleado que contratan para que les ayude en este negocio, esperanza    va a invertir el crédito en la compra de volquetas de tierra y de leña para fabricar su producto, Esperanza aspira ayudarse con el crédito que le otorga Fodemi para mejorar su negocio y seguir dando la educación a sus  2 hijos que actualmente están estudiando y pagar los gastos que implica estabilizar a su hijo menor que le nació prematuro.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman of a tranquil character and very loving with her husband and three children of 5 and 7 years old, and one of 3 months old. She makes a living by making bricks with her husband and an employee who they contract to help with the business. 
Esperanza will invest the loan in buying a dump truck load of earth and of firewood to create her product. Esperanza aspires to help herself with the loan that FODEMI grants her in order to improve her business and continue to give her two children the education that they are currently getting and to pay the expenses that they accrued to stabilize their son who was born premature.

loans.use: to buy firewood and earth.

loans.name: Phearom

texts.en: Phearom is 32 years old. She is a married woman with three children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in making hats since 2000 and earns approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband has been providing transportation services to the factory laborers since 2009 and earns approximately $15 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase zinc roofing sheets to renovate her kitchen. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can purchase a Hyundai porter to provide transportation service to clients.

loans.use: to purchase zinc roofing sheets to renovate her kitchen.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is 39 years old and has five children who are currently in school. Genaro, her husband, works as a construction worker. She operates a rug-making business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She mainly offers rugs; from those round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with everyday. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 in sales every week.

Delia is taking out PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other stuffs, which are necessary to increase her inventory. In the future, she dreams of being successful in life and business. She hopes that she could meet their everyday needs through all her hard work.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 37 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. 

To earn a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in her business for ten years and earns well to augment their living. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012, and now she has requested a loan to buy feeding supplies and vitamins for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol is 37 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Carol works very hard to provide for them. Carol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, laundry soap, shampoo and other groceries.  In the future, Carol would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Shahane

texts.en:
Shahane is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

Shahane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as soft drinks, sardines and other groceries.

She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from selling personal products.

Shahane aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as soft drinks, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Adamson

texts.en:
Adamson, age 43, is a farmer in Chibombo District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

Like many farmers in Chibombo, Adamson earns a living farming maize during the rainy season, and earns extra income by selling valuable vegetable crops during the dry season. Using buckets, Adamson has been able to grow cabbage and a local eggplant called “Impwa”, that he then sells to large markets in Zambia’s Copperbelt region. 

Rent to Own has worked with Adamson to create a business plan for this dry season, and has concluded that a water pump will allow him to increase his production and profits. Rent to Own will deliver the water pump directly to his farm, and provide him with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump. 

Adamson is planning on adding tomatoes and butternut squash to his vegetable crops this season. He hopes to be able to use the profits to expand his cattle herd and continue to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Brighton

texts.en:
Brighton, 27, lives in Kabwe District, Zambia with his wife and two children. He is asking for a loan so that he can obtain a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his garden.

Last season, Brighton grew tomatoes, drawing water by hand from a nearby well in order to irrigate them. This season, he has big plans to expand his production, and will need a water pump in order to keep up with the irrigation required during Zambia’s dry season.

Rent to Own has worked with Brighton to create a business plan for this growing season. Rent to Own will deliver the water pump directly to Brighton’s farm and provide him with training on how to use and maintain the water pump, and will check in to provide support until he has completed his loan.

With a water pump, Brighton is planning to also start growing different crops, including watermelons, which are popular at markets within Kabwe.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine

loans.name: Trust

texts.en:
Trust, is a farmer with two children from the farming area of Chibombo District, Zambia.  He is a returning client with a proven track record, and is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a second water pump to continue expanding his garden crops.

Last season, Trust supplied watermelons, butternut squash and green peppers to large markets in Zambia’s capital city, Lusaka. This year, he is planning to add new fields to also grow onions and eggplant. With an additional water pump, Trust will be able to offer a variety of produce at scale – a true rural farming enterprise!

Rent to Own has completed a seasonal business plan with Trust, and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own will also provide training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and provide on-going support until his loan is complete.

Trust is eager to expand his production so that he can continue to effectively supply the larger markets in the capital city.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Marietes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marites works hard to support her family. She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing.  Marites is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell for her frozen foods business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh Lò Thị was born in 1980. Currently she lives with her husband and 2 children in a poor locality in Mai Son district, Son La province.
The mainly income of her family is primarily based on farming and breeding  However, the source of income to feed two school age children also makes her family having more difficulties. She looks forward to having a loan to cover the learning of her two children.
She expects the loan will help to ensure her two children with good education, which will bring a bright future to her children.

loans.use: to cover the learning of her two children

loans.name: Fridah Njoki's Group

texts.en: These young men and women represent a promising group of entrepreneurs working as independent distributors of energy efficient stoves and solar lamps in Kawangware, Nairobi. This is a densely populated slum area where access to life-changing technology is difficult despite these various technologies being targeted towards the very population that lives in Kawangware. Despite having little to no education, these men and women have taken it upon themselves to find a venture that not only helps them make their way out of poverty but also brings positive externalities to their community. They will use this loan to finance inventory to take their sales to the next level.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient products to sell

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a resident of the Kawangware slum. After completing school he found it difficult to find a job that paid a decent wage. Instead of engaging in illegal activities like many youth in poor urban settlements do, he decided to start a business that would earn him money legally. He now sells eco-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves in slums around Nairobi. This earns him decent pay and also helps the community in which he lives. He will use the loan to buy more stock to sell to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase energy efficient products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salon hair products and other equipment

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en: Phalla is 33 years old. He is a married man with three children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman and his wife is a garment factory laborer. Both of them can earn approximately $12 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $800 to pay for smoothing the land for farming. This loan will help him grow more rice crops. In the future, he hopes that he can build a house as soon as possible and that his children can get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To pay for smoothing the land for farming

loans.name: Maleta

texts.en: Maleta is a 52-year-old mother of six children. She runs a small elei printing business. She sells to the people around her community and to the public in town. She also makes meat buns, which she not only sells to the schoolchildren but to people around her village. She will use this loan to purchase fabric materials, fabric paints, paint brushes and rolls for her elei business, and water tools (mouth, long plastic stick, elbow, glue) for a new tab for water for their family. She has managed to improve the livelihood of her family with the profits she is able to make from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, fabric paints, paint brushes, rolls, and water tools

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: As a married mother of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business. Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 58 years old and married with eight children, two of whom are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods, diapers and other groceries.  In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aramathan

texts.en: Aramathan is a 57-year-old married male with 4 children of whom two go to school; he has been in the retail business for thirteen years located on a busy street plus rentals as additional income.He used the previous loan to buy clothes,sugar,salt and maize flour to sell. Aramathan has a vision of  expanding his business however, competition and price fluctuation are difficulties he faces. He needs the loan to buy sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn Fernanda

texts.es: A sus 19 años de edad Evelyn se dedica a la crianza de chanchos hace 2 años, ella vive con sus abuelitos y comenta que se encuentra estudiando en un instituto donde asiste a clases los fines de semana, con el dinero que le otorgue Fodemi Evelyn va a comprar chanchos para de ahí obtener los ingresos suficientes para seguir costeándose sus estudios por medio los que aspira llegar a ser toda una profesional y servir a la sociedad mediante su educación.
texts.en:
19 year-old Evelyn has made a living raising pigs for 2 years.  She lives with her grandparents and she takes classes at an institute on the weekends.

With the money granted by Fodemi, Evelyn will buy pigs so that she can make enough income to continue paying for her studies by any means necessary.  She aspires to become a proper professional and serve society through her education.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Oscar Isaac

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado de primaria, está casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales no estudian por ser menores de 4 años, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Oscar se dedica a la agricultura, también trabaja de albañil cuando se le da la oportunidad ya que aprendió como ayudante y luego decidió ponerlo en práctica, para llegar al trabajo a veces se va en bicicleta o caminando ya que donde tiene el cultivo no hay otro acceso. 

Él necesita este crédito para poner luz eléctrica en su casa y terminar de arreglarla ya que es bien difícil hacerlo sin la ayuda de nadie. 

Él sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales o al menos que tuvieran su propio negocio aunque dice respetar la decisión q ellos tomen cuando ellos sean adultos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 32 years old. He went to school up to the fourth grade. He is married and has two children who don't go to school because they are under 4. His wife is a housewife.   

Oscar works in farming. He also works as a bricklayer when he has the chance. He learned as an assistant and later decided to put it into practice. To get to work, he often goes on foot or in bicycle, since where he has his crops has no other access. 

He needs this loan to install electricity in his house and to finish fixing it up, because it is very difficult to do it without anyone's help. 

He dreams of his children going to college or at least having their own businesses, although he says he will respect the decisions they make when they are adults.

loans.use: to install electricity in his house and finish fixing it up.

loans.name: Starford

texts.en:
Starford, 40, is a business owner and farmer with 6 children from Kabwe District, Zambia. He is asking for a loan for a water pump that will help him irrigate and expand his vegetable crops

Starford has been growing tomatoes, cabbage, onion and okra on his farm to supply local markets in Kabwe. Using buckets, he has been drawing water from a nearby well to irrigate his crops. This is an extremely labour intensive task, especially now that the dry season has begun.

Rent to Own worked with Starford to create a business plan for his gardening season and will deliver the water pump directly to his farm. Rent to Own also provides training on how to use and properly maintain the pump, and will check in to provide support until he has paid off his loan.

With a water pump, Starford will be able to ensure his garden is properly irrigated during the dry season, and will even be able to expand his production.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
ulio Cesar is a farmer and lives with his wife Rosa and their son.  Every morning, he gets up before the sun rises to work in the field.  Meanwhile, Rosa stays home cleaning, cooking, and taking care of their child.  Every afternoon, Rosa goes out with their son to sell what Julio Cesar grows in the field.  Their hard work earns them roughly $600 USD a month. 
Julio Cesar has worked hard over the years and has been able to build a home for his family.  However, their house is small even for the young family.  They all live, cook, eat and sleep in the same room.  Julio and Rosa know that more children will come soon and they need to expand before that happens.  The family is asking for a loan to build one additional room.  This loan will help them pay for the materials needed to finish the construction and get expert supervision. 
Julio Cesar has no access to credit with other organizations because he has an informal job that does not pay much and has irregular cash flows.  The family will work together to build this addition to their home.  They will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction, and to prevent them from losing all the time and money they have already invested.  In less than 3 months, Julio Cesar, Rosa and their child will be able to live in a better house with more space, that allows them to lead a healthier lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a new room

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala was born in 1991. She is a single lady who lives with her parents and four siblings. Hala is a conservative lady and she asked her father to appear in this picture in her place. Her father is well-known for his shoe-making business and Hala has been helping him. His business is their only source of income but he doesn't have enough money to expand.

Hala is requesting a youth loan to help her father purchase a new shoe press machine to make him more productive and raise his income.

loans.use: to buy a new shoe press machine

loans.name: Sor's Group

texts.en: Sor’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Sor makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs. She also does extra work as a teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brand-name clothes and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en: Nan’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nan makes a living cultivating rice with her family and she also does extra work selling groceries from home to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Leap’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Leap makes a living cultivating rice with her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yut's Group

texts.en: Yut’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yut makes a living cultivating rice with her family and her sons also do extra work as farm laborers to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en: Yin’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yin makes a living cultivating rice and also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. Phuong is 24 years old, married and has a baby. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family’s member, especially her kid. She has daily income from pig raising activity and fishing so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Mrs. Binh is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a small house and without hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. With more than 20 years experience and has support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van is 42 years old, married and has five children, three of them are schooling. She works very hard to feed &education her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but she lacks the necessary capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from fishing and selling chicken in her garden.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Sameth

texts.en: Sameth is 42 years old. She is a married woman with three children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Two of her children are garment factory laborers and one is a blacksmith. All of them can earn approximately $19 per day. Sameth would like to apply for a loan of $500 to purchase the equipment of a blacksmith. This loan will help her son make more income for the family. In the future, she hopes that she can build a bathroom and a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment of a blacksmith.

loans.name: Punipuao

texts.en: Punipuao is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She bakes and sells pancakes to the members of her community and also to the school kids. She also bakes and sells banana chips to the same clientele. She will use this loan to purchase sacks of sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, flour, spoons, pots and pans, large frying pan and cooking stove for her business. She has been doing this for more than two years and has managed to improve her family's living standards with the profits she has been making from her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, flour, spoons, pots and pans, large frying pan and cooking stove for her baking business.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en: Sarat is 32 years old. He is a construction foreman in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia and earns approximately $6 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps him reduce transportation expenses. In the future, he hopes that he can increase his business capital for doing construction.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Panda Província de Inhambane tem 66 anos de idade casado oficialmente pai de 6 filhos maiores de idade não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É médico reformado aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa. Com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo ração, pintos e vitaminas. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que os últimos foram aplicados para mesma actividade.
Futuramente pretende construir mais aviários para a criação de poedeiras. O seu maior desafio é expandir o seu negócio para satisfazer as necessidades dos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro comes from Panda, province of Inhambane. He's 66 years old and officially married. He has six adult children and doesn't support anyone else.
He's a retired physician and earns an income which he uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan he intends to increase turnover in his chicken farm business by purchasing feed, chicks and vitamins. This is his third loan with Hluvuku and the previous loans were used for the same purpose.
In the future he intends to build more coops in order to raise laying hens. His biggest challenge is expanding his business so that he can meet his customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase feed, chicks and vitamins.

loans.name: Tsetsenbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Tsetsenbayar is 31 years old and lives with her spouse and child in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives in a Mongolian ger (traditional nomads felt tent). She is a skilled hairdresser and has been working for two years in a local salon. Her husband is a taxi driver. Their only child goes to kindergarten. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to repair and buy an extra (additional) felt roof for her ger. If she renews her ger and buys an extra felt roof, her family will feel comfortable and stay warm in the Mongolian harsh winter while using less coal, which increases air pollution in her country.

loans.use: to renew her ger (Mongolian nomadic felt tent) and buy an extra felt roof

loans.name: Julia Marisela

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene la edad de 23 años, esta acompañada y tiene un niño de 2 años. Ella es una persona activa, emprendedora, entregada a su trabajo y llena de sueños los cuales piensa lograr poco a poco. Labora para el ministerio de salud desde hace 1 1/2 año, se desempeña como auxiliar de enfermeria labor que la realiza con mucha entrega y responsabilidad. El credito le ayudara de gran manera, ya que sera para reparacion de la vivienda, repellara las paredes de la sala y cambiaran el techo.
texts.en: Julia is 23. She is in a relationship and has a 2 year old child. She is an active, enterprising person who is committed to her work and full of dreams, which she thinks of achieving little by little. She has been working for the ministry of health for one and a half years. She serves as a nurse's assistant, a job she does with much commitment and responsibility. The loan will help her a lot, since it will allow her to improve her life, rebuild the walls of her house, and change the roof.

loans.use: to buy bricks, purlins, iron and cement.

loans.name: Dania Scarlett

texts.es: Dania tiene la edad de 22 años, es casada y tiene un niño de 10 meses, es una persona alegre, trabajadora, emprendedora,con sueños y metas por cumplir a corto plazo. Ella labora para la Alcaldia desde hace 4 1/2 años, en donde se desempeña como Responsable de Caja. Dania actualmente culmino sus estudios en la universidad y en un futuro no muy lejano continuara estudiando, ya que desea sacar su segunda carrera de Administracion y de esta forma lograr otras oportunidades. Comenta que el credito va a estar de gran ayuda ya que logro hacer un rancho de palma en su casa de habitacion que es entre sus metas, con el objetivo de recibir a sus amistades en un lugar fresco y acogedor.
texts.en: Dania is 22 years old. She is married and has a 10 month old son. She is a happy, hardworking, enterprising person with dreams and goals to accomplish in the short term. She has been working for the Mayor's office for the last 4 and a half years, where she serves as the managing cashier. Currently, Dania has already finished her studies in the university and in the not so distant future, she will continue to study, since she wants to get a second diploma in Administration and, in this manner, achieve other opportunities. She says that the loan will be a great help to her since she will be able to make a thatched roof in her house which is one of her goals, in order to have friends come to a cool and cozy place

loans.use: to buy palms, wood, nails, plastic and pay for labor.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reina es habitante del municipio de chichigalpa es casada tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo tres tiene a su cargo en edades escolares es una mujer emprendedora que día a día trabaja en el mercado municipal cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas desde hace 6 años la señora canales utiliza el préstamo brindado para la compra de frutas escasas en el invierno como es :La manzana , el perote,uvas y para gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Reina is a Chichigalpa resident who is married with 5 children,  three of which are school age children who are still in her care.

She is an enterprising woman who has had a small fruit stand in the market for the last 6 years. 

She will use this loan for the purchase of fruit that is rare during the winter, apples, grapes and other fruits to pay for her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruit for her stall

loans.name: Carolina Elizabeth

texts.es: Carolina de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Carolina quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro perimetral en el lugar que muestra la fotografía ya que por las lluvias se está lavando el muro de tierra que se encuentra ahí, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra para poder construir dicho muro y si ella y su familia puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en:
Carolina is 38 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She owns a store, located at her place of residence, and her sales allow her to cover the expenses that come up in her household.

Carolina wants to improve her house by constructing an outer wall in the location shown in the photograph. The rains wash away the earthen wall that is there currently, but with what she earns from sales, she is not able to carry out her plan. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and iron and to pay for labor to construct the wall. In this way, she and her family can live more securely.

loans.use: to pay for sand, cement, brick, iron, and labor costs

loans.name: Patrocenio

texts.en: Patrocenio has operated a motorcycle transport service for 11 years and earns a good income for his family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that he used for the business. With his income, his wife was able to put up a retail store in their village. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to purchase additional goods for his wife's sari sari store.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: purchase additional goods for his wife's sari sari store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza  has been selling assorted grocery goods for six years while her husband does fishing. She earns enough to provide for the family's needs. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. Recently she borrowed a new loan to purchase additional goods for her sari sari store.

Analiza is hopeful that she will be able to improve her business in order to have a better source of income for the future of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari sari store.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita is 45 years old and married with two children. She lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She has just started operating a retail business to earn a living.  She joined GDMPC recently and now she has requested a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Lina has a personal products business in the Philippines. She has requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items to sell to customers.

Lina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 34 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Lilian's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. She is taking out a PHP 7,735 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lilian has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maricir

texts.en:
Maricir is 39 years old and married with 11 children.  With six of her children in school, Maricir works very hard to provide for them.

Maricir's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Maricir has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maricir has taken a PHP 9,250 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maricir is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and is now requesting a PHP 7,464 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Margarita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña Teresa es una clienta con 61 años de edad, casada y tiene tres hijos. Actualmente vive con su esposo y un hijo. Es una señora trabajadora y con ganas de superarse y mejorar su calidad de vida. Se dedica al comercio hace muchos años, desde que se jubilo luego de trabajar más de 25 años; Le va muy bien, gracias al buen trato y condiciones de pago que le brinda a sus clientes. Tiene un hijo que está en la universidad, debido a esto necesita financiamiento para reforzar su negocio y apoyar a éste en sus estudios. Es la cuarta vez que solicita préstamo y siempre ha mostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. 
Ella inició su actividad con capital propio hace varios años. Ahora cuenta con un patrimonio estable. Sin embargo necesita capital de trabajo para invertir en más mercadería, aumentar su inventario y tener mejores ganancias, aprovechando las temporadas de mucha demanda como día del padre y de la madre. 
La actividad de la clienta es el comercio ambulante de ventas por catálogos, cuenta con buenos clientes que son familiares, vecinos y funcionarios de diferentes empresas. Ahora quiere invertir en lociones, cremas y perfumes finos, debido a éste idea es que solicita financiamiento.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y le gusta mantenerse activa, pero principalmente busca como apoyar más a sus hijos y a su esposo.
texts.en:
Teresa is a client who is 61 years old and married with three children.  Currently, she lives with her husband and one child.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to better herself and improve her quality of life.  She has worked in sales for many years, since her retirement after working more than 25 years.  It is going well for her, thanks to a good contract and payment options that she passes on to her customers.

She has a son in college and, because of this, she needs a loan to reinforce her business and support him in his studies.  This is the fourth time she has requested a loan and she has always been punctual in her payments.  She began this business with her own capital some years ago.  Now she has a stable arrangement.  However, she needs working capital to invest in more merchandise, expand her inventory and earn higher profits, taking advantage of the high demand seasons like Father's Day and Mother's Day.  The client is a mobile vendor who sells through catalogs and counts on good customers who are relatives, neighbors and representatives of different businesses.
