Now she wants to invest in fine lotions, creams and perfumes and this is why she is requesting financial support.  She is an enterprising woman who likes to stay active, but she is principally concerned with supporting her children and husband.

loans.use: to purchase fine lotions, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia, estudio hasta 9º grado de educación básica, esta casada, su pareja trabaja de albañil, tiene dos hijas que viven en su casa y están estudiando, nadie mas vive con ella.

Yesenia trabaja con ganado de repasto, lo ha hecho por mas de 10 años, lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió dedicarse a este negocio para tener un ingreso económico mejor y a la vez para inculcarles a los hijos el trabajo, también se dedica a la venta de ropa en los cantones; así mismo hace pan y sale a venderlo, antes trabajaba como empleada en una venta de ropa, el ganado lo mantiene como a 1 km de su casa y viaja a pie, lo mismo con las otras actividades con la diferencia que en la venta camina como 3 km. 

Se involucra en el negocio el esposo y sus dos hijas. Su horario de trabajo es variado. La cliente comprara ganado de repasto, le mejorara porque tendrá mas ganado y le generara mayor ganancia y por lo tanto tendrá mejor calidad de vida su familia, la necesidad satisfecha es que tiene la oportunidad de comprar de una vez. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando de la mejor manera para obtener logros y en cuanto a su familia que sus hijas estudien y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Yesenia studied until the 9th grade of basic education. She is married and her partner works as a mason. She has two daughters who live with her and go to school, and no one else lives with her. 

Yesenia works with grazing cattle and has done so for more than ten years. She learned this trade from her parents and decided to dedicate herself to this business in order to make a better income and to introduce her children to work. She also works selling clothing in the cantons of her region. In addition, she makes bread and goes out to sell it. Previously, she was an employee at a clothing store. 

Yesenia's livestock are one kilometre away from her home and she travels there on foot. It's the same with her other activities, although for sales she walks about three kilometres. 

Her spouse and their two daughters are both involved in the business. Her work schedule varies. Yesenia will buy grazing cattle, which will improve things because she will have more livestock and this will generate better profits. This will also improve her family's quality of life. The need that the loan will meet is that she will have the opportunity to purchase one time. 

Yesenia's dreams are to continue working in the best way in order to achieve results. As for her family, she hopes that her daughters study and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Silvana Margarita

texts.es: Margarita  es una señora que se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos 10 años atrás,  Margarita vive con sus padres en la casa de ellos, su padre siembra papas y otros productos propios de este sector  y de ahí es que margarita aprendió esta actividad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y pagar de mano de obra a las personas que les contrata  para tener su cultivos sanos de los que espera tener una buena cosecha para salir adelante y  ayudar en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Margarita is a woman who has worked in farming for the last ten years. She lives with her parents in their home; her father plants potatoes and other products of this nature, and it is from him that Margarita learned this occupation. She will invest the loan in purchasing fertilizer and paying for hired help, in order to have healthy plants from those she is expecting, to have a good harvest so she can move ahead, and to help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura: Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene 47 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos, mayores de edad. Su esposo es docente. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace un año estableció  una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su segundo financiamiento, para incrementar su inventario: granos básicos, frutas para elaborar refrescos naturales, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico entre otros productos. Su sueño es establecerle un negocio a su mamá en la comunidad de Saupuka en Waspam.
texts.en: Maura is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is 47, is married, and has three grown-up children.  Her husband is a teacher.  In order to have her own source of income, a year ago she opened a small convenience store.  She is requesting her second loan to increase her inventory of staple grains and pulses, fruit for making natural soft drinks, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, and other products.  Her dream is to start a business for her mother in the Saupuka community in Waspam.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of basic grains and pulses, fruit for making natural soft drinks, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, and other products

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manjacaze Província de Gaza tem 45 anos de idade, casada oficialmente é mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sogra que vive em sua casa.
É negociante  a mais de 5 anos, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa, com este empréstimo pretende ampliar o seu negócio de venda de potes. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku, sendo que os últimos foram aplicados para o mesmo fim.
Futuramente pretende iniciar um outro negocio de criação de frangos para a venda .
texts.en:
Rosalina comes from Manjacaze, province of Gaza. She's 45 years old and officially married. She has five adult children and supports her mother-in-law who lives with her.
She has been a vendor for over five years and earns an income which she uses to pay for household expenses. With this loan she intends to expand her jar selling business. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku, and the previous loans were used for the same purpose.
In the future she intends to start another business raising chickens for selling.

loans.use: to expand her jar selling business.

loans.name: Adriana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Adriana tiene la edad de 57 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos esta bajo su cargo y estudiando la carrera de Derecho en la Universidad. Doña Adriana es una persona alegre, trabajadora, emprendedora, con deseos de superacion y con metas por cumplir. Ella labora para la Alcaldia desde hace 15 años y se desempeña como Secretaria.Los creditos que ella ha obtenido han sido de gran impacto en su vida porque poco a poco le ha realizado las mejoras necesarias a su casa de habitacion. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos se realicen profesionalmente y que puedan ser personas de bien en la sociedad. 
Doña Adriana comprara madera,ya que le cambiara la que actualmente tiene en el techo de una de las habitaciones de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adriana is 57, is married and has three children. One of them is under her care and is studying a degree in Law at the university. Adriana is a happy, hardworking and enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead and goals to achieve. She has been working for the Mayor's office for 15 years and she serves as a secretary.

The loans she's obtained have been of great impact in her life because little by little, she has made necessary improvements to her house. One of her dreams is that her children make themselves into professionals and that they can be good people in society. Adriana is going to buy wood in order to replace the roof on one of her children's houses.

loans.use: to buy wood and pay for labor.

loans.name: Somath

texts.en: Somath is 33 years old. She is a married woman of three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are factory laborers. Both of them can earn approximately $15 per day. She would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike for providing transportation service to clients. This loan will help her husband make more income for the family. In the future, she hopes that she can open a tailoring shop and her children can get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for providing transportation service to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her youngest son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition for her daughter.

loans.name: Liceth Lucero

texts.es: Liceth de 23 años de edad, desde hace dos año, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas; ella todo el tiempo ha trabajado con su familia el tema de negocios, quienes primero tenían una sala de servicios de juegos de billar, a la que agregaron una  discoteca y oferta de bebidas;  finalmente cuando ella creció decidió por su propia cuenta aprovechar este aprendizaje y ganar dinero, por eso creó su negocio. En el que ofrece, hamburguesas, perros calientes, salchipapas, que distribuye directamente entre su clientela a crédito y de contado, desde los  lunes a domingos, dando apertura a las 7 de la mañana y cierre a las 10 de la noche. Impulsando con su persistencia la venta, entre habitantes del barrio donde se encuentra ubicada, Liceth  tiene metas muy claras, como la de ampliarlo y adquirir mas adelante su propio local, tener   una buena dotación en su infraestructura, y  sueña con terminar su carrera de psicología en la Universidad. El mayor desafío  de Liceth son los recursos que no le resultan suficientes, para crecer rápidamente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un carruaje para vender perros, hamburguesas, sopas, con ello planea incrementar sus ventas y ahorrar en el arriendo del que actualmente tiene, haciendo que su inversión en el  negocio, sea exitosa.,
texts.en:
23 year-old Liceth has made a living preparing and selling fast food for the past 2 years.  She grew up working with her family all of the time in their business which started out servicing billiard tables and later added a nightclub and drink sales.  When she grew up, she decided on her own to take advantage of this knowledge and make money, and so she started her own business.
　　

Her shop sells hamburgers, hot dogs, and salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dog) which she distributes directly to her clientele by credit and cash payment, 7 in the morning to 10 at night, 7 days a week.  Her sales are boosted by her persistence, and among the residents of the neighborhood where her business is located, Liceth has very clear goals such as to expand and purchase her own property later on, and for her infrastructure to be valued highly.  She dreams of finishing her psychology degree at the University.


The biggest challenge for Liceth is that the resources available to her are not sufficient for her to grow rapidly.  She is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan that she has applied for through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy a cart to sell hot dogs, hamburgers, and soups.  With this, she plans to increase her sales and save on the lease that she currently has, invest in her business, and be successful.

loans.use: to buy a cart for selling hot dogs and hamburgers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase compost, pest control, herbicides and insecticide.

loans.name: Maregie

texts.en:
Maregie is 34 years old and married with nine children who are all in school. Maregie works very hard to provide for them.

Maregie's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Maregie has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maregie has taken a 9,250 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maregie is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Margarita desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de ropa gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco margarita empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.
Tiene una hija de 11 años por la cual ha tenido que responder durante 10 años sola ya que el padre de la niña las abandonó cuando era apenas una bebe.
Es una mujer emprendedora, amorosa y siempre dispuesta a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.
Se siente muy agradecida con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora.
Ella pide un apoyo económico para comprar una fileteadora y así poder aumentar su volumen de producción al mismo tiempo que ofrece un empleo.
Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Thanks to her mother, Margarita learned to make clothing at a very young age.  All her life, her mother was a clothing manufacturer, and that is how, little by little, Margarita learned and then was able to apply that knowledge. 
Margarita has an 11-year old daughter, who she has taken care of by herself for ten years.  Her daughter's father abandoned them when their daughter was just a baby. 
Margarita is an enterprising and affectionate woman who is always ready to give her customers the best possible service. 
She feels very grateful for everything she has been able to build up up to this point. 
She is requesting financial assistance in order to purchase an overlock machine.  The machine will allow her to increase her production volume and also offer employment. 
Margarita has a lot of plans for her business and still dreams of having a much bigger workshop.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock machine.

loans.name: Liselena

texts.es: Liselena una mujer humilde la cual a raíz de sus condiciones económicas y de lo numero que es su familia ha buscado en base a su experiencia alternativas para ganar un dinero que le permita colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos de su familia pues a pesar que en el sector que viven es igualmente muy humilde busca la manera de brindarle a su familia algo mejor pues no basta solo con tener lo suficiente una madre siempre busca lo mejor para sus hijos. Gracias a la experiencia obtenido trabajando como ayudante de un chef, ha logrado montar un negocio donde vende víveres y abarrotes, ofrece principalmente desayunos y en busca de ampliar su negocio cumplir metas, mejorar servicio y pensando en que sus hijos cada día están creciendo y las demandas estudiantiles que van desde necesidades tecnológicas, alimenticias e incluso deportivas quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de víveres y abarrotes ya que su tienda como tal carece de muchos productos que diariamente le son solicitados y con la ayuda de este crédito traerá productos para lograr la fidelización de varios clientes que recurren a otra tienda.
texts.en:
Liselena is a humble woman who, as a result of her economic condition and number of family members, has searched based on her experience for an alternate way to earn an income that will allow her to help her husband with family expenses. Although the sector that they live in is also very humble, she looks for a way to give her family something better because it is not enough just to have what is sufficient -- a mother always looks for the best for her children. 

Thanks to the experience that she attained working as a chef's assistant, she has managed to set up a business where she sells food supplies and groceries. She primarily offers breakfast. Looking to expand her business, achieve her goals, and improve her service, and thinking that every day her children are growing and educational demands, which extend from technology, food, and even sport necessities, are increasing, she is requesting a loan to buy food supplies and groceries. As is, her store lacks many products that are requested on a daily basis. With the help of this loan, she will buy these products to obtain the loyalty of various customers who go to other shops.

loans.use: to buy groceries and food supplies with which she will obtain the loyalty of various customers who go to other shops.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Nan is 57 years old. She is a married woman with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband, who is with her in the photo, are farmers, who earn approximately $4 per day. All of her children are employed as factory labors and earn approximately $24 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $600 in order to purchase cows for plowing. This loan will help her to do farming. In the future, she hopes that she can purchase more cows and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cows for plowing.

loans.name: Meakra

texts.en: Meakra is 30-years-old. He is a married father of two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker and his wife who is with him in the photo is a garment factory laborer. Both of them can earn approximately $11 per day. Now, he would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase cows to breed and to renovate his house. In the future, he hopes that he can build a gate and their children can get bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase cows to breed and to resell.

loans.name: Aivale

texts.en: Aivale is a 44-year-old woman with five children. She runs a small retail shop and has been operating for over a year now. Because she wants to maintain the operation of her business and also have a variety of stock sold there, she has just joined SPBD seeking access for financial assistance. She will use this money to purchase sugar, rice, flour, salt, onions, containers, scales, shopping bags, noodles, curry, coffee, tea bags, lollies and chewing gum to stock her shop. She hopes that she will be able to save a lot of profit from her business so that she could help out in improving their family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, flour, salt, onions, containers, scales, shopping bags, noodles, curry, coffee, tea bags, lollies and chewing gum

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt: A Sr Raquel vive na casa propria com seus 3 filhos e um sobrinho todos na sua responsabilidade e  vão a escola,a dona Raquel perdeu o seu esposo a 5 anose viu se obrigada a ter que batalhar na vida para poder sustentar seus filhos, alugou sua casa  e foi viver numa dependencia para poder ter dinheiro para começar com pequenos negocios,hoje vive ja numa outra casa que construiu com o fruto do seu negocio que é da venda de roupas usadas,agora construiu uma baraca onde vende produtos diversos da primeira necessidade, mas pela maoir procura dos seus serviços  viu se obrigada a solicitar um emprestimo na Hluvuku para comprar farrinha de milho,arroz e açucar,o seu maior sonho é tornar se uma comerciante de renome e expandir o mesmo.o maior desafio é ter fundo suficiente para apetrechar a sua barraca
texts.en: Raquel lives with her three children and a nephew in a house that she owns. Her children and nephew are all under her care and attend school. Raquel lost her husband five years ago and found herself having to work hard to support her children. She rented out her house and went to live in a room so she could save money to start small businesses. She currently lives in another house that she built with the profits from her business, which is selling used clothing. She has now built a booth where she sells various products that are household staples. However, since her services are in high demand, she felt compelled to request a loan from Hluvuku so she can purchase cornflour, rice and sugar. Her biggest dream is to become a well-known vendor and expand her business. Her biggest challenge is not having enough funds to stock her booth.

loans.use: to purchase cornflour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school tuition for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, 41 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Misamis Occidental. Emma owns and operates a retail business located in her village. She has been in this business for over thirteen years and earns well to sustain the family's needs. 

Emma joined GDMPC in 2013, and now she has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory and working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nhóm 07 Tân Cầu 1 Xã Tân Khang Group

texts.en:
Yên works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Yên is 40 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 07 Tân Cầu 1 Xã Tân Khang solidarity group, which consists of three members.  In 2009, Yên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Yên hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 48 years old, is married and has five children. With two children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them. Nenita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nenita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Nenita has taken a PHP 5828 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials and to pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. Nenita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fish vending business and is now requesting a PHP 8357.14 housing loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Melba will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Melba would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luz Fanny

texts.es: Luz una aguerrida, fuerte y comprometida mujer de 49 años de edad, la cual ha tenido que rebuscar de una u otra manera la comida para su familia conformada por sus dos hijos. Ya que se separó de su esposo le ha tocado un trabajo doble donde se multiplica ejerciendo oficios caseros y de empresaria pero gracias a su pequeña tienda de fabricación de calzado y teñido de ropa y gracias a sus habilidades y destrezas ha logrado fidelizar muchos clientes  y ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos para ensanblar de sandalias  y calzado pues por su volumen de clientes y rotación de productos es grande. Con la ayuda de este crédito lograra tener buen capital para mudarse de sector o abrir otro punto de venta puesto que el actual está cerca de un rio y cuando hay fuertes aguaceros sufre inundaciones.
texts.en:
Luz is a brave, strong and committed woman who is 49 years old who, one way or another, has had to find food for her family which is made up of two children. Since she separated from her husband she has had to work twice as hard, multitasking work at home and in her business but thanks to her small shoe-making and clothes-dying shop and thanks to her abilities and skills she has managed to foster loyalty in many customers.  

Now she sees the need to request a loan to purchase supplies to assemble sandals and shoes because of the large volume of customers and rotation of products.  With the help of this loan she will manage to have a good amount of capital to move to a different area or to open another sales location as the current one is close to a river and when there are strong downpours she experiences flooding.

loans.use: to buy supplies for assembling sandals and shoes.

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Mario es un enérgico y humilde campesino, con mente emprendedora y corazón noble.
El se ha dedicado a los trabajos del campo desde hace unos 12 años, tiene actualmente cultivos de flores y hortensias los cuales atiende todos los días con la esperanza de obtener buenas cosechas y tener unos ingresos más estables para su familia.
Siempre está pensando en progresar y sacar a sus hijos adelante, por eso está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios que le permitan tener uso cultivos mucho más sanos y productivos. Esto impactara positivamente sus ventas ya que tendrá unos productos de mejor calidad.
Su mayor desafío hasta ahora es el clima que en muchas ocasiones se pone difícil y hace que muchos de sus procesos de cultivo se detengan.
texts.en:
Mario is an energetic and humble farmer, with an enterprising mind and a noble heart. He has been devoted to farming for 12 years.  Currently he cultivates flowers and hydrangeas, tending them every day with the hope of obtaining good harvests, and having a more stable income for his family.

He is always thinking of making progress and raising his children, and this is why he is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies that will allow him to have much healthier and productive cultivations. This will have a positive impact on his sales, as he will have better quality products.
 
His biggest challenge is the climate, which can be harsh on many occasions, causing his cultivation processes to stop.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es: Luis es un joven casado  tiene 2 hijos, uno de 5 años que asiste a la escuela y otro de 4 meses, Luis  vive arrendando y se dedica a la venta de verduras en una carretilla recorriendo las calles de la cuidad  juntamente con su esposa, también se dedica a trabajar en la cuadrilla, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de verduras, Luis aspira aumentar y variar su mercadería para poner un puesto de verduras en el mercado.
texts.en: Luis is a young, married man with two children. One of them is five years old and attends school, and the other is four months old. Luis lives in a rental property and works selling vegetables by taking a wheelbarrow through the streets of the city with his wife. He also works on a maintenance crew, and he will invest the money in buying vegetables. Luis hopes to increase and vary his merchandise so that he can have a vegetable stand in the market.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean is 33 years old. He is a married man with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. His wife and children are with him in the photo. He is a vet and his wife is a garment factory laborer. Both of them earn approximately $11 per day. Now, he would like to apply for a loan of $1,000 to purchase cows for plowing. This loan will help him generate more income for his family. In the future, he would like to breed cows and pigs. He hopes that he can build a gate to protect those cows and pigs and his children can get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To purchase cows for plowing

loans.name: Koemsal

texts.en: Koemsal is 53 years old. She is a widow with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her daughter, who is with her in the photo, is a factory worker. Both of them can earn approximately $8 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $750 to purchase timbers and roofing zinc sheets to renovate her house. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more cows to breed.

loans.use: To purchase timbers and roofing zinc sheets to renovate her house

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Mr. Ulziijargal, 24 years old, is a professional photographer. He lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is hardworking and eager for his bright future. He has a plot of land and is building a house on it. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to buy building materials and complete the mansard (roof) of his house, which will bring comfort and convenience to the four members of his family.

loans.use: to buy qualitative building materials

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt: A Celina é casada e mãe de 5 filhos  onde somente 4 é que vão a escola, o marido é aposentado,pelas dificuldades da vida e devido  ao valor da pensão que é baixa do esposo a Sr Celina sentiu se obrigada a fazer  negocio,vai para o norte do pais comprar portas para vir revender em alguns bairros urbanos  em expansão na cidade de Maputo para ajudar o marido nas despesas  de casa,hoje ela tem um negocio evoluido e nunca tem falta de clientes.com o valor do emprestimo vai fazer comprar cimento e areia grossa para fazer acabamentos da sua casa.O seu maior sonho é tornar melhor cliente da Hluvuku e conseguir outros emprestimos para  abrir um negocio de criação de frangos de abate para garantir a formação academica dos seus filhos.O seu maior desafio é a dificil transitabilidade no centro do pais devido tensão politica.
texts.en: Celina is married and has five children, four of whom attend school. Her husband is retired. Due to life's difficulties and the low amount of her husband's retirement pension, Celina found herself having to start a business. She travels to the north of the country and buys doors for re-selling back in Maputo, in some urban areas that are currently expanding. That way she helps her husband with their household expenses. Nowadays she has a well-developed business and never fails to get customers. With the amount of the loan she'll purchase cement and coarse sand in order to do finishing work on her house. Her biggest dream is to become Hluvuku's best client and get other loans so that she can start a business raising broiler chickens. That way she will ensure her children's education. Her biggest challenge is how difficult it is to get to the central area of the country because of political tension.

loans.use: to purchase cement and sand in order to do finishing work on her house.

loans.name: Nhóm01 Thôn Cao Nhuận Xã Vạn Thiện Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yến  works in the agriculture business, raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Yến is 45 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn Cao Nhuận Xã Vạn Thiện solidarity group, which consists of three members. In 2001, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Yến  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Yến hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 40 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married, has no children yet but is still hoping to have one. 

Elma has had a little sari-sari store in their home for three years already. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable products for retail.

Elma has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, bags, creams, cosmetics, and perfumes

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 45 años de edad, ella es soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 viven con ella en una casa prestada, Marina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y comenta que le va bien en esta actividad ya que ella vive en el campo y es adecuado criar animales, también se dedica a trabajar al jornal en trabajos de agricultura, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar sus ingresos y para bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Marina is 45 years old and single with six children, four of whom live with her in a borrowed house. Marina works raising livestock and says that she is doing well in this occupation since she lives in the country and it is good for raising animals. Marina also works every day in farming, and she will invest the loan in buying pigs in order to improve her earnings, and for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Jomaira Estefania

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad Estefanía es madre soltera, su hijo tienen 3 años, Estefanía vive con sus padres en el campo y  se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, Estefanía se dedica a la crianza de  chanchos y al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Estefanía va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio y sacar sola adelante a su hijo ya que dice que ella es padre y madre para su niño le va a educar y alimentar lo mejor que pueda.
texts.en:
At 21 years old Estefanía is the single mother of a 3-year-old boy. Estefanía lives with her parents in the countryside. She makes a living by farming and raising small livestock. Estefanía raises pigs and works as a day laborer on a farm. 

Estefanía is going to invest this loan to buy pigs in order to expand her business and move forward with her son because, as she says, she is both father and mother for her child and she is going to feed and educate him the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, 40 years, is a married woman with three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalie's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Rosalie is taking out a PHP 9893 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Rosalie has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 53 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Sonia's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Sonia has restarted her fish vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Sonia has taken a PHP 7,350 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Sonia is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима местная жительница района Кубадиён. Она благоразумная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Халима имеет двух сыновей, которым по 20 и 23 года, и 15-летнюю дочь. Ее муж дехканин и животновод. Халима у мужа научилась ремеслу животноводства. Вот уже 5 лет как Халима при дворе своего дома разводит скотов. Сейчас в ее скотном дворе считанное количество овец и она хочет увеличить их поголовье. С такой целью она запрашивает кредит, который ей очень нужен.
texts.en: Halima lives in the Qubadiyon region. She is a sensible and hard-working woman, 49 years of age. Halima has two children, who are 20 and 23 years old, and a 15-year old daughter. Her husband is a farmer and raises livestock. Halima learned from her husband how to raise livestock. For five years she has been raising livestock in her backyard. At present she has only a small number of sheep, and she would like to increase their headcount. This is why she is applying for this loan, which she truly needs.

loans.use: to buy a couple of sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Alberto Alonso

texts.es: Don Alberto tiene 54 años de edad, trabaja como taxista. Es casado, y tiene 6 hijos. Su esposa es ama de casa y le apoya con la administración del hogar. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad, y dos se encuentra viviendo con él. El crédito solicitado será para construir un cuarto de habitación para uno de sus hijos, con el crédito anterior cambio parte del techo de su vivienda, lo que le está ayudando con la entrada del invierno. Los créditos solicitados han sido para mejorar su vivienda, y espera poder seguir haciéndolo hasta lograr ver su casa en mejores condiciones. Con el préstamo comprará materiales de construcción como bloque, hierro, perlines, arena, zinc.
texts.en:
Don Alberto is 54 years old and works as a taxi driver. He is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker and helps with managing the household. All of his children are adults, but two are still living with him.

The loan he is requesting will be used to build a room for one of his children. His previous loan was used to replace a portion of the roof on his home, which was helpful during the start of the winter season. Alberto’s previous loans have been used for home improvements and he hopes to continue receiving them so that his house will be in better condition. This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as blocks, iron, crossbeams, sand, and zinc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a room for one of his children.

loans.name: Ahlonkoba

texts.fr: En 2006, Ahlonkoba  a débuté son activité. Elle est revendeuse de divers en friperies. Depuis son dernier prêt, Ahlonkoba âgée de 57 ans a commencé par diversifier ses articles. A part les habits et les sacs, elle vend aussi des tapis, des serviettes et des rideaux en friperies. Avec deux enfants en charge, elle vit avec son conjoint. Ahlonkoba espère accroitre ses revenus pour  améliorer les conditions de vie. Ce microcrédit de 400000FCFA  lui permettra de s approvisionner. Son souhait pour l avenir est de voir grandir son commerce.
texts.en: Ahlonkoba launched her business in 2006. She sells miscellaneous used items. Since the time of her last loan, Ahlonkoba, who is 57 years old, began to diversify her merchandise. In addition to clothing and bags, she also sells used rugs, towels and curtains. She lives with her husband and has two dependent children. Ahlonkoba hopes to increase her revenues and improve her living conditions. This microloan of 400,000 West African francs will allow her to restock her merchandise. Her goal for the future is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy linens, rugs, towels and curtains.

loans.name: Maria Rubiela

texts.es:
A pesar de su avanzada edad, la señora Maria nunca ha dejado de trabajar y luchar por sus hijos que aunque ya la mayoría son mayores de edad, su amor de madre no le permite separarse de ellos y dejar de estar pendiente a lo que necesiten.
Ella es una laboriosa productora agropecuaria con amplia experiencia en el manejo de diferentes cultivos y en la crianza de animales. Tiene actualmente un pequeño terreno en el que ha logrado levantar cultivos de papa y frijol, adicionalmente tiene ganado lechero y todo lo que produce su finca lo vende y es así como obtiene los recursos para su supervivencia.
Su mayor desafío es su estado de salud, pero no es impedimento para verse siempre alegre atendiendo y trabajando en sus tierras.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca lechera que le permita aumentar su producción láctea.
El crédito le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio dándole un impulso significativo y permitiéndole gozar de ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Despite her advanced age, Maria has never stopped working and fighting for her children.  Even though the majority of them are now adults, her maternal love doesn't allow her to separate herself from them and leave them lacking what they need.


She is a hard-working agricultural producer with ample experience in the handling of different crops and animal husbandry.  Currently, she has a small piece of land which she has managed to plant potatoes and beans on, and she also has a dairy cow.  She sells everything that she produces and that is how she gets the resources that she needs to survive.  

Her biggest challenge has been the state of her health, but it doesn't prevent her from always happily caring for and working her land.  She is asking for a loan to invest in a milk cow which will allow her to increase her dairy production.  This loan will give her an opportunity to add capital to her business, giving it a large boost and allowing her to enjoy more stable profits.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has been a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City for 15 years and has four children. She runs a small Sari-sari store in order to earn additional income and to be able to help her husband in providing for the needs of the family. So, in order for her to find additional capital for her business, she became a member of Paglaum MPC and applied for a loan amounting to PHP 11,000. With this amount, she believes that it can help her a lot to continue the operation of her Sari-sari store.

loans.use: to pay for additional groceries for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Sinorn

texts.en:
Sinorn is 33 years old and married with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been breeding cows since 2002 and her husband has carried dirt to sell since 1980. Both of them can earn approximately $7 per day. One child is employed and earns approximately $4 per day.

Sinorn would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to purchase land to build a house. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more cows to breed and her three children can get their high school diplomas.

loans.use: To purchase land to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a computer for his son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah helps her husband make a living. Her husband works, and Leah sells fruit in town and also provides manicure and pedicure services, earning well for the family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the services. 

Leah took a new loan recently to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services, and to buy additional fruit to sell in order to earn more income.

She hopes to gain more revenue from all of her business activities, and plans to save a portion of her income to repair their own house for a better living.

loans.use: to buy additional tools for providing manicure and pedicure services and buy additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn helps her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She also sells fish at the market. For the last five years in their business, Marilyn has been earning well, and has been able to provide for the needs of her three children. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying fishing nets. Marilyn plans to improve her business by acquiring a new fishing boat from her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 41 years old and has four children. She is married to Mario, who helps to provide for the needs of the family. She operates a rug-making business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. In addition to this, she also operates her small variety store which serves as an additional source for her.

She mainly offers rugs, from the round palm sized ones to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1500 in sales every week.

Rosemarie is taking out a PHP 20,000 loan assistance to buy supplies and other materials needed in her business. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials like fabric, thread and other items which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she dreams of managing and supervising her own people. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is a hard working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school. She manages a direct-selling business and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and Royale.  Customer orders are bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer price is lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

Ophelia is taking out a 15,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products which are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants to expand her business and start up another possible business. She dreams of success and good health for family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics to sell  in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to replace her home lost in a  typhoon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her typhoon-damaged home.

loans.name: Karen Andrea

texts.es:
Karen es una joven mujer amante del trabajo y siempre con su mirada al frente para enfrentar todos los obstáculos que se presenten.
Ella trabaja en una marquetería que era propiedad de su padre, ya que este no pudo continuar con su manejo a causa de quebrantos de salud, Karen decidió tomar las riendas e invertir unos pocos ahorros que tenía en el negocio.
Se siente orgullosa al ver que gracias a su intervención el negocio no decayó y por el contrario fue tomando un poco mas de fuerza. El negocio consiste en un taller de marquetería en el cual se hacen trabajos de arreglo de cuadros, fabricación de parqués, espejos, entre otros. Ella siempre estuvo familiarizada al negocio y por eso es que se siente tan segura frente a él.
Ella solicita un préstamo puesto que quiere impulsar su actividad y darle una inyección de capital comprando materiales como madera vidrio y pegantes.
Este crédito le dará una gran posibilidad de explorar nuevos mercados y obtener nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman who loves her work and always has her gaze set ahead to confront any obstacles that present themselves. She works in a marquetry shop that used to be owned by her father. He was not able to continue running it due to health problems. Karen decided to take the reins and invest the little savings she had in the business. She is proud to see that thanks to her intervention, the business did not decline and, on the contrary, was strengthened. The business consists of a marquetry workshop which repairs boxes an makes mirrors, board games, and other items. Karen was always familiar with the business because it was always in front of her. 

She is requesting this loan because she wants to give her work a push by injecting capital: buying materials such as wood, glass, and adhesives. This loan will give her a great possibility to explore new markets and obtain new customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood, glass, and adhesives.

loans.name: Bat-Ulzii

texts.en:
Bat-Ulzii, 37, drives a taxi around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been in business since 2009. 

Bat-Ulzii is living in a friend's house for two years. His friend has given him permission to live there and take care of his land and the house over the years. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to improve his living environment and renovate the house.

loans.use: to improve the living environment and renovate the house.

loans.name: Bulgan

texts.en:
Bulgan is 32 years old and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with her 9-year-old son and parents. Her parents are over 60 years old and retired. She works as a knitter at the cashmere factory and is the only person who earns an income in the family. 

Bulgan is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrigs) to buy sand, cement, batten, balk and other building materials to complete her house. When construction is complete, her family will live in warmth and comfort, and she can work without worrying.

loans.use: to buy building materials and complete the construction of her house.

loans.name: Pampila

texts.en: Pampila, 59 years old, is a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City and has seven children. Together with her husband, they strive hard to provide the needs of the family. Since most of her children are already married and have separate lives, she decided to be an operator of a motorcycle transport business. And since she is the one who is responsible for the maintenance of the motorcycle, the renewal of the motor franchise, and for buying motor spare parts, she decided to apply for a loan from Pagalum MPC in the amount of PHP 6,000. With this, she can continue operating the motorcycle for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of the motor franchise and to buy motor spare parts.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a resident of Dipolog City. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC for seven years. Together with her husband, they raise their three children in the best way that they can. Edna is the breadwinner of the family since her husband is now suffering from sickness.  In order for her to find additional capital, she applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC for PHP 11,000 to buy piglets for her "Hog Raising" business. Edna believes that with the help of Paglaum MPC, she can give a better future to her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Mary Lisa

texts.en:
Mary Lisa is 61 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Misamis Occidental. To earn a living she operates a banana farm, while her husband works as a carpenter. For ten years growing and selling bananas, she was able to provide for the needs of her family. 

To improve her farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her banana production.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her banana production

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is 49 years old, married, with two children. She lives in  Misamis Occidental. To earn a living, she owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been in her business for 10 years, and earns well to sustain their living. 

She recently joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC), and now she has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn, 20 years old, lives with her parents. She wants to finish her studies and to become successful in her career. 

She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition so that she can concentrate on her studies without worrying about her fees. 

If she graduates from the university successfully, it will be great help for the family. Her parents are hardworking individuals who are very caring to their children.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees

loans.name: Neolito

texts.en:
Neolito owns and operates a cocoa farm in the local community to earn a living. He has been in business for more than nine years and earns a good income to sustain their needs. 

Neolito also raises pigs to sell in town. He would like a loan to purchase feeding supplies to boost his pigs' growth. His dream is to have a better future. He has successfully repaid his previous loan that was used for fertilizer.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for his pigs.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. At the age of 42, she manages the household while operating the business with the help of her husband. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jinky is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers and sell it by the container (5 gallons per container) at a profit. She earns additional income by selling breakfast food items. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jinky hopes for her business to continue growing and flourishing. She dreams for her family to have a sustainable and healthy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of mineral water to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hard working entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. She is 47 years old, and has three children who are currently in school. Rodrigo, her husband, works as a driver. She oversees the operation of their Jeepney unit, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which she is paid *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,500 every day.

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippine.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Cocepcion is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her Jeepney unit. She will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she wants another Jeepney unit to be used for their business operation. She hopes that her children will be able to complete their studies.

She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is 42 years old and lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Marat graduated from Yerevan State Agricultural Institute and he is an economist. Now he works at the Kapan city post office as a director of that post office. Marat is married and he has a nice, happy family. His wife works at the kindergarten and their two children are school-aged. Marat was born in the village of Kaghnut in the same region. Although Marat does not live in this village now, he has a nice farm here. This is his father’s house and Marat spends all his free time here taking care of his beehives and organizing vegetable cultivation such as potato and beans. As he says, his cute farm demands great care and effort, but it in its turn brings some income and solves some part of his family’s financial problems. Specifically, he has success in honey production. He has loyal customers who buy honey only from his farm.

Marat is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy more beehives, wax papers, frames and special uniforms, which he greatly needs during his bee keeping activities.

loans.use: to buy more beehives, wax papers, frames and special uniforms

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. 

Carmelita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Carmelita has been raising livestock for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Yuly Elena

texts.es: Cuando se es un vendedor de productos como calzado, jeans, electrodomésticos, y se vende puerta a puerta y se ofrece servicios de pago por cuotas se corren muchos riesgos y el más reiterado es el incumplimiento en los pagos y es por esta razón que la economía de un vendedor es muy variable y debe tener un ahorro para aguantar los tiempos de crisis situaciones como esta son las que enfrenta La señora Yuly una mujer de 47 años de edad que vive sola y no tiene hijos y que desempeña esta actividad hace dos años, en vista de la variedad de problemas que presenta este negocio solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía como ropa, zapatos y electrodomésticos ya que quiere formalizar sus ventas en un local comercial para evitar cansancio y fatiga próxima solo quiere ejercer su profesión tranquila para poder pensar en una pareja con la cual compartir varias experiencia que por su trabajo no ha podido tener,
texts.en:
When one is a salesperson, selling products such as footwear, jeans, and household appliances door to door, and offering services such as paying over time, there are many risks; the one most reiterated being defaults on payments.  This is the reason that a salesperson has a very variable financial situation, and should have some savings in order to weather crisis periods such as those that Señora Yuly is facing. She is 47 years old, she lives alone, and she does not have children.

She has been engaged in this occupation for two years. Because of the variety of problems that this business presents, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and household appliances, as she wants to formalize her sales in a shop, in order to prevent exhaustion and fatigue.  

She wants only to exercise her profession peacefully, so that she will be able to think about having a partner with whom she could share various experiences that she has not been able to have because of her work.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as shoes, clothing, and household appliances, in order to sell them in a shop instead of door to door.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Dolores works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  

Dolores is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her sewing machine for her tailoring business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, school supplies and other groceries. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora María es una confeccionista la cual cuenta con una larga trayectoria de 13 años en el mercado ofreciendo sus servicios a empresas de ropa y cualquiera que llegue solicitando sus servicios, actualmente cuenta con una persona la cual trabaja a meta cumplida y con la que ha progresado a pequeños pero firmes pasos, ya debido a la implementación de tecnología y la fuerte competencia que se evidencia en estos tiempos y la cual la empresa le entrega la mercancía al proveedor que le realice el trabajo en un menor tiempo, María se ve en la obligación de invertir en su negocio es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para la compra de repuestos y una plancha industrial ya que esta inversión le traerá muchos beneficios respecto al tiempo de producción aspirando a que con estas nuevas herramientas de trabajo agilice sus trabajos para tener un mayor volumen de clientes
texts.en:
Maria is a seamstress who counts on a long stint of 13 years in the market offering her services to clothing companies and to whoever requests her services. Currently she relies on one person who works on set project goals and with whom she has progressed in small yet firm steps. 

Given the implementation of technology and the strong competition evident in companies giving the merchandise to the provider who can complete a task in the least amount of time, Maria feels obligated to invest in her business. For these reasons she requests a loan to buy supplies and an industrial iron. This investment will bring many benefits with respect to production times. She hopes that the new work tools will expedite her jobs to bring a greater volume of clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies and an industiral iron to improve her turnaround times.

loans.name: Edison Mauricio

texts.es: Edison es un joven soltero de 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres en el campo donde se dan buenos cultivos de los productos que son propios de esta localidad asi como cebolla y papas, este joven responsable se dedica también a trabajar en una fábrica de productos lácteos, para ayudarse en sus gastos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para mantener en buen estado sus cultivos, su aspiración es seguir luchando para tener un buen futuro.
texts.en: Edison is a single young man, age 21. He lives with his parents in the country, where they have good plantings of crops that are local to this region like onions and potatoes. This responsible young man also works in a dairy to help with the expenses. He will invest the loan in buying fertilizer and fungicides to keep his plants in good condition. His goal is to continue working to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Byron

texts.es: Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad, el vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, Carlos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace un año atrás  y también se dedica a la crianza de terneros, dice que trabaja juntamente con su padre, Carlos tiene un hijo de 4 años que aunque no vive con el si se hace responsable de todo lo que le hace falta a su hijo que está asistiendo a la escuela, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de fungicidas y pagar de mano de obra a las personas que le ayudan a trabajar para tener sus cultivos sanos, lo que Carlos espera de esta cosecha es que se le vaya muy bien para incrementar sus sembríos y seguir educando a sus hijo.
texts.en: Carlos is a 22-year-old young man who lives with his parents and siblings. He has worked in agriculture for one year and he also raises calves; he says that he works together with his father. Carlos has a four-year-old son and, even though he doesn't live with him, he is responsible for everything he needs because he is going to school. He will invest the loan in buying fungicides, and paying for labor from the people who help him to grow healthy plants. What Carlos hopes for from this harvest is that it does well so he can expand his fields and continue to educate his son.

loans.use: to pay for manual labor and fungicides.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas is a 28-year-old married man from Khan Younis. He is a father of two kids (a son and a daughter). He has a small grocery store in the city where he sells regular grocery products. He would like to improve his store and expand it. 

Firas took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more items for his grocery store like wheat, oil and rice. By taking this loan, Firas will be able to improve his store and increase the sales. 

Firas appears in the photo in his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more items for his grocery store like wheat, oil and rice

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios raises pigs, work that she has done since she was very young. Her father taught her this work since it was the only way they had to move the family forward in addition to farming. She gets up early and has to go to the farm where she has her crops. She took responsibility for raising her pigs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy feeding supplies. In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now.  She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is happy and hopeful that his second deal with Kiva will also be as nice and useful for his family as the first one.  He asked for his previous loan in order to buy mannequins to demonstrate his stall products and some new clothes to renew his collection and as he says this loan greatly developed his trading business in which he is still engaged.

Petros lives in Vnadzor city in the Lori region. He has two children, a daughter and a son.  Petros' son is a student at the Polytechnic Institute of Vanadzor branch, the faculty of Informatics and Architecture. The problem is that his son studies at the paid division and at this moment Petros does not have enough money to pay for his second semester.

He asks for this loan in order to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the last semester.

loans.use: to pay for his son’s tuition fee for the last semester

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is in her 50's, and eagerly wants to succeed with the business she has now. Thelma shares that her childhood was not easy because her father died when she was very young. Only her mother worked to provide for their needs. 

Now that she has her own family, Thelma is doing her best to provide the easiest living for her children. She doesn’t want them to experience what she has.

Thelma manages her banana dealer business. She buys bananas in different far-flung barangays and import them. She has had this business for 27 years; she manages the business and hopes for continued growth. Thelma also operates a retailing business selling grocery items in their village. 

Thelma is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy bulk groceries and cases of beverages. She will also use her loan to buy bananas to import. 

She always prays for their safety in travelling to sell bananas, so that she can earn more profits for the education of her four children.

loans.use: to buy bulk groceries and cases of beverages.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.es:
Jean Paul vive a las afueras de Lima en la localidad de Huachipa junto a su madre y hermanos menores. El se levanta muy temprano y viaja 3 horas en bus todos los días para llegar a tiempo a sus clases. 
Su madre a tenido que ser a su vez padre para el y sus hermanos ya que su padre se separo de ella hace un tiempo y vive actualmente en Pucallpa, selva peruana, y apenas envía dinero para ayudar en el hogar, ella vino de Cajamarca, sierra peruana, a la capital en busca de un mejor porvenir y actualmente labora de obrero en una empresa ganando el salario mínimo, por lo que pronto Jean Paul tendrá que abandonar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos para poder continuar de no contar con la ayuda de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Jean Paul sueña con sacar adelante a su madre y hermanos menores pero antes debe de terminar su carrera técnica y comenzar a trabajar, sueño que cree firmemente poder alcanzar gracias al apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva, por lo cual les agradece de antemano toda la ayuda que le pueden brindar.
El desea convertirse en un gran profesional y hombre de bien para que su madre se sienta orgullosa, ademas de ser ejemplo a seguir para sus pequeños hermanos a quienes ayudara para que sigan por el buen camino que el esta recorriendo.
texts.en:
Jean Paul lives in the outskirts of Lima, in the Huachipa neighborhood, with his mother and younger siblings.  He gets up very early and travels 3 hours by bus to make it to his classes on time. 

Jean Paul's mother has had to be mother and father to him and his siblings, as his father separated from her some time ago.  His father currently lives in Pucallpa, in the Peruvian jungle. Jean Paul's mother came from Cajamarca, in the Peruvian sierra, to the capital to look for a better future.  She currently works as a laborer for a company, where she earns minimum wage.  Jean Paul would soon have to abandon his studies due to a lack of funds if it weren't for the help of the Kiva lenders.

Jean Paul dreams of getting his mother and his younger siblings ahead.  But first he needs to finish his technical studies and start working.  He firmly believes that he will be able to realize his dream, thanks to the help of the Kiva lenders.  He thanks them in advance for all the help they may offer. 

Jean Paul hopes to become a great professional and a man of means so that his mother can feel proud of him.  In addition, he wants to be an example for his younger siblings to follow.  He will help them to follow the good path that he, himself, is traveling.

loans.use: to pay for a technical degree to become a mechanic technician

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food supplies, beer, and soda and to repair her two washing machines

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is married with four children.  She is 65-years-old and lives in Mialen Clarin, Philippines.

Paz is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional farming equipment.

Paz has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Paz hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional farming equipment

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en: Mrs. Oyunchimeg, 64-years-old, lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. She and her husband have retired from work and get a state pension. She had worked as a weaver at a cashmere factory for more than thirty years. She is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD to buy a washing machine and refrigerator for household use as the former ones became out of service. A new fully automated washing machine and refrigerator will save time and ease her work.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and refrigerator
